title: From the spiritual centre to beggars and cheaters
review: I always enjoyed Pushkar bevor. But it changed a lot. Some people on the right side close to the steps shouted at one Indien friend who was with us without any reason. They tried to deny him the entrance. They are only interested in making money by caring of your shoes. They are not caring about what is inside the temple. It’s a shame for Pushkar and for all the honest Brahmans that are living there.

title: Only Temple in the world
review: Brahma temple in Pushkar is the only temple of Brahma ji in the whole world. The temple closes from 1.30 in the afternoon to 3.00 o clock in the afternoon. Rest it is open can be visited any time. The temple is unique one should definitely visit.

title: Only great if you are Hindu
review: The sole reason to see this temple is the only image of Lord Brahma. Temple is small, nothing different from what you can see all over India, except for the one image.

title: Coulda, woulda, shoulda...but......
review: Underwhelming to say the least!!

title: Visit to Brahmaji Temple, Pushkar
review: Brahmaji Temple is one of its kind the whole world and located in Pushkar, being a famous landmark.

title: Enjoyed witnessing the true believers
review: Pushkar has lots of atmosphere including The Lake and this Temple. As has been mentioned by other reviewers its a famous temple and an important pilgrimage centre for Hindus. The lake is believed to be the spot where the lotus flower thrown by Brahma (Creator of the Hindu Trinity) landed.

title: Only one
review: This is the only Temple Dedicated to Brahma in India so it is a very important pilgrimage for many. At the entrance rigorous check and no big bags allowed. No she’s either. Short visit, not of great interest architectural.

title: Only temple in India and was amazing
review: It was an amazing experience. Although there was a lot of rush and a lot of people trying to take you for a ride by offering special benefits (BEWARE!!!) but the temple is serene and extremely peaceful. Must visit

title: Beware of cheaters
review: Beware of the cheaters surrounding this temple. Nice people who just want to show you around and talk a bit about the temple will end up asking for ridiculous amounts of money.

title: Unique place
review: If you are interested in the methodology of the religion you are really entering the beginning of everything. I really enjoyed the atmosphere.

title: Holy place
review: Number of times we have visited Brahma Temple and all the times we get fresh look after offering prayer . Such a nice place for worship.

title: READ IT- Be careful of the "official" scam of  flowers
review: We just entered inside the temple and one person inside approached us. He was an oficial guide from the temple and he began to explain about the temple and after a while, he was demanding that we had to do some rituals with flowers, saying that is the respectful way of visiting the temple.

title: Scam in the name of Lord Brahma
review: The temple as such is a good visit. However, we first encounter a set of scammers before visiting the temple. As you approach the pushkar lake, a so called official govt guide will ask you to make nominal Rs 31 payment for puja vidhi. Out of trust on lord we oblige and then the cheating begins. A so called pandit arrives, with a thali of some old flowers and coconut and does small puja vidhi uttering crap mantras and all the while pushing you to make donation for anna daan ( food service charity). Per day cost being 2100 he would say. We as god loving peope think that it is good cause and agree. But then the pandit will make you feel inferior if you give one day charity. He will insist that 3 days charity is must else we wil face bad effects as the puja is completed with promise of 3 day payment which is 6400. A total duping of tourists here. Please refrain of giving even one rupee here to anybody and you do not need any guide here. Just switch on google maps and visit the temple. and return. Rest all they say is fake.

title: Small famous temple.
review: It is said this is only temple of Brahmaji in the world. So if in Pushkar, this is a must visit. surrounded by local market. Lassi there is a must try.

title: Was Only Brahma Temple in World.
review: Brahmaji is 3 basic supreme gods in Hinduism. But still has this only as major temple(few smaller r there.)

title: So many tails, so many stories.
review: Unfortunately no pictures allowed.

title: Worth a visit
review: The only temple to Brahma in India. That might surprise you but it is true. No cameras allowed but you can deposit them outside for a small fee in a locker. The idol itself is 1200 years old. Beautiful. Worth seeing.

title: Fraud guides and priests
review: As soon as we got down on the car, we were approached by a guide that for a sum 100 rupees, we would get parking and he will explain about the place. He spent 5 minutes with us explaining things, then left us with a priest who did some Pooja with us and started asking for money. We said we would pay at the shrine where we will get the receipt but even after paying 200 rupees we didn't get a receipt. Then this guide dropped us in Midway, took his money and left. We then went to parking and the guy asked us parking fee. At this we said that parking was included in guide fee but parking owner said that he doesn't know anything about charges and that we must pay parking fees. So instead of 100 rupees we ended paying 350 rupees frustrated with cheap cheating tricks.

title: Only Brahma Temple on Earth
review: Pushkar is called as ( तीर्थो में तीर्थ) greatest pilgrimage place among all pilgrimages. As per इतिहास (old saying) Brahma the creator of the (बहमांड) all universe used lotus as weapon to kill a (रक्षश) demon and petals fell at three places, one being at Pushkar where now Brahma (सरोवर) Sarovar, lake is. He later came down to perform (यग्य) yagya and in absence of his wife Savitri created Gyatri for the ritual as his wife. His wife Savitri cursed Brahma that he will not be worshiped any where on the earth which was diluted by his second wife Gyatri making Pushkar an exception. This is how the only place where Brahma is worshiped is here in Pushkar in form water from the Brahma Sarovar. The temple next to the Sarrovar is neither grand nor big but very important because of its significance.

title: Brahma Mandir  - Pushkar  a divine destination
review: Brahma Mandir @ Pushkar is an excellent place to visit .  It is understood  that this Brahma Temple is the only  Temple of Lord Brahma, the Creator, in the entire Universe.

title: Very near to pushakar lake
review: This temple was well known in india. Very near to Pushkar lake. There are very less temple of Bramha in India. This is one of them. Beautiful temple.

title: NEAT & CLEAN TEMPLE.
review: We visited the very rare Brahma Temple. The temple was clean & neat and well kept.

title: #religiosplace
review: If ur visiting pushker than it is good place to visit. You will feel relexed after visiting Lord Brahma trample.

title: world famous temple
review: world famous temple but mismanage by local government its good if you visits this place with out guide because local guide an priest not helpful and only money minded.

title: Brahma as diety
review: this temple is significant as it is the only temple in India where Lord Brahma,the creator of the universe,is worshiped . mind you Lord Brahma idols are found in many temples in India,but to have a separate temple to himself is a first & only due to a curse.basic temple,only go to pray.

title: Nyc temple
review: Awesome temple..i felt the charm of true worship.one and thebonly temple of lord brahma situated at the bank of holy pushkar lake

title: Best place to visit and stay
review: After having a hugely bad experience at Ajmer, we were so impressed with Pushkar  amazingly meditative place with no hassles at all from priests, no force selling, guide explained importance of the shrine with details. There are a number of beautiful resorts and competitive pricing during off seasons with service and food to match. We would come again to stay and enjoy the beauty of this place. Sunset at Aaravalli mountains is a must. A great place for destination wedding.

title: Visit to Brahma Temple
review: Brahma Temple is the only temple of Brahma in the world and attracts millions of devotees and tourists each year.

title: Must to Visit Brahma Temple
review: This Temple is situated near Pushkar Lake and is the only Temple of Lord Brahma in the world where Puja is being offered.

title: The only Brahma temple in the world - So its a must visit place
review: As I mentioned in the title- this is the one and only Brahma temple in the world— and we visited this temple with family and kids. The temple is a not much larger but it’s very nicely designed and very old.. there are many stories attached with this temple - you can read from YouTube and other local people. But this temple is the must visit place for all Hindu bhai and their family.. this is one of the most sought after temple in the ancient history as well..

title: only Lord Brahma temple in world
review: the temple is dedicated to Lord Brahma, who created the universe. since he was cursed, so there is no bhog for him,

title: one time watch
review: Only devotees can get something. Otherwise you need a guide who can tell you the story behind this temple.

title: Pure and simple place
review: The temple was not crowded when we visited. The shops just outside the temple provide ample types of prasad and there is no fuss to catch devotees by the shopkeepers. Temple is relatively small and you can properly have the darshan.

title: The only Brahma Temple
review: As the story goes this is the only Brahma temple in the world. so this becomes a must visit place.

title: Nice temple
review: A must visit in Pushkar

title: It’s fine not St Peters though
review: This is an interesting shrine but it is not a “stop the horse and cart” type of event .

title: lord brahma temple
review: located at main street of main bazaar, quite peaceful and positive vibe at lord Brahma temple, major tourist attraction in   pushkar

title: Peaceful
review: This was in a complete contrast to the Ajmer Dargah that we visited... this temple was peaceful, the people were polite and one could feel connected. We had a ceremony done by the lake as well... there was no forcing people to pay money so we were very happy and inturn donated more than what we were forcefully ripped off at Ajmer Dargah.

title: A historic and unique temple in Rajasthan
review: Brahma temple is a rarity and this temple is therefore unique. Temple attracts lots of pilgrims. There are steps to be climbed to reach the temple. Pilgrims can have Dharshan of Lord Brahma with Gayathri mata by his side.

title: Interesting experience
review: I went and sat with a priest and received a blessing and then he took me to the booth to 'make a donation' which I was happy to do as it helps the local poor.  He was very pushy though and when I offered £10 he was like tut tut you need to pay more to feed the poor families. So I gave £20.  Warning - always get a receipt.  I didn't and the guide told me it therefore went in his pocket.  Left a bad taste in my mouth!

title: Exclusive Brahma Temple
review: As you all must be aware that this is the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world. This is a very busy place as it is mostly visited by tourist from outside India. It is very popular among the foreign tourist. There you can get a variety of cuisines catering to all the foreign tourists.

title: Cheats!
review: We visited the temple as s part of our tour. As we are not Hindus we didn't want to do Pooja but our driver sent us with a guide who forcefully took us for the Pooja, on saying we don't intend to do they said they don't charge for it..Respecting their religion we did the Pooja. After that they said we can donate whatever we want to the trust and took my husband to pay.. there they said pay for 3 days or 7 days Pooja  etc.. minimum was 1 day which was Rs 5001 !!

title: One of its kind.
review: Very well maintained,  better to have a guide as this is the only temple for Bramha the creator and the lake itself is worshipped as Bramha and there is also a shrine.  The ghats are clean. Tranquil place.

title: Pooja Trust at the lake side is a Mistrust
review: We took a family vacation for the first time to Pushkar, Traveled to this place of historic significance for Lord Brahma, however, the way the trust that  manages the offerings at the lake side should be shamed to call themselves good "Hindus" where a so called hindu priest well articulated and mannered sets out systematically to deceive our hindu family in the name of offering.

title: Only Brahma Temple in India
review: Pushkar is having the only Brahma temple in India. On one side is the lake. You have to climb a few steps to see the deity of Lord Brahma the creator having four heads. Rose flowers are given as offerings. Just behind the main Temple of Brahma there is a Devi Temple also.

title: Underwhelming
review: For what is supposed to be the most important temple in this town of temples I found this a disappointment.  First, you have to leave your shoes with a huckster outside for the inevitable fee (the only time I've been asked for such a fee throughout my time in India).  Then you join a thronging crowd that you get swept along with, to the point that it's very difficult to stop and look.  So I spent a maximum of 10 minutes here, and found it particularly unmemorable.

title: Very busy
review: Our recent visit to pushkar found us with guide in toe, pushing our way through the throngs of local visitors.

title: Temple could do better with cleanliness
review: I expected a place of worship to be cleaner than an average home. I was surprised to see dirty floors, garbage cluttered in and around shrine and hallways. I wonder why the management has time and ideas of keeping donation boxes everywhere you look around temple but lacks in housekeeping.  A huge direspect to the place of worship.  The management can learn by visiting Jain temples where not a spec of dust would be found and hardly any donation boxes! Lets hope someone steps up! What a shame!

title: Religious
review: Holy and sacred.....

title: Temple and lake deserve visiting
review: The famous Brahma Temple is located in Pushkar, about half an hour's drive from Ajmer. This is probably the only known temple of god Brahma. The way leading to the shrine is not wide enough and one has to jostle with other visitors on the way to the temple. Although the temple premises is being cleaned time and again, in view of the huge crowds of devotees and visitors, constant cleaning is necessary. Proper measures for "darshan" in an orderly manner is a must. The lake also needs regular cleaning. Clean eateries and hotels are to be established. This religious place always deserves a visit.

title: The only Brahma Temple
review: It is a holy place and the only Lord Brahma temple in the world. There are 52 steps to reach the temple. Apart Lord Brahma, there are also temple of other shrines like Lord Kuber. Photography is not allowed.

title: an must in India
review: the biggest Brahama Temple in India (just a few existing) w/o shoe&socks no pics allowed, can it be very busy inside.

title: Beautiful
review: Simple and beautiful temple. Slightly crowded but manageable. Best to get a guide before reaching here. This is a place similar to the benaras galls. Follow it up with a visit to the lake.

title: Temple
review: Only Bhraman temple in world. In day is hot and in night it's very cold. So many restaurant with Italian, Iesril and confidential food.

title: Must vist temple in Pushkar
review: Sole Brahma temple must vist place in Pushkar. A holy shine driven place.. give pleasure and worship. Must vist it.

title: Historical and Peaceful
review: Full of culture and history.  This was a peaceful stop and relaxing.  Don’t bring a large bag with you because it’s not allowed in.

title: Good Temple being the only one in India
review: it's a small temple with a flight of 30-35 stairs. Not much to describe about itBig bags and cameras are not allowed inside. Free locker facility available new the base of stairs but one may has to search for it.

title: Brahama Temple has Special place in the heart of Indians
review: Situated in the picturesque Pushkar Valley and surrounded by Nangaparvat and Anasagar Lake, Brahma Temple has a special place in the hearts of the Indians. It is the only temple in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma. Made with marble and decorated with silver coins, this temple is also known for its red peak and a swan (considered sacred for Lord Brahma) and image of the image. The statue of Chaturmukhi Lord Brahma is situated in the sanctorum. There is a marble statue of Sun God in the standing mode in the temple. While all the deities feet are shown bare, the interesting thing is that an ancient warrior has been shown wearing shoes.

title: Bliss
review: This is the only Brahma temple in the world and has a story behind its construction. Felt blessed to have ticked it off my bucket list. The temple and the lake Pushkar are extremely well maintained with all creature comforts around.  Try and avoid the free lancing priests around the lake. Read up about the place before you visit. Won't need the services of a guide then.  Place for pilgrimage but one can see plenty of teenagers from around the world.

title: new version of temple looks great
review: after restoration its would be very impressive and well managed. all though pushkar is the town of temples.

title: The one and only God Brahama's temple
review: Stories... stories..... n.... stories. Small and only temple of God Brahama ..... ladies will love to shop along while seeking blessings from the Creator of this world

title: Only Brahma temple in the world
review: THis place is OK and nothing to rave about. Since thisi s the ONLY Brahma temple in the world, it is worth visiting if you are in Pushkar. We went as we were there for the camel fair. It is a very busy place, with many people going through the temple. You need to leave shoes outside for a small fee, and no cameras are allowed. When we were there, the security guard allowed several men to take photographs saying they were media people and hence allowed to take pictures. These guys were taking selfies on their mobiles, so graft seems to work if you want to take pictures inside. It is a small place so you are in and out in 5 mins. THere are steps to climb up and down.

title: Temple and Peaceful Lake
review: As the Brahma Temple in India a visit here is must.  The villagers Pushkar compliments the temple with a peaceful lake and idyllic setting.  The village was clean, calm and really a compelling place for rest recuperatio.  The stay at a hotel on the lakeside with stunning sunset was a Beauty to behold.  The village is vegetarian and there is no alcohol, as I was told.

title: Awesome
review: The temple I wanted to visit for so long..... It was worth the wait. An awesome experience worth remembering a lifetime. The walk from taxi stand to temple was good with shops on both sides, good items can be picked up from them. The arrangements at temple we're great, security to Prasad shops around all we're good.the shopkeepers were courteous and genuine. The temple had NSS boys deployed for crowd control and they were exemplary in that. Very cheerful and helpful. Darshan we're worth the  efforts.

title: An interesting temple experience - don’t take a camera...
review: Not a particularly dramatic of aesthetically appealing temple experience, but if you are interested in Hinduism or want a glimpse of an important Hindu religious site you will want to visit. I liked Pushkar and I was glad we stopped off here on our way to Jodhpur - the lake was beautiful, and it must be amazing when the camel fair is in town... I just wish we had had time to go to the Jain temple in nearby Ajmer...

title: NOT worth
review: Their is nothing much here BEAWARE of pundits n touts all are cheat here.  SO many ghats are there. GOOD Enough to sit on a peaceful ghat and enjoy marwari food in markets

title: Spiritual journey
review: It was very interesting joining the pilgrims and visiting this temple. there were lots and lots of people visiting Pushkar and it was a holy day. I recommend it.

title: Brahma Temple
review: there is only one temple of lord Brahma in india, that is located in Pushkar. nice and hindu religion temple. temple is so peaceful. as we all know, lord brahma has four head. in this temple, lord brahma's fourth head can see in mirror. out side the temple, there is so many stalls are there. you can buy things with cheap range.

title: Interesting & colourful Brahma Hindu Temple
review: This Brahma is a Hindu temple situated at Pushkar, in Rajasthan, and is very colourful.

title: Disappointed
review: Beautiful lake on sacred grounds. They say that this is the only place on earth that Brahma can be worshipped as his wife put a curse on him. A Brahmin performed a ceremony for us but beware that they do expect a hefty ‘donation’ in return. It’s almost like they scope you out to see what you can afford. Takes away from the experience but I suppose everyone has to make a living.

title: Only Brahma Temple in the  world
review: This is the only Brahma temple in the world, good to pay a visit and offer prayers. beware of pocket pickers and keep your valuables safe. you wont need a tourist guide to the temple. a quick read online would be good.

title: Lots of Steps Again
review: By now we were over the temples  and this one is nothing to get excited about.  There were a number of families 'praying'  there when we visited which gave added atmosphere however the steps are again quite slippery when asked to take off ones shoes

title: Average visit
review: As said the only Brahma temple, so a visit.  Crowded. We visited during the Pushkar fair time and hence had a lot of visitors. Very close to the fair grounds. No need for a guide to go through the temple. Steps are there and wheelchair access etc is not there.

title: Very busy and tired
review: Painted in Bunnings orange paint , myself and mate basically walked around the temple and straight out .

title: The reason for Pushkar visit
review: Brahma temple is unique as it is hard to find any. This is one of the main attraction in Pushkar. Very well maintained and managed.

title: too crowded
review: although a must to visit, make sure to chose your timing as this place is overcrowded with visitors at most times.

title: One and only bhrama temple
review: It is famous temple in Pushkar as it is only single Bhrama temple in india. Inside the temple luggage and camera are not allowed inside the temple. There are shops who charge 50 rs for locker where you can keep ur valuable   stuff.

title: Temples within a temple
review: This is a small Hindu temple at the edge of the Pushkar street market. Shoes must be left at the base before ascending the steps inside. There was a shop across the street where our group stored our shoes in lockers (normally 100rp) for safe keeping and they offered restrooms.

title: Lovely setting
review: A special place to visit, spiritual and reflective, and a joyous, colorful setting.  Worth some quiet time.

title: Called as only Brahma temple!
review: This temple at Pushkar has mythological significance as only Brahma temple!! However the place could be better maintained! Pushkar lake is next to it.

title: Divine Place
review: Its my 3rd visit. Love this place . Its full of energy and positivity. Single Brahma Temple in World is situated in Pushkar. Food is spicy here. 10 minutes walking distance to sarovar. Filming is not allowed in the temple. New park has been built behind the temple. Stayed everytime in Gujar Dharmshala. Everything is available here. In November day is bit hot but night is cold. Love to visit 4th time. Cheers.

title: Good spiritual place
review: After reaching Ajmer at around 9:30, we decided to directly take another cab and finish Pushkar leg. I did not know how much time it will take for Pushkar, so thought of booking Ola rental for 900. But we negotiated with few cabs to do the round trip to Pushkar for 800 without the Ola booking. Mind you they do not turn on the AC for this trip. The drive was scenic while it goes through the ana sagar lake and the aravalli hills. At Pushkar, the brahma temple and pushkar lake ghat are nearby. So the driver dropped us at the entry point, from where it is a bit of walk to the temple. The street is full of small shops. As you are close to the temple, lot of people will try to be the guide, ask you to take flowers and prasad and keep the shoes for free. There was a veg restaurant just in place of the temple, where we had our breakfast. It was a no-onion no-garlic veg day for us, so we had some parathas and kept our hoes in the restaurant itself. We did not buy any stuff for the puja. We just went in and did the darshan of all the deities within the complex. Whatever donation we made was in the donation box.

title: Yeah it’s cool in that it’s ubuque
review: But a little commercialized. Painted statues and temple spires made it seem a lot more new than what it claims. That it’s the only Brahma temple in India is unique, but aside from that mental attraction, the temple itself is fairly normal.

title: Very Good Place
review: A very well maintained and managed place of worship that I have seen so far. The people are well managed and instructed with a good level of security and vigilance (with good number of cameras) in the temple complex. Inside the place is very clean. We got ample time for darshan. Overall a very good experience and a definite repeat in my next trip to Pushkar.

title: Feel spiritual
review: we got to see our first brahma temple in our life. it is in the centre of crowded market but one can easily reach there. it is not very big temple but a good one.

title: Must Visit Place
review: According to me this is arguably the place in Rajashthan with the combination of Pushkar and it's lake.

title: LORD BRAHMA
review: World famous only temple of brahma is simply awsome,payed tribute to lord brahma, Beautiful temple,must visit once,Located in centre of town,

title: Religious visit
review: Visited the one and only temple of lord bramha on this planet. Lord bramha is considered to be the original creator of mankind as per hindu religion. Since this is the only temple for lord bramha you get a strange feeling of tranquility after you visit the temple. Its a holy pilgrimage for hindus especially in the auspicious month of kartik. No cameras are allowed in the temple premises therefore no photographs attached. A must visit for all hindus at least once in lifetime.

title: Very Nice and Clean
review: Good lighting if you visit at evening. You can reach the temple from Car directly. Good place, clean and beautiful.

title: Khimsar Fort Hotel and Temple
review: A glorious hotel built around a Shiva temple in Khimsar, the cross roads of an old trading route.

title: Brahma
review: Hindu god Brahma temple only one temple in the world, the temple was full artitecure by older way, a nice palace to visit

title: Well worth a quick visit
review: On an organised tour our party visited here with a Brahmin priest to lead us round and explain the importance of this temple. Very interesting beautiful and historic.

title: Great Temple and Design
review: It is very important for Hindus and the best area for other religion too, the walking street is clean and beautiful with antique and pashmina shops. Recommended.

title: Small Serene Temple dedicated to Lord Brahma
review: This is a relatively small temple built on a small elevation/hillock. This is a very old temple dedicated to Lord Brahma( one of the very few). The temple is relatively clean but the surrounding area is a bit crowded and unclean with vendors and haphazard vehicular movement.

title: Interesting temple
review: If you like temples, this is one to see. It's the only one of its type and has inscriptions to devotees from all over the world including the UK, Australia and Pakistan. There are lots of silver coins pressed into the floors and walls as offerings and many have been polished smooth by being walked over, even in bare feet.

title: D
review: Our wold only one tempel..Very good  people ..And one off the best ...Prishth Also very good and frendly

title: A Must Visit!
review: To visit the only temple of Brahma in India is an education.  To observe all of the pilgrims praying and submitting offerings is an unforgettable experience.

title: Worth visiting only Temple of Brahma in the whole world
review: The Temple was not formed naturally but due to efforts of Shankaracharya, as per the guide who accompanied us. One is not allowed to take photographs - so mobile phones, bags, etc. not allowed inside. Note to visit Temple of Goddess Ambaji at the backside of the main Temple.

title: Serene place
review: We were curious to visit this place knowing that this is the only Bhrahma temple in India. The place is simple and unlike the grand temples in many parts of the country. Beware of the touts around the pond near the temple

title: The only Brahma Temple in the world
review: It's the only Brahma temple in the world, so you should visit, it's quite small and simple, but interesting, also you should know the story, why it's the only one in the world.

title: Brahma Temple
review: We were told, this is the only Brahma Temple in the world. Due to curse, Brahma is not worshipped on earth. Mythological background place. Beware of touts trying to exploit.

title: Very nice
review: Nice Hotle rooms are very good and I will again vesit same Hotle when I will be there, it's great experience

title: LORD BRAHMA 🙏🙏
review: This is the only one temple of lord brahma in the world ...

title: Very old temple in world
review: Hindu God brahma temple only one temple in the world. this temple in AJMER rajasthan india. and pushker world

title: Beware to the so called “Brahmins”
review: The temple is nice but tourists must be very very careful to the so called “Brahmins” (a kind of custodes of the temple and the lake area). They will start taking care of you and helping you to make Hindu preyers but they will soon ask you to make “charity” donations whose amount is mandatory (100/150USD).

title: Avoid the temple , just walk around the lake
review: The moment one tourist gets down from a car scores of people come running- all out to lure money frm u!!

title: Pretty lame
review: Think the title summarises it - just lame. Not impressive at all. Zip in, zip out - takes @ 5 min. If you are not solo, ask a friend / your partner to wait outside with your slippers or shoes else they will get stolen or you will get ripped off by the guy 'watching' your slippers / shoes. Best avoided all together.

title: Scam all around
review: Photography is not allowed inside. Due to uniqueness of this temple , you can visit when you are in pushkar.

title: Nice location
review: The temple was having some good views and was quite and nice. It took us 20 min to cover the temple as it was not that much big.

title: Great temple not maintained well
review: It is very sad that such an important temple is not properly maintained.well. The fact that there is only one temple for Brahma makes it very unique and special but people dont seem to realise that. We had attended the evening Aarti which was performed very nicely by a young priest.  he diety is  very well adorned There is no queue system so people push you from all sides. It was not very crowded when we went but in times of any important festival there may be a stampede if crowd is not regulated. Wish the temple authorities do something about this and also maintain cleanliness,

title: Only Bhrama Ji temple
review: This is only temple of Brahmaji and very famous. You need to use several stairs to reach up to temple.

title: One time
review: It’s the only Bhrama  temple in the world so one should visit it .... evening time during the Aarti we visited .... police was taking good care of security ... quite different idol ....

title: the soul of pushkar city
review: this temple of brahmaji in pushkar city is unique in the world. i visited 4th time . administration should do some work forkeeping clean temple promise.

title: Unique and only in the world
review: Bhrama Ji temple is only temple of god  bhrama in the world , the temples is situated near by lake . In pushkar apart from camel ride this is one of the most visited place and .

title: Excellent Pandits
review: Enjoyed visiting as you are not harassed for donations.

title: Brahmaji darshan
review: Not sure whether this is the only temple for Brahma. The temple is small and was crowded when I went on a Monday. The temple is closed between 1:30 to 3:00 pm. The crowd is regulated by security staff. Bags and cameras are not allowed. A visit to this place especially for Hindus is a must. Pushkar is 20 km from Ajmer and there are private and government buses plying regularly. From bus stand I took a share auto to reach the Temple.

title: The only Brahma Temple!
review: I love the story our guide told us about the Brahmaji along with the establishment of temple and why it is the only one in Asia/world - i cant remember that.. Outside there are several shops with typical Rajasthani dresses for dirt cheap prices.

title: Be careful with guide and priest in Pushkar Lake
review: It is terrible experience, since I am new to Rajasthan and not familiar with Hindi language. I was taken to the temple by a guide, who told there is no charge to him nor to the priest who will do the pooja for happiness on the Pushkar lake. After doing the pooja they taken me to the donation counter and dictating to pay 7 days food charge for the priest in Pushkar, which amounts to 35000 +, Is any where just for few minutes of pooja will any one pay this exorbitant amount? In the name of voluntary payment the way they force for donation is very terrible. The minimum donation to pay is 2100/- which is very high. So any new pilgrims to this place be careful..

title: Exclusive
review: Only temple dedicated to Brahma, the god of creation, it rests in a crowded spot in Pushkar, 15km from Ajmer. I was lucky to visit during off hours and was thus spared the heckling and undesirable interference by the local priests. Surpringly, the premises are clean, even though the temple itself bears a kitschy red paint on outer walls. In the absence of any crowds, I could spend some quiet moments in the temple, with no one hell-bent to tell me the apocryphal tales or promising me a peaceful afterlife. Overall, a relaxing and fulfilling visit

title: This Is only temple in India of Lord Brahma.
review: Its very nice place  to go and worship lord Brahma.One can go here anytime and omth of the year here.The temple has  great importance in Hindu ideology.

title: A must family visit
review: A place of devotion, being the only lord Brahma temple. The parking is a bit far but not an issue. Can have a quick snacks and shopping around the place.

title: Beautiful temple
review: This temple is de biggest Brahma temple in India and that shows! Lots of hindoe people come here to worship the God Brahma with a beautiful flowerceremony.

title: If you are a tourist, behave like a tourist only.
review: It is really important to understand the purpose of visiting various attractions.  In case you visit this place to perform certain rituals and give away your hard earned money to anyone asking for it, it is your take but if you are a tourist and just want to see this place, then do not fall prey to touts, priests, pandas or pandits, in and around Pushkar Lake or Brahma Temple.

title: Darshan
review: Holly temple... clean temple only brahmaji temple in India. Old Shivlingji is also there in basement.

title: Only Brahma Ji temple of the universe...
review: Pushkar Raj is the place where world only Brahma Temple their. The history is very nice... It's very long I wish I could share. However it's a very nice and holy temple..

title: Must visit
review: Must visit because it is known to be the only temple of lord Brahma in whole world,n it's situated in the holy city of pushkar

title: Good temple to visit in pushkar.
review: Location of the temple is little in between the market which is troublesome for those who are travelling via their own four wheeler but rest it is a good place.

title: Annoying people hang around the temple
review: Walked to the temple which was very crowded with pilgrims. Deposited my shoes, told by a young guy I needed to wash my hands and feet with his water bottle and declined as I did not see others doing this and would rather do this with the rest of the pilgrims. I was then told I needed to deposit my bag in an open area so decided to forgo the visit. When I picked up my shoes the bottle guy started being nasty and I gave it straight back to him. Happy to walk away. Foreigners are not allowed in a number of temples so best to just enjoy wandering the streets and looking at the lake.

title: A revered Shrine.
review: You were not allowed to take photos at this temple. There were many people with families and singles etc, making a pilgrimage to this place. You had to remove your shoes and walk up a flight of stairs. It was revered asa sacred place. We enjoyed our experience here. We were glad we visited this place.

title: Must-visit but kept in bad condition
review: despite being a place that you have to visit it is very dirty and generally not somewhere you would want to spend a lot of time.

title: Not much to see.
review: Was taken there by a local guide, had to remove shoes, then walked around a small temple with not much to see.  Photography not allowed.

title: One and only temple of Lord Brahma Ji in the world
review: Offered our prayers to lord Brahma. Thanks to our auto driver Mr. Rajesh bhai. We had visited temple after holy dip in prayag kind. A nice place to visit.

title: Hmmm
review: This is the so called only Brahma Temple in India. Why can't we keep it exclusive? Neat and clean? Brahma murti is very exclusive since we don't see it everywhere. There are many other temples like Kuber and Narda....... Do visit... Beware of beggars, pickpockets and the dalals of God

title: Famous Temple
review: I went to Brahma Temple. Brahma Temple of Pushkar, located close to the sacred Pushkar Lake. This Brahma temple is one of very few existing Brahma temples of the Hindu and the most prominent among them. It is great place to go.

title: Brahma temple
review: The only temple dedicated to brahma in the world..too Commercialised..beware of prole misguiding..these pal just keep on following you and scare you..better just avoid and visit th he temple with a clean heart..wish the temple and surrou5areas were well maibtained.lot of shopping options nearby..

title: The one and only brahma temple
review: There is no other brahma temple in the whole world. It is said that we should visit savitri mata temple first and then visit Brahma temple. Aarti in the evenings is first done at Savitri mata temple and then at Brahma temple. Both temples are a must visit. Savitri mata temple is on a hill and there is a rope way. There are steps to reach the temple. I climbed up the steps instead of the rope way.. It was a great experience. There must be around 600-700 steps. And each step is quite high towards the end.

title: Marvelous and spiritual
review: After going around for 3 weeks to numerous temples, came to this one where you can visit and pray in oeace without pressures from fake priest. Very good priest, administers and police.

title: One temple in whole India
review: Brahma temple is the only one temple in whole India. Each and every person who are in Pushkar has to visit once to this temple once. Place is very peaceful and calm.

title: The Brahma Temple
review: The only temple dedicated to god Bramha is here. Bramha the creator of world according to Hindu mythology is worshiped here. The temple is 5 minutes walk from Pushkar lake. There are few other temples inside the premises. The normal visit of temple takes hardly one hour. During the festival time or on important dates according to hindu calendar it may take more time. There is a Gaushala inside where you can graze Gau mata by paying some Rupees

title: Devine experience
review: Lots of expectations that were completely fulfilled

title: Not worth it
review: Was eager to see the temple. But the guides pester you so much that out of irritation you hire them.  Then comes the loot.  They literally force you to perform the puja at the ghats and donate money in the name of the temple.

title: Good
review: It was exciting as this is the only Brahma Temple in India! but u have to learn to be ignorant of the guides they can really irritate the hell out of you!

title: amazing.must visit.
review: This was my second time when i went there earlier i saw the evening arti. this time i could not see that.anywys when you enter inside it feels like you are on right place. most important you can see brahma ji as well as kuber ji who all are not in other temples.

title: Worth a visit
review: The good: The short drive up and downhill. Excellent view of Ajmer and the lake. The walk on the streets leading to the temple.

title: Divine Experience !!
review: Very Peaceful place. Preferably go around 8 PM and do some meditation or go early morning around 4 AM. Photograpghy is strictly prohibited in the temple. If you dont want to get scolded by Police men then dont try. Stay away from people who will try to do "tilak" and ask money for it.

title: Beautiful as always
review: It's always divine experience to visit temple and this was our 2nd visit to brahma temple. Though the approach to hotel is crowded and dirty but it was good experience being there.

title: Pilgrimgae site
review: Not much to say. But you should go to feel that vibes in your life at least once.

title: Phonemnel Bramha temple
review: I visit twice in years of Brahma temple it really charming blissful and tranquillity holy temple in situated Pushkar. One of the world's famous temple. I am request to all tourist please visit once when came india structure of temple no words for express myself awosome place

title: the only Brahma temple in world
review: Despite being the only temple and so popular - the place was quite simple and peaceful... felt a sense of calm as soon as i entered the temple

title: Beyond words
review: This is only temple of brahma in india(may be in world but not sure).

title: Historical holy temple
review: Brahma temple is only in pushkar and it is called Treethraj. It is built by Jagadguru Shankracharya.

title: Uno temple
review: There aren't many brahma temples in the world...this is a chaturbhuj temple which means 4 heads and hands of brahma that we see on tv or idols.

title: beautiful temple
review: Once u reach temple many people will try to scam you so beware. Architecture is excellent but photography not allowed inside the temple. unfortunately you have to get through the markets to get to the temple.  what a shame. definitely worth a guide to get the history

title: Colourful Temple
review: This temple is a bit out of the way and not really worth the drive unless you are visiting the Camel fair

title: Awesome bharma temple lovely market place nearby
review: Must visit temple.clean n tidy temple .enjoyed my stay in puskar . good restaurants n fast food in market

title: An ok experience.
review: Nothing too special besides the fact that it's the only brahma temple, the architecture wasn't all that significant.

title: One & only.
review: It's a temple of Brahma Lord. Localite people suggest you to go there. After going there I realised how important this place is. Anyways, a must place to go in pushkar.

title: One Temple
review: The only brahma temple.Calm & peaceful place .Feel the power of Indian religious divines.One of the mosr visited place in pushkar alomh with pushkar lake

title: Change so much !!!!!!
review: This place use to be a “shanti mountain”, now you can find even cableway to go up & down for 100 rupies !!!!!!!!!!

title: Nice place to Visit!
review: This Brahma temple is one of very few existing Brahma temples of the Hindu, so you can’t find the second one in Pushkar and even in other cities, so you should come there if you are in Pushkar.

title: Lord Brahma!!
review: This is one of the few places in India having a dedicated brahma temple.This temple lies near the ghaat and can be reached by a long walk along the famous Pushkar market lined by shops selling famous Rajasthani artwork,famous cafes and eateries.This temple opens early morning and stays open till approximately 10pm..camera is not allowed into the premises.

title: Beautiful lake and ancient one of its kind Bramha temple
review: One has to get down at Bramha ghat and walk towards Bramha temple for around 200 mtr. One has climb few steps to reach to temple. It is said to be the only temple of Bramha. As soon as you get down a pandit will catch you, will tell about the membership of a trust and will ask to donate there if wished and will say, he won’t charge anything. A mantra chanting for your ancestors and for your welfare etc at Sarovar and finally after 10-15 min will ask you to donate with minimal being 1100 or so. Suggest to just pray at Sarovar and move to temple and keep away from pandit as long as you are a visitor. A small temple of Bramha is situated here. Cameras not allowed inside. There is also a prachin Shiva temple here. Lot of shops are there on the way for local made items. Could observe 1 or 2 shops with fixed rate and found it to be reasonable. It’s one of the rarest and holy places in India.

title: historical temple manage by unprofessional government
review: temple is beautiful and only one temple of lord brahma but managed by very unprofessional guy they make lot of improvement if they work in right direction.

title: Lord Brahma Temple.. the only
review: Pushkar is famous for the Only Brahma Temple in the world.. Lord Brahma the creature of universe is being worshiped in a temple only at this place. Many stories are associated to justify this facts. However, place of religious importance and belief is hardly managed.. every where you will find touts..so beware of them. Even the basic amenities are not in place, local management must look into this.

title: Only brahma temple
review: Pushkar temple is the only temple for lord brahma. Pushkar lake and temple are of huge religious significance for hindus. Ideally, worship in the temple should be undertaken only by brahmcharis. The temple is closed in the afternoon from 1.30 pm to 3.00 pm. Otherwise the timings are 6.00 am to 9.00 pm.

title: Worth a tour with a guide to give you the history
review: We had a guide here in Pushkar and we sat for 10 mins and he told us the history of Brahma, his wives, his son and why this is the only Brahma Temple. It was fascinating and worth it, it made visiting the temple even better.

title: Lord Brahma Temple
review: Only one is world. Must visit place. Other then there are many other places to explore like, Pushkar Lake, Savitri temple, Gurudwara Singh Sabha and main market, great meal and shopping and many more.

title: Worship
review: Good place. Only place of Brahma ji temple in whole world. It’s a holy place to worship brahma ji. Near by market is very good.

title: Onw and only...
review: This is the only Bramha temple in the world, who is believed to be creator of the world one of the first 3 gods in Hindu mytholodgy.

title: Good Place
review: It is a small temple in comparison to its publicity but the good part is that you can do the darshan for long as it is not very crowded in the evening.

title: The divine presence
review: I always visit the Brahma Temple  whenever get chance. Since childhood I have been coming here and always enjoy the divine silence and peace which this place bring.

title: Only temple
review: The Brahma Temple is the only one in the whole of India and well worth a visit but very busy The lake is accessible by various ghats just be careful the views are spectacular but walk around the lake and take it all in .the market is huge and mind boggling.

title: Worth visiting
review: The fact that this is a unique temple in India makes it worth visiting and seeing for the similarities and contrast to other temples. You do not need to purchase any offerings if you do not want to, despite what some of the vendors will have you believe at the entrance. You can leave your shoes with one of the men and give a small “donation” when you leave. The temple itself is very busy with tourists and locals. it is painted a vibrant blue colour, which is eye catching and unique. Definitely worth the 10-15mins round trip while visiting Pushkar.

title: The only Brahma Temple in the world as it is said...
review: Cameras are not allowed though mobiles are allowed. A must visit when in Pushkar. A small temple but good one.

title: Cameras not allowed but you can take your mobile and take pics inside
review: This old brahma temple has a beautiful old athmosphere. But there are masses of tourists and Indians at any given time. Not a good place to meditate but worth seeing whilst in Pushkar.

title: An intriguing visit to such an important Temple
review: When we arrived in the area near the entrance to the Temple you are right in the busy Pushkar bizarre. You can only go in without shoes, cameras and bags. So we left everything opposite in a place that seemed to double as a shop and a small restaurant. There were lockers for valuables.

title: Great temple
review: India only brahma temple, worth a visit.

title: jagat pita brahma temple on this planet
review: the most most rare temple is brahma temple , beacuse the temple you will get in this planet only one . so every body should go there ,  mind satisfaction is 100%

title: Visit the temple but careful the priest
review: There is a saying to visit the lake first before the Brahma temple . Good to know that we follow the requirements but be careful of the "priest" who want to perform rites for a fixed fees of approx Rp. 2000 minimum. My advise is sit and meditate on your own, your own time with the All Mighty. Just walk away from such people . They will not harass you if you avoid them .  The visit to the temple later was a breeze . Easy and hassle free. Do visit the temple and avoid those touts , with a smile .

title: Well...
review: Small but nice temple. Unique in the way that it's one of the view worshipping Brahma. If nothing to do in Pushkar, worth a visit.

title: Part of Webjet tour
review: We took our shoes off and went up the worn marble steps to the temple. You have to be fully dressed and no cameras permitted, you lock your camera in lockers at the entrance and keep the key. The marbles of the steps and walls were covered in remembrance texts to celebrate deceased family members. We carried petals and sweets bought from venders at the foot of the steps where we left our shoes and took them to be blessed by the priest in front of the four headed shrine of Lord Brahma, then they were returned to us. At the back of the shrine was the accommodation for the cows who had been retired as they were too old to walk the streets, the Hindu religion really Love their cows. Very nice.

title: Excellent temple
review: This was part of the Riviera Tour, but well worth the experience, the early morning walk through the market that was beginning to open up.

title: Uninteresting
review: Unless you’re fascinated by a couple of idols in small niches, this place is essentially a quite dirty empty temple with too many people. Nothing to remember about and easy to skip.

title: Spiritual visit
review: One n the only temple of Brahma in India.. is in Pushkar... One of the popular holy place among induan pilgrims ... ther us one main brahma temple n two other temples of maa durga n obe shivling is there in basement... temple closing time 12-4pm everyday... lots of rajsthani clothing and antique jewellery shop is there.. last but not least beware of pockets lifters... h

title: Brahma temple and ghats around Pushkar Lake.
review: One of the many temples around the lake. Though one of the few dedicated to the god of creation Brahma. Hindu pilgrims visit once in a life time, to bathe in the waters. Beware of men offering the ‘holy flower’. Otherwise a beautiful peaceful lake with amazing reflection.

title: Scary place
review: Really creepy place where everyone is out to rip you off. One of the only places in India that I felt very very unsafe. One of the only brahma temples around and should have been interesting

title: Ok... Nothing great
review: Although everybody said you don't need offer anything in Brahma Temple. The local stalls owners and their helpers will try fool you to buy flowers and other stuff for as high as 100inr. Overall ok but nothing great and spoilsport are the shopkeepers who will track you and your actions and use it to mint money

title: Main place to visit......
review: No one should miss this place when you are at Pushkar and this temple is dated back to 14th Century but renovations made after has made the structure mixed feeling.

title: The One and Only
review: The Brahma temple is the only temple of Brahmaji in India. The temple is quite simple but old and has a charm about it.

title: Rare Brahma temple
review: Worth a visit early in the morning , you need to buy an offering before you go in and of course shoes off . Although Brahma is a the top of the Hindu pantheon temples to him are rare . No photos inside but the streets all around are teeming with interest and mostly helpful people .

title: Visit to the Brahma Temple
review: Attractive modernist architecture. Fantastic, perfect visit great lakeside temple view. Managed in a perfect way.

title: The one and only.... in the world. Must Go!
review: Do go there in the late afternoon to enjoy the Aarti in the evening. That’s a must watch to feel the charisma of Pushkar Sarovar. Also, you can enjoy the evening “maalpuas” sweet pies

title: Temple of Brahma Bhagwan
review: Only temple dedicated to Brahmaji. Its a religious place for hindus and people visiting out of curiosity should follow rules to maintain sanctity of the holy place.

title: Touristy holy place.
review: One of the few Brahmin temples. It has turned into a bizarre tourist show. Sad for the devotees. Lots of junk shops outside

title: Interesting temple, lots of people
review: The place to see in Pushkar - one of the few Brahma temples, nice ambience, though difficult to understand the spirituality as outsider. Would recommend going for the aartis.

title: Dissatisfied
review: As we are interested in history  and India with its different religions we took a detour to the Brama Temple. A tourist trap and so beware of con men. Access to the temple is through alleyways of merchants selling overpriced souvenirs. The temple itself does not have the reverent feel that one would imagine towards such a significant deity.

title: Rare temple for Lord Brahma
review: The temple at Pushkar is one of the very rare temples for Lord Brahma in the Hindu Pantheon. The idol in itself seemed small ..maybe better lighting could be used inside? Sadly no pictures were allowed to be taken

title: Such an amazing place!
review: Loved every bit of the experience here at  the temple! I recommend on going there during sunset, such a beautiful sunset!

title: Only Bramha Temple
review: Small but quite temple. According to Hindu scriptures Lord Brahma has no temples or pooja. This is considered to be one and only temple built for him. You can also notice interestingly Kubera as deity in this temple with Hanuman.

title: Religious place
review: Though it's a religious place and while going toward the temple you will see alot of shops which deals in clothing and food items and yes there are many small food eating joints nearby to this temple but yes take care of your belongings over here and you have to deposit your cameras and  bags in a locker so it's better not to carry anu valuable things

title: Don't go on the ghat with a priest!
review: Even in the Hindu believe there are priests you can't trust.

title: Amazing
review: Great place to visit. Its very easy to find and can be done on your own, you don't need a guide and its free. You have to leave your shoes at the bottom of the steps for a small fee, but entrance is free. Well worth a visit .

title: Beautiful temple
review: Interesting to learn the history and culture and visit this temple, it is worthwhile to visit in Pushkar,

title: intresting plcae for knowing culture and history
review: beautiful temple its a only temple devotee to lord brahma temple and this temple ric histiry so take local guide.

title: The Only Brahma Temple in the World
review: AS this is the only temple of its kind in the world and sacred in the Hindu religion you would expect something a bit exceptional, visually. It isn't. It is a religious site so respect.

title: Avoidable Place
review: The Brahma temple, supposed to be the only temple in the world, disappoints you when you reach there. The temple is dirty coupled with disinterested priests sitting there. Of course if you offer "Dakshina" or you are accompanied with a pandit guide, you may receive a warm welcome.

title: Nice place
review: Must visit and enjoy the taste of pawan restaurant that beats all other expensive worst hotels or shops. Pawan restaurant is at its best along with thus Brahma temple

title: It’s alright!
review: Again another hype about this temple which I did not seem to fathom. They say it’s an un Lucky temple for some as it is heavy. But yes it’s worth a visit. Be carful about monkeys

title: Brahma Temple
review: This is the temple to see in Pushkar- Brahma's temple. It is dedicated to Lord Brahma, the Creator in the Hindu faith.  Lots of tourist shops around the area, can be a little crowded be careful of your things.Our guide was very good and explained everything very well.

title: Amazing place
review: Such a pretty place. So much to see and absorb. The space is circular, so you can just carry your shoes and walk around. The temple is magnificent and so is the nearby Durga mandir. Truly magical.

title: Just Brama!
review: There is no reason to visit the Brama Temple. This is, what i have to read in this platform. Well, there is a theological reason, even if you are not a Hindu: respect the religion of others and go to the only Brama Temple in India. And try to have a bit of a spiritual experience!

title: Unique storyline
review: You will find lot of stories and myths associated with this trample. If you are visiting Ajmer , would recommend to visit it

title: Mythological place
review: A descent place in pushkar. Except for its mythological importance nothing is there to do. It is the only famous brahma temple in India. Get protected from your selves by duping done there. People will approach you by saying they will perform holy Pooja on the name of your family. Simple say them that you do not have money with you.

title: Religious...
review: It is one and only temple of Lord Brahma. Temple's design and Architecture is beautiful to watch. There is a huge market also. I am very happy to visited here.

title: Excellent Brahma temple
review: On moving around 1 km on foot through narrow road with small shops both side we reach the Brahma temple.It is located at a high place .It is the only temple of the Brahma, the creator in the world.

title: Must visit place in Pushkar
review: The only Lord Brahma temple in India, that definitely states the kind of importance this place holds. Temple is simple and serene, the surrounding area is highly commercialized. Recommendation - Lakshmi Mitthaiwala, an eatery in this area is a go to place if your taste buds demand rajasthani delicacies!! I just loved the Kadi Kachodi, Moong Dal Halwa there!!

title: Disappointing Scam
review: It was quite a hassle to visit the temple and then, once you do get inside, it was one of the least interesting temples on our whole trip. A guy was waiting outside and he said he was a student working there voluntarily. He initially gave us a couple of pointers and I made it clear we didn’t want a guide. However he followed us around and basically did become a guide. He harassed us to go to the lake with him where it became clear we would have to get a blessing from a waiting holy man and make a sizeable donation (I am sure the ‘guide’ gets a cut of this). We stopped it long before it went too far and the chap was pretty annoyed. It cost us nothing other than a small donation we made to the official temple office but could have been so much worse. We made it clear several times that we didn’t want a guide and weren’t going to pay any money but it’s all just a big lie. Be warned! The temples really need to get a grip on the situation - these guys are making a lot of money out of religion and I doubt that much filters back to the people who really need it.

title: Very Knowledgable
review: Its a must visit when in Pushkar. Absolutely fascinating history to be learnt of why there's only one temple devoted to Lord Brahma in the entire country.

title: Om Brahme namah:
review: The operator ,only temple of the world when reached upstairs of the near operator the feeling peace in heart ,Amazing devotional reverence on our mind  after temple went to pushkar lake side complete holi feeling

title: Divine Atmosphere marred by Guides who want quick money
review: We went to Brahma Temple to offer our prayers, however as we parked the car, all these local guides, not sure even they are guide or what to haunt you ...they will smartly push you to perform a Pooja and then ask for Donation of INR1100 or INR2100 and take you to Donation Counter, It is sad that in Divine place like Brahma Temple, we have to face these peoples.

title: Very popular Hindu temple
review: Pushkar having some great place to be visited and Bramha temple is one of beautiful place to see. Also, this is the only Bramha ji sample in Asia.

title: colorful
review: amazing temple, it is the only Brahma temple so it worth the visit. you can't bring with you anything weith the exeption of something that can cover the feet.

title: Only Bramha temple in the world
review: I always wanted to visit this temple after learning the story behind it. The temple is beautiful, situated in the city so you can reach easily (walk, I would suggest). Just be aware of the Brahmins who can force you for performing puja.

title: ONLY HISTORIC TEMPLE OF BRAHMA JI
review: The Brahma Temple is very famous because of its grandiose architecture of opulence but it is dedicated to Brahma Ji.  In the center of town, not on the lake, this is one of India's most important temples. Although many say it's the sole temple dedicated to Brahma in the world, in reality there are a few others but they are not considered authentic

title: Brahma Temple
review: This is perhaps the only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma.

title: only brahma temple in world
review: the idol of creator brahma is very beautiful, nearby temple are good options of dal baati etc..behind the temple is a walk to ropeway to savitri temple

title: Waste of time
review: Hassled outside to make a donation.

title: nicely managed temple
review: We were attracted to the place as this is the only temple of lord Brahma in the world. we were blessed with nice darshan.The temple is heavily guarded but kept clean.

title: Worth spending a day or two here.
review: Very nice and cultural town which gives u a great feeling about Hindu culture and blessed with the presence of so many Gods to this place. You can see the vibrant colors in different shops, temples and ghats around the Pushak Lake.

title: Get a guide
review: Ask someone for a guide, many locals do it as well for less money than you would book from an agency. It's worth it to go there with someone that can explain the story of Brahma, the way they worship, the mentality of the pilgrims, the Puja ceremony

title: Serene place
review: It is a unique temple with adequate facilities around it. I personally liked the energy. As an architect i found number of reasons to visit.

title: Vacations
review: Visited with my mother, wife, son and daughter. Very peaceful place. We all feel blessed with bhrama jee

title: Unique One
review: It's the Only Temple of Lord Brahma in the whole World. A must visit place if you are travelling to Ajmer.

title: Satya ki khoj
review: We all know about only temple of Bramha ji, but the story related with its puja needs to be researched , there is a lot hidden or not told yet

title: Add this holy shrine to your trip to Rajasthan
review: Brahma Temple, Pushkar. Jagatpita Brahma Mandir (Hindi: जगत्-पिता ब्रह्मा मंदिर) is a Hindu temple situated at Pushkar in the Indian state of Rajasthan, close to the sacred Pushkar Lake.

title: One of its kind in India- Dedicated to the Creator- Brahma
review: Busy with hoards of Indians on pilgrimage here. One gets the sense of fever for those ardent followers who take the opportunity to receive the blessings of the God. I can only guess that belief = experience of the temple equals faith in their hearts. Observe and empathise and one will understand the experience the faithful feel. Taking a tourist view to snap photos is fine but it is better to be a traveller within that temple and feel your way empathising what the local faithful feel. See it, feel it experience it! You will discover YOURSELF! ...just that little bit more. Is that not what India is- a spiritual experience?

title: Good!!
review: It's a good temple and worth visit because it's the sole temple of Brahma ji . Outside is Pushkar Lake and market too.

title: Good feel
review: There is only one temple of Bhrama in world and it's just amazing good maintained by people .

title: Temple
review: Very old temple of lord brahma.senior citizens will face problem as it has plenty of stairs to climb op

title: The one and only Brahma Temple
review: True to it’s claim, it could be the one and only Brahma Temple in India. Pleasant  environment, well managed and quiet peaceful for prayers. However, we’re not allowed long enough to do the prayer in the main hall as we were ushered away immediately.

title: Supposedly only Bramha temple in the world
review: This temple is supposedly only Bramha's temple in the world, it has interesting story behind it. you can hire a guide in ~50 Rupees and he will provide you guided tour of temple and sarovar.

title: Awsom Pushker
review: Pushker is Awsom Place. I visit Pushker many time. When I visit Pushker I feel very good. Barhama temple and Pushker to Lake is very famous around the world the world. In Pushker people who came from all over world.

title: Too crowded and nothing outstanding
review: The place was a bit too crowded. Quite forgettable and full of shop owners asking you to keep your shoes and buy Prasad from their shop.

title: Pushkar Visit.
review: terrible. lots of pushing around happens. totally commercialized area. early morning visit or late evening visit preferrable.

title: An invaluable link to ancient religion
review: We travelled from Jaipur. It's about 2hours by car but well worth it. Roads are good.

title: Serene
review: Beautiful temple. So ancient and only bhrama temple in the world. Pushkar is a quaint little place. Holy and peaceful

title: Only famous  'Brahma' Temple in the world
review: This holy place is the Abode of 'Brahma', the God of creation. There are only two temples of Brahma, in which, the one in Pushkar is only the famous one. The temple is quite old and holds a sacred value among Hindu devotees & pilgrims.

title: Terrible experience
review: It saddens me to write this review however I feel I must warn future visitors whom decide to go to Braham Temple, First impressions of the temple were great, it's beautiful and has a breathtaking view over Pushkar Lake. This good impression quickly disappeared as we were immediately targeted by "priests" of the temple, not priest mearly opportunists taking advantage of tourists. My partner and I decided to partake in a blessing at the temple as we are both spiritual people whom are open to each and every religion. Firstly we were separated as we were not married, this meant we were taken to different areas of the temple to complete the blessing. From here the priest carried out the blessing which start great but it quickly went down the road of how much money we would donate for good karma. Asking as much as $100 AUD each. My partner and I both donated $20 each however this was after much back and forth with the priests whom persisted to ask for more money. Throughout our tour in India we donated endless money to children and people whom we felt truely needed it but at Braham Temple we felt pressured and targeted. Good Karma is not bought.

title: USP-Touted as the only Brahma Temple in the country
review: The temple is as any other famous temple in India - though not as grand as most of them. The USP of this temple is that it is touted as the only Brahma temple in the country. The crowd management is not upto the mark at the temple and for those who face difficulty in climbing stairs this is a difficult climb as the steps are steep and 100 plus in number. The markets around the temple are good to have a relaxed walk and indulge in some shopping for clothes and traditional Rajasthani artefacts

title: Amazing Temple
review: Beware the temple closes at 1:00 pm and reopens at 3 pm. This is the only temple in the world of Brahma Ji. After visiting the temple you need to take a dip in the sarovar to complete the visit.

title: It is the only temple for God Brahma, the creator of the universe.  Its uniqueness is the reason to visit.
review: One of the the very few temples which has not become commercial.  You do not find anyone seeking offerings, donations or alms inside the temple.  A rare experience, in deed.  Very pious environment and nice place to visit and spend some peaceful time praying.  Glad that I visited.

title: A unique temple
review: Visiting Brahma temple in pushkar was one of a kind experience as it's the  only temple in the entire world devoted to Lord Brahma.

title: Scram
review: Be aware in the temple and around there are many scramers so called gurus and brahmand which want to make money. Temple itself nothing special.

title: Intersting visit, watch out for scam
review: The temple itself is very interesting.  We were met by a 'student' who offered to guide us. Have in mind how much you are prepared to pay.  The student was very informative and then escorted us to the Brahma Ghat where we received a 'Blessing' from a Brahmin. All very nice until we were then asked to make a donation to their trust.  Happy to do this but there was then a lot of pressure to donate extremely large sums of money.  I keep my larger value bank notes in a separate wallet so only had a small amount of money in my 'working' wallet.  This seemed to satisfy them that I couldn't pay the equivalent of US $200 they were all-but demanding

title: Superbbbbb
review: Brahma temple who is the creator of world his temple are few.even kind is there if u want you can take a holy dip then you visit in early morning u can see god with patience as devote ll be less so that you can enjoy seeing. As photographs are not allowed in side so can see

title: Mr
review: Fantastic hotel very friendly. Excellent food. Lovely room and setting. Shamsher Khan excellent waiter.

title: Great Mythological Story
review: One of those rare Hindu Holy Shrines which have less number of visitors and attarcts less crowd. So you can actually sit and enjoy the blissful sarovar. This place is very holy and has a lot of importance from hindu mythology point of view. Everything is great about this temple . Do not get in the trap of flower vendors trying to get you to perform pooja and rituals by local pandits. But it is definitely worthwhile to hear the folklore and the importance of the place. Administration should take care that tourists are not forced in to giving unnecessarily higher donations ( than what one would like to ).

title: Spiritual Journey
review: The Brahma temple is the only temple for Lord Bramha in the world. Beautiful architecture with a great history.

title: Only Brahma Temple in World
review: This temple is dedicated to lord Brahma.  And it is only one Brahma (creator of world) temple in world.  It is one of famous hindu pilgrimage spot.

title: Temple visit
review: Wonderful temple but so many scammers around there ! Today was a special celebration so it was over crowded too!

title: so religious place
review: every one comes here to worship with god,, the place is so good ,, we reach there by walking along the pushkar lake, there are plenty of good shops, but bewares of cheaters, they sell things 10times it costs or even more expensive.... so u need to bargain alot,, u can buy a thing in just 100rs if someone tell u it's for 500 or 600.

title: A rare Brahma temple
review: This place is called the only Brahma temple in India. Overall wasn't much different from other temples with lot of haggling from the vendors outside.

title: Only Lord Brahma Temple in the world
review: This is the only Brahma temple in the world. Located near the BrahmaSarovar. The temple is not very crowded and you can easily get darshan and come out within 20 minutes on a regular day. Do not get schemed my purohits.

title: Largest Brahma Temple in India
review: Interesting and also had Puja blessing  at lake by a young man This may be a touristy thing but I felt blesses by it.

title: Lord Brahma stands alone
review: When in Pushkar take time to visit this temple. Over a good visit and unique one as it as it is said to be the only Brahma Temple in the world (or at least the most famous). We noted a number of areas where a good cleaning would be in order.

title: Amazing Holy Place
review: Great holy place. Place of Brahma, the creator. Performed pooja on the pushkar lake. A very feel-good experience overall.

title: Nothing Special
review: Well to be honest, apart from the fact that this is Lord Brahma's only temple in the entire world, I could not figure out a reason to visit this place after I came out of it. It's a normal Hindu temple, nothing special about it. It's at the end of a very colorful market cum street which houses a lot of cafes and small eateries. You can just walk down from one of the hostels you might be staying in, about 1.5 kms from Zostel and Madpackers. Alternatively, you can also take a cab or an auto which takes you from a different route and drops you about 50 mts from the temple.

title: World's one & only Brahma Temple
review: Took an unsual conveyance from Ajmer - Auto Rickshaw (tuk tuk) for an adventurous ride alone. Rickshaw took Rs.350 including to & fro fare, luckily the driver was very enthusiastic guide too.

title: Brahma Temple
review: Been told that this is the only temple of Lord Brahma in the whole universe. One the way to temple one guy approached us & requested us to brief the history of temple & procedure to do Pooja at temple for just Rs 20. We agreed & he told us that the first step is to visit the ghat prior to enter to the temple. He introduced to a Pandit/priest at the steps of lake & he did Pooja & ask us to make donation which we did. We visited the temple. It was an awesome experience, well managed queue & you hardly get time to worship properly.

title: The one and only Brahma Temple in India
review: It is the one and only Brahma Temple in India and thats why people  from all over the world come and visit it.

title: Unique temple
review: Brahma temples are a rare thing; this one is relatively small but interesting and pretty. We went around the time of the fair so the temple was packed, but still worth seeing. Note that photography is prohibited. Take pictures with your eyes only :)

title: Nice temple, shame about the rules!
review: I love going to the Brahma temple while in Pushkar but it is a little busy most days with pilgrims wanting to visit; especially during the camel fair!

title: JAI Lord Brahma
review: I have too much fatith for Lord Brahma Temple and this is a only temple in the world who devotee to Lord Brahma.

title: Nice
review: Though it is often said that the temple in Pushkar is the only one for Brahmaji in the world, there are 4 more temples in the world. Went, had darshan and came back.

title: Nice
review: Temple is very nice but the people are like doing business for god they are trying to force you to buy some "prasad" for god , really bad

title: God....
review: The temple has a very special feel to it. Being aware of its importance, I quietly entered the temple and was surprised to see a Guru sitting in the middle of the room who was very friendlyThe temple complex was quite clean. We visited the temple in the evening and after Dussehra was over so it wasn’t crowded.

title: For the spiritually inclined
review: Others can and should avoid it. Messy and dirty religious commercialisation. Pushkar can be completely written off the itinerary while touring Rajasthan.

title: Great Temple | Peaceful | No Place to Keep the Shoes
review: Bhrama Temple is very Peaceful. We loved it. But we found out that they don't have a place keep shoes. So many religious tourists visit the place everyday, and they obviously make good donations as well. There are shops around which offer to keep the shoes for Free but when you keep the shoes there, they'll ask you to purchase something from their shop (Note - overpriced).

title: My photo looks nothing like TripAdvisor's
review: Evidently I saw the temple under maintenance but as the guide explained the significance and the adjacent mural about Hinduism it all came together for me.  That is the religious value of modern Hinduism.

title: Unique Place
review: Very old temple. Was not too crowded could manage darshan quite quickly. Photography is prohibited inside

title: Quite unique
review: The Brahma Temple is in the middle of town so it is an easy walk from almost anywhere in Pushkar. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Pushkar. Photography is prohibited and you will need to remove your shoes, but there is a place to leave them just before you reach the main entrance.

title: World only temple devotee to lord brahma temple
review: This is the only temple who devotee to Lord Brahma temple and feel very good when enter to lord Brahma temple.

title: A Must Have Place to Visit in Pushkar
review: As we went there at mela time, The place was extremely crowded. Shoe, cameras are not allowed inside of the temple. One can buy Puja offerings from nearby stalls. They well arrange placed to keep your shoe. People are very helpful. Average 45 mins are required to make darshan(in an extremely crowded situation).

title: An interesting temple
review: There are so many temples in India one cannot visit them all! I would not go out of my way to visit this one, but if you happen to be walking past, why not drop in? No cameras are allowed.

title: Clean temple complex
review: Visited this temple as we’d been told it’s the only Brahma temple in the country. It was a nice experience. The temple complex was quite clean. We visited the temple in the evening and after Dussehra was over so it wasn’t crowded.

title: Brahma temple in pushkar
