review: We went here little late. The closing time is at 9pm. There was hardly any crowd at late evening though it was Kartik month and Pushkar fair had begun. Darshan was very easy.

title: Impressive site
review: The temple has a very special feel to it. Being aware of its importance, I quietly entered the temple and was surprised to see a Guru sitting in the middle of the room who was very friendly.

title: Terrible Experience
review: We stumbled across this temple on a walk around Pushkar and went to deposit our shoes before going in. Having placed them in the provided shelves, a Brahman guide started talking to us and taking us around the temple (quite a common occurrence in India). We were happy to have him take us around but things very quickly took a turn for the worst when he sat us down with a Brahman priest who immediately demanded thousands (thousands!!) of rupees in exchange for prayers for our family members. They also demanded we go to an ATM when we refused. They insist donations are voluntary but they are not - horrible, intimidating experience which several other travellers we met had also suffered. If you go to this temple please do not humour any of the guides or men surrounding it.

title: Beautiful temple
review: This is the one and only Lord Brahma temple situated in India and well worth a visit . Situated in the small town of Pushkar around 11 Kms from Ajmer , it's nestled in between the Aravalis . The temple is quite nice and well maintained and one can find peace and tranquility here .

title: Holy but subject to extortion
review: We detoured here intentionally during our Rajasthan adventure, I am glad we did to experience the Westin....this however was seriously sad.  The temple is badly kept but fine, it’s a holy site and respect is warranted.  What is bad is the ‘come to the lake for the blessing, any donation you wish to make can be and is voluntary to support the charitable work, and a government receipt’, all good I think and look towards the spiritual experience.  Well, blessing done, all very special on the steps of the ghat.  Next....so, how much are you giving? INR500 I say....non, no, no, rupee is Indians only, English give pounds and maybe £1000 is reasonable....do you have any other currency? A bank card? Can you come back later and pay more.....well, last time here thanks very much, extortion is extortion and has no place in a holy site.  Shame on you.

title: Only bharma temple
review: nearby to the lake , walking distance from lake and have market just outside temple.

title: Evening Aarti and rose water!
review: Visit in the evening for the aarti! Beautiful aarti!  Plenty of tourist guides but we declined, they say no tips but they take you to the temple and make you do pujas and make you pay hefty amounts! Visit pushkar lake, see the sunset! If you're keen on buying Pushkar's famous Rose water, stop by at the first two shops next to the temple, been using their rose water from a company called "Niharika" for years!

title: Love love love love it!!
review: We came here with a private guide! And he was so good! So informative !! But one this that made Pushkar and this visit so special we’re the different personalities of people from Pushkar to anywhere else in India!! So welcoming so lovely so amazing just feel so happy to have gone here !! I love Pushkar I love the temples the shops the lakes !  Everything it’s so special!!

title: Lord Brahma Temple
review: Lord Brahama Temple is the only temple situated in Pushkar and at no other place. It is at a reasonable hight.

title: The only temple of Brahma in India
review: It's regarded as the only temple of Brahma in India. A must visit this 90 years old temple. You can collect the 'prasad' from outside the temple which is a long local market.

title: Unique temple
review: Unique temple in India devoted to Brahma. Very crowed place as Indian people should come as pilgrim once in their live. So very authentical place. We were touched to be part of it.

title: Only Brahma temple in the world
review: Very old and significant Hindu site. One of the three holiest places for the Hindu religion.

title: The major attraction
review: Its a major attraction at Pushkar. There are many touts selling prasad & free shoe keeping service there, avoid.

title: The sacred abode of lord Brahma
review: It was a long overdue trip to this pushkar and brahma temple for this holy site is a sacred place for the believer. Full of nice vibes . Nice in the morning

title: blissful
review: beautiful temple. small complex. lake is well maintained but slippery. better to take a bucket if bathing is required. there are no rods to hold on to only few ropes so unless an expert swimmer I wouldn't venture in the water.

title: Brahma temple visit
review: Yeah go for it as this is the only place to visit here in Pushkar, but if u visit after diwali there is a camel fair which is amazing and give u a feel of real Pushkar. Also when u visit the brahma temple dont fall for the guide who will charge u only 20/- but will encourage u more for a pooja that happens on the bank... Dont go for it even if want to go for it, that kind of tbing must not be encouraged for they ask u for a hefty amount after the ceremony... Apart from that there is nothing much. The hotel Gulab Niwas that we stayed in was amazing and an experience of a life time...

title: Dirty, badly managed
review: Typical Indian temple, overcrowded, badly managed and dirty. Instead of managing the crowd, policemen and one policewoman, either asleep or completely indifferent

title: Extremely disappointing, especially compared to the rest of Pushkar!
review: Maybe one of my only negative reviews, if not my first.

title: Holy place
review: It's a calm and serene place like any temple and the lake itself. The only distraction is lack of cleanliness along the path. I wish the authorities conduct a swach bharat drive here!!

title: Only temple of brahma ji
review: It is well managed, you can have peacefull darshan at thic place despite being a ekadshi just before the pushkar mela.

title: Brahma Temple, Pushkar
review: This temple is definitely worth the visit as it is the only one in the world. Your tour guide would tell you the story behind the Brahma Temple. Photography is not allowed here at all.  Just a short walk away is the Pushkar Lake. If you would like to donate, do donate at the donation box at the main gate of the entrance to the Pushkar Lake. The donation office is a charity foundation for needy children, abused pets and homeless people. You will be given a receipt for the donation. We didn’t take a picture of the entrance - steps towards the Brahma Temple - which is allowed. However we did take a picture of Pushkar Lake. Along the way to the Brahma Temple and Pushkar Lake there’s a bazaar selling local handicrafts. It’s definitely worth the trip to Pushkar especially around the last week of October/early November where they hold a yearly carnival that starts seven days before the full moon night. This year the carnival will be held from 28-Oct to 4-Nov 2017.

title: Old Heritage Temple
review: This is only temple of Lord Bramha . That is why Puskar is famous . This is Religious place . Moreover presence of foreigner is very high wfrt Indian . ( This is my Experience )

title: Unique temple
review: One certainly needs a bit of awareness about Hindu practises to understand the relevance and uniqueness of the Brahma temple. After all, here is a God who is known to have been cursed by his own wife that he will have just this one temple where he will be worshipped. And a God who is known to be the God who created the world, no less.

title: Highlight
review: This is one of the most famous temples in Pushkar. It's very nearby the Pushkar lake. You can visit this temple after seeing the Pushkar lake. Very old and beautifully built.

title: Very Holy place ...
review: First time here, very nice temple and holy place and only Brahma's temple of the world. In high security.

title: Brahma Temple
review: A short walk from the Pushar Bazaar and the sarovar. An impoirtant temple which has to be included on the visit list. According to legend, you cannot visit the Savitri Temple without first visiting the Brahma Temple

title: Only Brahma temple
review: You have heard many famous temples in india. But there is one temple which is the only one temple across world, yes, and that is the temple of lord brahma in pushkar. The sunset and sunrise of pushkar is the finest feeling and scene ever.

title: Peace!!!
review: Less crowded temple. Recommended visit with relaxing clothes and sandles. Avoid shoes. This temple was not very crowded and you can get spots inside temple for self reflection . It is peaceful place...

title: beautiful place
review: beautiful place! india is the only temple in Brahma! there is no such an india!

title: Only One temple in the World
review: We visited pushkar in the month of June this year . It was a holy and spiritual visit . But as it was not so far from ajmer we decided to visit pushkar .We have reached pushkar by 7:30 pm . We parked our car just beside the temple . We goes inside and their was no rush or crowd as I thought that the temple would be too crowded . The temple was was quit and spiritual we have seen the whole temple it was great seeing and a man told us that the temple gets closed by 9 pm so we hurried and offered prayers in front of lord brahma and decides to leave temple after night aarti . We came out of temple by 8:15 pm . Then we decided to see the market and pushkar lake we ate food in a dhaba just beside the temple the taste was too good.

title: Peaceful
review: The temple is peaceful. There is a lake in front of the temple.  The temple premises are not well maintained and there are flowers thrown on the floor.

title: Absolute must
review: Town full of culture and people are very warm. Mythological stories of Brahma is well explained and the Brahma kundapur is well maintained. Would suggest to go with a guide as there are lot of knowledge gain.

title: Famous ancient temple
review: It is a very beautiful historical ancient temple Brahma is known eminent god in Hinduism it is very great temple on a hill

title: The only temple in the world
review: Nice temple. A piece of advice, do not buy Gulkand sold outside as it is overpriced. Avoid services from Pundits who will contact you during your whole stay. You can visit all the places without much help.

title: Skip this
review: Nothing special, very busy, locals offer to look after your shoes and belongings for free when you go in then try to demand cash when you come out. We said no and still got out things back. The temple itself, is pretty disappointing, unless you have a religious reason for going as it is the only Brahma temple, i just wouldn't both

title: Among the very few Brahma temples
review: The temple is located close to the Pushkar pond. It is dedicated to "Chaturmukha Brahma"- the creator among the Trimurthis. The deity is worshipped as per traditions  only by Sanyasins and normal people just visit to seek blessings form the deity.

title: Great Temple
review: So Nice Temple of God Brahma Ji.

title: One of the very few Brahma Temples
review: Visited one of the very few Brahma Temples in the world. The temple was quite crowded on a Saturday evening but the crowd was managed quite well.

title: one of the very few temples for brahma in the world
review: You won't come across too many temples for Brahma in the world, but this temple is one such. Probably, the first in the world too. There is provision for keeping the bags and luggages, including the shoes and cameras in lockers before entering the temple. And inside also, we can feel that peaceful atmosphere

title: One and only..
review: This is one and only Brahma temple in the entire world. People from different part of India come and do worship to complete their wishes...

title: Find solace
review: It is a very simple temple and a small one too. It is accentuated by the Pushkar lake near by where hundreds of pilgrims visit every year. There are no architectural marvels to look at but the faith with which all pilgrims who flock to this temple make this temple so special. Do not forget to buy some sweet preserve of rose petals, rose drink and rose perfume

title: Good for first Time Visitors
review: It is said that one can not do puja in this temple but I am surprised why Prasad and Puja samgri shops are there. I visited the temple and as other temples, it was a good experience.

title: The only temple of bramha ji
review: Well! Pushkar is known primarily for this temple only. The only temple of bramha ji in the whole world. Visiting this temple might require more than a gentle effort since you have to climb up some stairs and go around in the temple itself, especially because its hot as hell except winters.

title: Wonderful experience
review: We were on 2 days family tour of Anger and Pushkar... Aimee is very nearby to Pushkar . Pushkar is famous for its Brahma  temple only one in world.  Temple - very nice, neat and clean,  security was at high alert..  Must visit..

title: A must place to visit
review: This place would be crowded but it's easy approach. An idol of Lord Brahma is worshiped here. We visited in the morning and darshan hardly took five minutes time.

title: Spiritual trip!!!
review: With so significant and vast spiritual history, a only Brahma temple which exist in the world. A rare temple and one should keep in their iternary.

title: Great Temple of Lord Brahma
review: Lord Brahma temple is the only and best temple in Pushkar near Ajmer ,no doubt it is very crowded  ,neat and clean ,one must to go.

title: Pls beware of strangers chasing your car on bikes.
review: When you enter the holy city, bikers starts chasing you. They will tell you to give only rs 50 for a guide. But when you reach brahma ghat you will be asked to take a pooja thali of just rs 11. After that one purohit comes for pooja and when he completes the pooja, you will be forced to pay 1100 or 2100 for parshad. So i request you all pls dnt hire any guide or biker for you.

title: "Only Brahma Temple in thew world"
review: Pushkar is full with amzing history and one is , this is the only Brahma Temple in the world. You can find many temples of other GOD and GODDESS , but this is unique and only one in the world.

title: Average temple
review: I went with just one other friend and the experience was rather stressful. We'd been pre-warned about hawkers and Brahmins, so just kept saying no all the time.

title: Don't Read At Your Peril!!
review: Travelling throughout India with a guide and this is the one place so far where he has given us a severe lecture in advance about hawkers etc....

title: Not a good experience
review: There are many "brahmins" who says that they are not there because they want your money, but they surely do. They tell all these stories about Brahman and his two wives and then, after the temple, they want to take you to the lake and the gate, where they'll want money. They will probably treat you this way if you're European.

title: ONLY IF YOU UNDERSTAND GOD
review: The temple is really beautiful and one and the only temple in the world (as said).

title: The only temple devoted to Lord Brahma
review: It is spiritual journey, visiting this temple after going through rituals at Savitiri Ghat on the banks of Pushkar Lake.

title: The only Brahma Temple in the world
review: I personally like this temple as it has names engraved on each and every tile of the temple, which in itself is unique for me. Never seen this in any other temple before.

title: One of its kind
review: There are very very few temples in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma and this temple in Pushkar is one of them.  The temple is a small temple where the deity is visible as soon as start climbing the stairs from the entrance.  It's a well maintained, neat and clean temple. An idol of Lord Brahma is worshiped here. We visited in the morning and darshan hardly took five minutes time.

title: Brahma temple
review: We visited as it was mentioned as the main temple to see in Pushkar, particularly as the largest Brahma Temple etc....

title: On way
review: This is not for foreigners

title: An ancient Lord Brahma temple
review: Visited the place in May 2014 - did a day trip and drove from Jaipur – the Pushkar Sarovar lake was clean and filled with water – be careful with people around – they try to loot by informing about various rituals one needs to perform – kindly be determined on what you plan to do – the Sarovar lake comes first and one can wash legs and hands in it – bath is also possible if planned - suggest to then go by walk to the temple – about one km away - the road through the street has lots of shop and antiques made of wood, brass, copper…etc –  a good bargain is the key slash at least 50% on quote to get a good deal – Photography is not allowed inside the temple.

title: Bramha mandir
review: Was gud even  and was meaningful reason thnks for the valuable trip enjoyed and had fun also the journey was comfertable and smooth.

title: The only Brahma Temple in the world
review: Nice temple...but nothing unusual. Avoid using personal car to visit it. It's a short walk from sarovar.

title: Amazing temple
review: Lord Brahma Temple is amazing. It was very crowded but peaceful. We feel divine here and very pleased. Must see place of Pushkar.

title: Must visit place
review: One of two Brahma temples in the world. It is a must visit place for all.

title: Lord brahma temple
review: World only temple who devotee to Lord brahma temple. Lord brahma is creator of the world very peaceful environment at lord brahma temple Side.

title: Brahma Temple Is one of The Temple In World
review: Lord Brahma Temple is only one temple in whole world this is why it is a famous place in Pushkar Ajmer. I found realy well in the temple and got new things and know about Lord Brahma and other Gods. Brahma temple awesome and clean temple in Pushkar and Ajmer i will review 5 Points and enjoyed there very well.

title: World Only Lord Brahma's Temple
review: One of the most sacred pilgrimage temple of LORD BRAHMA.

title: Brahma Temple
review: Through no fault of the temple, which I was very happy to have had the chance to visit, I found that a group of the most pushy, irritating, and just out for money dishonest type of people tend to cluster outside the temple creating noise and chaos.  Just walking by on the way somewhere else I was bombarded and mildly harassed every time.  In contrast to the generally kind and genuine people that seem to live and work in the rest of the town.  For sure, don't miss the temple, but make sure to bring your assertive voice and don't-mess-with me face.

title: Its my calling
review: Pushkar is a part of rajasthan so I don't need to explain much about its own beauty and reason to visit the part, except bramhaji's one and only temple in all over the world. Reason To know more about it practically, you have to make your presence in pushkar and get blessed in brahma temple.camera isn't allowed in the temple you may click picture from the outside of the temple Like other temples I didn't get plenty of pundits(priest) who are forcing people to do some hawans n give some donation directly to the pundit. If you want to give some donation as per your capacity (avoid what priest tell you),better give it in temple(credit and debit) and take  recipt with proper deeds. It can farely useful for betterment.

title: Better to stay on the sidelines and meditate
review: For the tourist it's not too remarkable temple, although formally it is considered the most special one in Pushkar. More allegedly anywhere there are no large temples dedicated to Brahma. Downstairs you leave your shoes and photocameras with mobile phones because  pictures here are prohibited. After climbing the stairs you get to the queue of pilgrims and clockwise come to the altarof  four-faced Brahma. Nothing special as to an aesthetic point of view. On the contrary, it is a wild, monstrous colors – red, blue, green of poisonous shades. However, it is possible to stay on the sidelines and meditate. But that's all.

title: Jai Lord Brahma
review: Lord Brahma was creator of the world and pushkar Lord Brahma temple is world works only Brahma temple.

title: Brahma Temple in Pushkar amazing
review: This temple is worth visiting and is very easy to find. This Pushkar Brahma Temple is the place of deep spirituality and thousands of devotees come here to pay homage to the many gods that reside in this temple town. It is dedicated to Lord Brahma and the only Brahma temple anywhere in the world, which is very interesting. The temple is built on the banks of the Pushkar Lake. There are many people both domestic and alien. The temple is open for worship between 6:00 am to 9:00 pm during summer. Nice place.

title: ''Only Brahma Temple On Earth''
review: I felt lucky & fortunate while ascending the stairs of only Brahma Temple on earth. This 2000 year old temple dedicated to creator Brahma Ji is located in Pushkar near sacred Pushkar lake. The temple can be easily reached walking in a lane & shops on both sides. It is said to take bath in the lake first before you visit the temple. One has to climb many marble steps to reach the temple. Inside the temple  atmosphere is very spiritual & one feels overwhelmed when the main deity is visible. I cannot think of anything else except for veneration of the place. Savitri Devi, consort of lord Brahma at Pushkar, has a temple overlooking the lake is situated high on a hill & worth visiting. Overall the place Pushkar & Brahma Temple worth & must visiting once in a life time!

title: Be carful from "holy people "
review: Temple is really amazing. Recommending to read the story online before visiting. There's no one that goes there and suppose to approach you or tell you he doesn't want money and there's a ceremony on the lake. Real holy person doesn't go and ask random people at the trample or at the lake to join a ceremony even if it looks super authentic. And if you fell for them somehow (they are good at what they do) remember you do not have to give them anything they will never do anything just raise your voice and they leave. That's what I did

title: Temple visit
review: Beautiful temple visit. Immersed in local culture. Unique stop, only Brama Temple. Must see if in this area. Wonderful shopping bazar.

title: Simple temple of Brahma
review: The Brahma temple is worth visiting as it is rare. It is well managed. the place is very peaceful but the shops where you remove footware can be very offensive as they sell offerings at exorbitant prices.

title: "an epitome of serenity amidst the bustling Pushkar"
review: Lord Bramha-ji temple is the most important destination in Pushkar for anyone having belief in Hinduism or who wish to understand it.

title: lord brahma
review: temple is old but famous because of lord brahma we need to cross many narrow streets to reach temple.

title: peaceful place
review: This place was peaceful and we didnt expirenced any kind of rush so it was kind of smooth for us , we did sit there for a while and had amazing time spent there , also the nearby market is good to shop up some local things

title: brahma temple
review: pushkar is famous for this temple. temple was normal but very old located with many narrow streets. photography was not allowed there.

title: OK-ish
review: That is the only temple dedicated to Brahma in India, but I felt I have seen more beautiful temples in other towns of India.

title: Only Brahma Temple
review: This place is a must visit since its the only lord Brahma temple. We had been here in the afternoon due to which the area near the lake was extremely hot so you cannot walk inspite of mats kept. It's advisable to visit here in the evenings or morning's

title: One and only temple of lord Brahma in the world
review: We visited pushkar in the month of June last year . It was a holy and spiritual visit . Pushkar was not in plan as we were going to shimla . But as it was not so far from ajmer we decided to visit pushkar .We have reached pushkar by 8:30 pm . We parked our car just beside the temple . We goes inside and their was no rush or crowd as I thought that the temple would be too crowded . The temple was was quit and spiritual  we have seen the whole temple it was great seeing and a man told us that the temple gets closed by 9 pm so we hurried and offered prayers in front of lord brahma and decides to leave temple after night aarti . We came out of temple by 9:15 pm . Then we decided to see the market and pushkar lake we ate food in a dhaba  just beside the temple the taste was too good . We leave pushkar by 11 pm and proceed for our further trip . One should visit the temple if he is in pushkar

title: Brahma temple
review: This one of the sacred Hindu temple situated in Pushkar in Rajasthan close to  the sacred Pushkar lake. This place has a very relaxing atmosphere.

title: Only Temple of Lord Bramha
review: Nice temple in Pushkar, Approx 10 KM away from Ajmer, taxi would be better option to visit this place. Small nicely built temple in this area and very famous its worth visiting this temple. Brahma temple considerd as the ten most religious places in the world and most religious place for hindu. Temple close from 1PM to 3PM so avoid this timing.

title: Must-see in Pushkar
review: A very colourful experience, and one of the most important temples in India (as my guide explained to me). It is lovely to learn more about the Hindu religion and culture. Photos inside are unfortunately not allowed.

title: Temple of Crator
review: The temple is located in Pushkar, you can reach here from Ajmer very easily. Hire a car from Ajmer city to Pushkar will take approx 40 - 50 minutes of drive as there is hilly area around. You can also take public transport options. In Pushkar, stay at any hotel take some rest and freshness than move to Lord Brahma Temple. You can also enjoy ride of cable car in Puhkar to reach Maata Temple. Best season to visit between September to March as during summers its very hot.

title: One of the few temples of Lord Brahma
review: Due to a curse, Lord Brahma is barely worshipped on earth.  There are very few temples in the entire world dedicated to Lord Brahma.  The Lord Brahma Temple in Pushkar is one of the most famous temples of Lord Brahma.  The temple is medium sized and has an idol of Lord Brahma. The idol is visible from outside of the temple. We went in the afternoon.  Very thin crowd. It was straightforward darshan of the deity.

title: One and Only Temple
review: This is the famous Brahma Temple situated in the mid of the Pushkar city. It is one of its kind and gives sense of achievement to have checked in. There are a number of small eating out spots serving traditional Rajasthani cuisines around this place. A small market is also there to purchase crafty items. The one big thing is, you are not allowed to carry your camera inside and hence a star less. In short, of you want to spend some time introspecting in silence, you can easily do that. A lot of devotees from across the nation are visiting here to witness the grandeur of one of the 3 most important lords in Indian Mythology. Brahma who is considered as the creator of the world has very less dedicated temples, as he was cursed as per the stories in the Mythology and this fact imparts a unique importance to this templwle.

title: Temple
review: First an individual needs to go the Pushkar Lake and offer the offerings . After that he should go the Brahma Temple .  Brahma Ji temple is right in the center and there other different temples also . Its a Very ancient temple . After offering prayers then person can buy GOD idols or some rose water and Gulukand .

title: Om Brahma Devaya Namaha
review: Significance of this temple lies in the fact that it is the only Brahma temple in the world. The temple has a large four armed statue of Lord Brahma and a silver turtle.  The temple is located besides the Pushkar lake. Lord Brahma is said to have performed penance at the site of this temple in the ancient period and performed Yajna.  Temple was less crowded in the morning time when we visited.

title: Clean well maintained very pious full of pilgrims
review: As part of our tour to Jodhpur my friend and I made a stop at Pushkar on March 29,2017.The porpoise was to see the Pushkar Sarovar lake and Brahma temple. It is believed that this lake was formed as a result of a lotus falling off from Lord Brahma’s hand. A holy dip in the Pushkar lake is considered to be sacred for Hindus as it is believed to wash away all their sins. The pure waters are also said to contain medicinal and curative powers. A visit to this lake along with the temples around it is a must when you are in Pushkar.

title: world only Lord Brahma temple in pushkar well managed and very peacefu place for mind and soul i will come again wehn i
review: world only Lord Brahma temple in pushkar well managed and very peaceful place for mind and soul i will come again when i come to pushkar.

title: Holy palace
review: Its a holy palace not a tourist destination. Temple was not well maintained as it is the only brahma temple all over the world.

title: Pushkar Brahma Temple
review: When you visit Rajasthan, make sure you visit Pushkar also. You can have two things here. One is the camel ride or safari. And the most important one is that you can reach the holy temple of Lord Brahma, the only such one in the world dedicated to Brahma. The atmosphere is calm and peace generating. You will live the experience and can boast later saying I've visited the one and only Brahma temple in the world.

title: Best Temple
review: What temples were made for, is defined here. The temple here, doesn't allow anyone to put flower or money. It is against the wish of the Almighty here. You may go for the Darshan and leave whatever you want in the collection box outside of the temple.

title: Brahma Temple in Pushkar
review: Well worth a visit to the 14th- century Jagatpita Temple as it's the only Temple of Brahma in the world. It's history is very interesting.  The Temple is not as well maintained as it should be, but one can feel the religious atmosphere. After leaving your shoes at the bottom of the steps there's a small clime up to a little courtyard where you can rest and soak up the atmosphere before entering the Temple (which isn't very big) to pay your respect and move on as other people want to do the same.  After enjoy a walk along the market to the lake a sacred Hindu site.

title: One and only temple of Brahma dev ji
review: Its an honor to visit such a spiritual temple and offer your gratitude to Lord Brahma. As this is the only temple of Lord Bramha.

title: World only lord brahma temple.
review: Lord brahma temple is world only temple devotee to lord brahma ans lord brahma is world creator, management at brahma temple is very good.

title: brahma temple pushkar
review: As it was our main destination of pushkar visit we reached here by guide of pushkar adventure desert camp here is a very interesting history in connection with this Temple. Temple is located at narrow streets on 20-25 stairs. There are strict entry protocols - shoes, cameras, phones.  We did street shopping in cheap price.

title: Heavenly
review: The only Brahma Temple in the world. Small, nice and clean. Before the temple is to be visit a small puja is to be performed at the Sarovar

title: Peace of mind
review: The only temple of brahmaji in the world. Peace of mind gurantee. Beautiful place. Must visit place if u there in ajmer or pushkar.

title: beautiful temple
review: One of the guide who with us when we go Lord Brahma temple he descried a whole story and myth about Lord Brahma temple.i feel very relaxed when enter the temple positive wave enter in your body when you enter lord Brahma temple.

title: One of only 2
review: From what I have heard there are only 2 Brahma temple, one in Pushkar and the other in Kher brahma, we  visited this during a day trip...and it was quite crowded as one would expect. advise: take care of your belongings

title: Famous Brahma temple in India.
review: When u arrive in Pushkar, everything u see and hear is about Brahma temple & story behind it. It is good  1km walk from gurudwara in main road. Only temple which is crowded and has security checks all along. Not allowed to take photograph. A small brahma idol and a shiva idol in lower basement are only shrines here. Can cover in 15 mins. Pls avoid guides as the history is painted everywhere. The main attraction is bazaar all along the road towards brahma temple which I can say best in Rajasthan with amazing food and shopping. You ll get everything from knife, dresses, hand made art work and many more. Best place to bargain and bring home many souvenirs.

title: only brahma temple in the country
review: there are no special prayers offered here to God. One just visits the temple and Gayatri Mandir. There are a lot of priests who abound there, trying to extort money from the visitors in the guise of religious rituals. Beware of this crowd and complete the visit with a prayer near the temple tank and exit.

title: hapy to visit brahma temple
review: To reach on temple we need to cross many narrow lanes. The temple was on hill top with tight security. No camera and shoes allowed here

title: The fascinating mythology baground makes this temple a great place to visit
review: Key features:

title: Fascinating
review: Having fought through the hawkers we arrived at the temple. No cameras allowed inside and you must take your shoes off. It's free to enter but there is a very strong pressure to donate to the temple. Well worth a few minutes to walk around. If you have a guide he will undoubtedly try to get you to buy something from the sellers at the temple gates. It's all of questionable quality so just beware if you do decide to buy.

title: Holly  place
review: One needs to understand this is a holly place for Hindu people. It is not a touristic place but a spiritual one. No pictures allowed, security checks. Don't expect to see architectonic marvels.

title: Soothing and calming as ever
review: This is my third visit to this temple and everytime I find it really soothing to the mind. Please refrain from big pujas the locals offer at the temple. Use your money judiciously while donating

title: World only temple who devotee to lord brahma .
review: World only temple who devotee to lord brahma .its a biggest temple for hindu mythology people and well managed by trust evening time aarti is very relaxing and give peace to heart and soul.

title: The peacefull place
review: This temple have a main attraction of te tourist in the pushkar... this temple is located i the pushkar which have a largest desrt in the rajasthan... it is the awesome place..

title: Very nice temple and view
review: Took the cable car up to the temple to watch the sunset. It cost 92 rupees per head and is really worth it. The cable car ride is comfortable and the views over Pushkar are spectacular. Recommended.

title: This temple is best
review: The best place to visit in the pushkar...it is only a one temple of brahma in world.. This temple is a very peacefull and enjoy the rajasthani culture from it.

title: Holy place
review: The bramha temple of pushkar is spritual and holy place.many silver coins spreaded over the floor of temple's mandap.god bramha's statue is very attractive.

title: Small temple but very famous
review: This is a relatively smaller temple but is famous for being one of the powerful temples dedicated to Lord Brahma on earth.  We reached the temple at around 11 am in the morning. The crowd was very thin. The broad stairs led to the sanctum of the temple. The sanctum is not very wide and is clearly visible from outside. It was more of straight forward darshan of the idol of Lord Brahma kept in the sanctum.

title: Could improve
review: Temple approach is surrounded by narrow streets and not disable friendly.  Hygiene needs to improve.  Shoe keeping has become a business. There should be an info room

title: UN HOLY LAKE PUSHKER
review: Keep away from any PRIEST who talks about Khama also be very careful of guides.

title: Be Careful for Guides and Priests that Fleece
review: The temple is good to visit but we would suggest read up about it and go yourself.

title: Suggestive
review: I was here with an Indian friend and, even if this temple has a special religious value, the high number of visitors and the "restricted time" available didn't allow me to probably fully appreciate it

title: Underwhelmed
review: I chose the day before holi to go which is probably where it all started off less than great for me. Way too many people! Closed between 1-3pm. No shoes, backpacks or cameras - must be left outside at bottom of the stairs before entering the temple. No photos allowed. Free entry. Reject any offers to guide you and show you how to make offerings. Expect to be shuffled in a circuit. Not very big or much to stay, not even very well maintained. It actually pains me to write this given its the only brahma temple in the world but i had high hopes on that basis and expected something quite grand and extravagant. I also dont intend to cause any offence to hindus with this review. This is strictly based on viewing it as a tourist site. On a religious basis, its completely different and perhaps this site is one that is truly intended only for the devout.

title: Review
review: Too crowded could be better and make way for people to go . But otherwise pretty good. Need more space tho

title: Jai lord Brahma
review: Very beautiful temple I had visited in my life and this is a only temple in the world who devotee to God Lord Brahma it's is situated  in pushkar local market and holy place for Hindu religious people.

title: Great temple
review: One of the few Brahma's temples which are greatly maintained. A must visit for everyone who visits pushkar.

title: The only Brahma temple in India!
review: The visit here is very special, since you can't see this kind of temple anywhere. Put your shoes and cameras in one of the lockers along the way (as photography is forbidden there) and enjoy the visit. Better if you have a guide or read about the place.

title: happy to visit the worlds only brahma temple
review: temple was attractive and located on a high plinth , very well maintained and better to leave your shoes and camera in shops located just near to temple rather then putting in lockers by government as there will be little rush .

title: Only Brahma Temple in the worls
review: Only brahma temple in India . The murti is nice. The offerings are just kept in front of the god. No puja happens in this temple.

title: Interesting
review: Our guide told us all about the Creator, the Organiser and the Destroyer and this time it all made sense. It's the only Dharma temple in the world.

title: Mixed review.
review: Beautiful spot but beware of aggressive attempts to get foreigners to donate money to temple. They are very skilled and relentless. Wished I had known. It unfortunately left me with a bad impression of the place.

title: Wonderful temple, a must see.
review: We were taken here by a guide who took us through the temple and explained a lot of this history; being Christian I can understand and perhaps relate to some of the explanations of this religion and found it very interesting.

title: Beautiful temple but bewar of people who will loot you in the name of religion
review: This happens to be the only Bhrama temple in the world hence has its uniqueness. The temple is small but has its spirituality intact with not not much of modernization,

title: Good place
review: It is situated at approximately 18 km from Ajmer.bus facility is also there.there is hilly road to reach this place.

title: The only temple dedicated to Brahma
review: Apparently, this is the only temple dedicated to the Lord Brahma, one of the holy trinity of  Hindu religion.

title: good going
review: our main aim to come to pushkar was to do worship at bherma temple and we did it. but when we heard that government is taken care to this temple, think it would be batter in coming years

title: Only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma
review: The most important temple of Lord Brahma,one of the holy trinity of hinduism, is visited by pilgrims after taking a ceremonial sacred bath in the Pushkar lake.It is also a practice that visit to the Brahma temple is followed by worship of his consort Gayatri, followed by visits to other temples at pushkar as convenient.

title: Not very impressive
review: As the tourist guide said it is a very important Hindu temple for those who worship the creator God - Brahma, I will expect a more gorgeous one.

title: A high seat of worship for Hindu
review: A temple for worship of Brahma, place is quite clean and peaceful, Visit to nearby Pushkar lake is a must do add-on.

title: Great place
review: Try to park your car near to the temple and beware of the guides they will start following you and providing their information and then will try to take money.

title: historical place could have been preserved better
review: A one of its kind temple of Lord Brahma the creator. Lot of commercialization around it, don't fall for any. Bags and shoes are not allowed inside so you can take a locker here for a nominal fee of Rs. 20/ and put your bag and shoes in it. the temple will not take more than 10 minute to visit.

title: One of its Kind
review: We walked through the narrow lanes depicting the arabian nights feeling in Pushkar, to reach the only Bramha (Creator of the World) Temple in the world. The temple was on a hill top and amongst some tight security. When we reached to take the blessings of Lord Brahma , the feeling was really special and so was the story of the lord. For al those belivers in the hindu mythology it is a must visit site.

title: Pretty important Temple but not much to see
review: One of the main attractions in Pushkar. Not a lot to 'see' but an important Temple in the Hindu religion.

title: People pushing you through and asking for donations
review: Even with a guide to explain the significance to us, this sight had no magic for us.  Maybe it was the paying for the locker to hold our bags (which was not necessary) or the information that it is tradition to buy something in the market after visiting the temple or the banging on the box as you walked out to make a donation (granted this is partially about having a bad guide, not necessarily the temple itself) but the experience was flat and we wished we had just glanced up at it from the street.  Even the spots the supposedly had significance we were pushed past it quickly by people behind us and it felt more like the crazy frenetic pace of all of India than something spiritual to us.

title: Pay Obeisance to Brahmaji.
review: Fortunately cars are not allowed on the narrow streets of Pushkar as you walk to the Brahma Temple.  Mind the motorbikes though.  Take note of the shops along the way and people watch the hippy types with piercings and tats.

title: The only rare temple of lord brahma
review: Ypu can find lot of temple of many deities but its rare to find temple of lord brahma. In hindu mythology there are 3 main  deities  (god) brahma , vishnu and mahesh.  In Indian mythology it is beleived that lord brahma is a creator of living being and earth. A very holy place to visit.

title: Brahma temple.. one and only one..
review: Brahma temple is located in pushkar rajasthan is a holy place for the hindus abs it's one of the most sought places by the tourists all around the world. On reaching there either by cab or state buses its better to take some guide who can explain you the history of the place very well. First yi have to visit the pushkar lake where people are making the offerings especially flowers. After that you can return and visit the one and only one temple for brahma in the world. Photography is prohibited inside the temple but allowed outside. Footwear has to be kept with the lockers available outside. You can see the beautiful temple, pray and come back and have shopping at the many shops available outside. It's one of the best places to visit in india, so don't miss it.

title: Nice
review: Super busy and people pushing every which way they can. Very small temple and no pictures or shoes allowed therefore be prepared. Loved seeing all the coins left by royal family and the Ghandi family.

title: The famous Brahma Temple
review: Our visit to Pushkar I was told was to see the Brahma temple, which is the only one of its kind in India. So I was expecting to see something very big and grand.

title: One-of-a-kind
review: Had to do a quick visit to this temple, since our driver/guide shared that this Brahma Temple was one of a kind (or maybe very few) in India.  It was worth it for the experience -- the temple was not very different or very big, but it was full of many Indians from around the country making offerings, pushing and praying to the god Brahma. Many shops and restaurants surround it, just steps away from Pushkar Lake.

title: Not worth a trip
review: In my opinion Pushkar and its Brahma temple are not worth a trip, it is much better to stay longer in the "pink city" Jaipur. The town is one big dirty market place with no places of interest, maybe with exception of this small Brahma temple near the lake. The only attraction for kids can be a camel ride.

title: Nothing stood out here for me
review: I walked here from where my driver parked near where they do the camel safaris. I for some reason lacked sense of direction that day and took my a while to find it. So to be fair I was already a bit wound up. When I arrived fell sucker to a guide showing me around. I should know  better. The temple itself just did not stand out for me, probably because of my mind set. I did enjoy then going down to the lake front after to make an offering.

title: Exclusive Brahma
review: Just 1 odd km from the Marwar bus stand (pushkar) brings you to this small and only temple in the world where lord Brahma is worshiped all year around (Temple remains closed in the afternoon for 2 hours (1:30-3pm). Brahma ghat is just outside the temple. One can see the savitri temple on the hilltop from the back side of this temple. Just outside the temple complex (few meters from the main gate) opp the hotel taj palace is a small lassi shop who makes delicious gulkand lassi (pure and tasty). Rest all are fake. To the right of temple gate is the biggest leather shop in whole of pushkar. Try this too. Check out local handmade shrugs (very beautiful

title: One of the 8 Brahma temples in the world
review: The pushakar Brahma temple is one of the few temples in the world which is dedicated to the lord Brahma. There is a Rajasthan artifacts shop just outside the temple from where one can buy various traditional artifacts and dresses of Pushkar. The temple is small and is situated close to the pushkar lake

title: Over crowded
review: The temple is supposed to give enough time to the devotees who travel across states and countries to visit this holy place however, the devotees were not allowed to even stand for 1 whole minute.

title: Can't bring your daypack in
review: Actually, it's not the only Brahma temple. There are one or two others in India, though this is definitely the foremost of them. Don't bring a daypack or anything valuable. They won't let you bring much in and there is nowhere safe to leave anything but your shoes. There is quite a commercial feeling around the place. I went at sunset and it was crowded, not at all peaceful.

title: Lucky to visit
review: Pushkar is  a temple dedicated to Lord Brahma, the Hindu god who created the universe,This temple is open morning 7AM to till 9PM,but its closed 1.30pm to 3 PM,I did street shoping for my family,and bought two Rajasthani turban.Temple is very clean,and was very lucky to visit the same.

title: One of its kind
review: The temple seems to be average looking but its the only Brahma temple in the world so has great significance.

title: Insight into Hindu beliefs
review: Before entering the Temple as this is a deeply significant Hindu site - there are strict entry protocols - shoes, cameras, phones ect are strictly enforced!!

title: Beautifull Temple Complex.. A Must visit place
review: Loved the small temples dedicated to each god separately, especially the Shiv ka Guffa. The Brahma temple, is a good opportunity to connect with the creator of the Universe. The outside market offers good bargains, especially on rose products which seem to be locally grown.

title: Onky One
review: This is the only Brahma Temple, so 1 should make a visit to this place. the total time required to visit this place is approx 1 hour. There are many ghats near to the temple which shd be visited.

title: Great temple
review: I thing God Brahma Temple is only one temple in the world.This temple is very famous and historical place this temple present in Rajasthan puskar

title: Family Trip
review: Most famous place at Pushkar.Only this place has idol of Brahma.So must visit if you are believe in God.

title: Cheap business in the name of God
review: If you are visiting this place, do no fall in the trap of the brokers of the temple, they are there only to loot you in the name of God. Just go visit the temple and get out of that place, else you will find yourself being forced to pay with no logical explanation. Avoid brokers and you will come out happy visiting the place.

title: Glad I visited
review: I really enjoyed visiting this temple and was glad my travelling companion made arrangements to stop in Pushkar. Definitely the most crowded temple we visited, but also very interesting. Bring your own thoughtful offering, as opposed to buying what is available at the entrance.

title: Only one such temple in India
review: Brahma, the creator  of human beings accirding to Hindu mythogy is worshipped only in  Pushkar in Rajashthan. Local worshippers visit this temple almost regularly as they have great faith in the Lord.Other believers from across the country also come to have a   darshan of the Lord. Tourists to Pushkar invariably visit this temple.

title: Unique temple
review: This temple is unique in that this is the only temple in India dedicated to Lord Bramha. The legend says that Lord's first wife Savitri Devi cursed Him and said that there will be only one temple for Him and there won't be any offerings to Him at this temple.

title: One of the very few Lord Brahma Temple
review: We visited the Lord Brahma temple when we travelled to Jaipur on a leisure trip. Lord Brahma is a Hindu temple situated at Pushkar close to the sacred Pushkar Lake. The temple is one of very few existing temples dedicated to the Hindu creator-god Brahma in India and remains the most prominent among them.

title: Nothing Special
review: This is supposedly the unique temple dedicated to Lord Brahma.

title: Brahma temple
review: Its the only Brahma temple in the World....its near Pushkar lake...very nice temple..but not well maintained...to reach the temple you need to climb around 20-30 stairs.....place is crowded during Pushkar mela....must visit-

title: Not for couples and Teenagers
review: Beware of beggars and Local Guides will start with Rs20/- and end with Rs200/-.

title: Oldest and only Brahma  temple
review: Very old Lord Brahma temple . Nothing special except to to the Darshan. just like all other Hindu temples

title: Sacred and only one in this universe...
review: Great temple, having only one in the world. The whole cabinet is present as per the Hindu mythology. The Vishnu, Kuber, Indra and Maheswar is also present there. Good place to visit.

title: God of Brahma's Temple
review: This is a Most Popular Temple of god of Brahma. This is awosome Place in puskar, Ajmer and also we have stay 2 days there for international fair.

title: One timpale in would
review: Is really bast tampal  in would one biggest God in India bahrma temple Pushkar man market and off the market patter the temple sawetary temple one hill

title: The only one
review: There is only one brahma temple in all of India. Is incredible ! Very good architecture, good way to get there, on top of the mountain. You must go and see it and enjoy it ª

title: Unique - Only One temple in world as Brahma the Main God
review: Must visit, Must visit. Only temple for Brahma in the world as Main God. Brahma Tejas the word is perfect at this temple. Brahma as per purana is Beautiful. The god seen here is Beautiful with smiling face. Go people, go and get ashirvad from our Praja Pitha. Amazing Temple with mind feels joy when reach there.

title: Lord Brahma Temple in Pushkar, Ajmer
review: Lord Brahma Temple in Pushkar in Ajmer. Wonderful Temple and place. This is the most important Temple of Lord Brahma. There is a very interesting history in connection with this Temple that can be found in the Internet. Near by, there is a kund or pool connected with Lord Brahma as well.

title: Interesting
review: Enter with the worshippers,they are kind and polite .don't take photo of people unless they agree.should behave with respect and be quite.

title: Beautiful temple
review: This temple is the worlds most popular temple , I reached there n saw , a very descent temple ... please visit if not yet visited ...

title: One of the few temples in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma
review: The Lord Brahma temple in Pushkar is one of the very few temples in the world dedicated to the Lord Brahma. The temple is an off white colored structure.  As per Hindu belief, Lord Brahma is the creator of the universe.  He is worshipped in this temple. We visited during the morning hours. There were very few people in the queue. Completed the darshan in 10 minutes.  The temple is very well maintained.

title: Spiritual awakening
review: The one and only BRAHMA TEMPLE in the world makes Pushkar a distinguished place to visit. The temple awakens ones spirituality. It makes you ponder on the fact to have only one such temple in the world..Visit it and get the answer!

title: A temple worth visiting
review: A very unique temple for Lord Brahma perhaps only 3-4 Temples in India still have Brahma shrines. One at Thirupattur in Tamil Nadu Belur in Karnataka are the other two that I am aware. The brief is Lord Shiva took the form of a Linga with out end. Then Brahma and Vishnu were competing with each other and to determine who is superior told each other whoever sees the end of the Linga is the more powerful. Vishnu went downward and Brahma upward and both could not find the end. But Brahma found a flower called Thazham pu and asked where she was coming from. The pride filled flower said from the TOP of the Shiva Linga. Brahma thought he could claim he saw the TOP end of the Linga and use the flower as witness. He did so and told Vishnu that he had seen the TOP and that he is more powerful hence. Knowing this Lord Shiva got angry and cursed that there won't be any temple for Brahma and thazhampu will not be used for worship. Only four Temples thus were left for worship of Brahma. This is believed to be one of them. So worth the visit.

title: The Brahma Temple in Pushkar!
review: For all the hype of being the only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma, this was a let down. The temple itself was low-key - no extraordinary paintings or architecture.  We just saw the deity for a few seconds and were out.

title: Watch out for 'donation' scam
review: Arrived at temple, told we were to leave our shoes and bags at the gate with a shop. For a fee of course.

title: Peaceful!!
review: Its the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world and indeed a must visit for Rajasthan travellars for its uniqueness and beatiful lake.

title: CALM!!!
review: DEVINE and calm

title: The only Brahma temple on the banks for Pushkar lake
review: This is a small and clean temple. Only USP is it is the only temple in the world dedicated to lord Brahma. Otherwise it is like any other normal temple, not very organised. But definitely worth a visit atleast for Indians. Pushkar lake too is a serene place where you feel spiritual and blessed.

title: "Can b better"
review: As this is the only temple of brahma ji so it must b well maintained so that it gives a peacefull n better feel..bt it wasn't..

title: Lord Brahma temple, Pushkar
review: This is a beautiful temple.  Very small but one of the oldest.  We were not able to really appreciate it from a spiritual point of view because we were there during the time of a pilgrimage.  Although we appreciated being there to witness the parade through the streets that took us directly to the temple, we were not able to "visit" and appreciate the temple due to the masses there.  On the whole it was an experience to remember.

title: Must visit if you are in Pushkar
review: The temple is quite small and the rituals short as well. However, the Pushkar lake and the history behind it was great. Be careful if you get a guide. He might con you into doing a ritual which would cost you 10 bucks but might force you to donate Rs. 250 or more for your family's well being...

title: Lord Brahma temple
review: This temple is Only one Lord Brahma temple in India . Camera  is not allowed but locker is available for Rs 10/- . Slippers can be kept at the same place for free. The atmosphere is peaceful

title: One time visit only
review: This temple is like any other regular temple but it's just that Brahma is worshipped here.

title: My first visit
review: I never felt that i will feel that great in brahma temple ...i went for relaxation but few minutes in brahma temple gave me peace of mind ..and it is really beautiful i must say everyone should visit it Atleast once .."GREAT "

title: Not a must visit temple
review: Its the only brahma temple in India. But there is nothing much in the temple, I mean no work of art involded inaide it. One may skip it. Also theaurroundings have a lot of small shops. The approach road is narrow. This temple is only for serious devotees.

title: Unique and Spiritual
review: As the main place of worship for Brahma and one of the few temples dedicated to him, this is a must visit for a spiritual traveler.

title: Only the temple in india
review: Its my first time yo visit pushkar and also my my first solo trip really like the place and the vibes people are so Nice and the brahma temple I heard that it is the only brahma temple in the world so glad to be here the architect and the story of Temple is such interesting one must Visit again .

title: Bad experience
review: Too many people pretending to be guides and forcing money from you. Beware of them. Temple itself is not so great. Have seen better temples in India.

title: Quaint & small temple (only brahma temple)
review: Is a small , but clean temple with picturesque alleys leading up to it.  Temple closes at 13.30 so make sure to reach before that.

title: Horrible Experience
review: I don’t want to write review for this holy place but I have to so that persons visiting this place should be aware of local goons roaming around in this area. I visited this place during our official picnic. But we encountered some of the bad elements of the society who tried to fight and threaten my colleagues. They will charge for some kind of toll while entering the area which is neither paid to the government nor used for any kind of development. Be prepared for same kind of warm welcome before planning to visit. Temple is very nice and the temple is one of very few existing temples dedicated to the Hindu creator-god Brahma in India.

title: Beautiful temple !
review: First let me be clear that this review is for believers in God / mythology . The architecture of the temple does not hold any out standing carvings or intricate  design to catch the fancy of art students. It might interest history students and students of religious studies and theology. For people like me who believe in God it has a special place as it is the first temple for Brahma and was the only one till a long time till a few more cropped up later. The four headed  Brahma is attractive and we can see all four thanks to a mirror kept on the back side of the idol. Photography is not allowed inside which is sad. The God Brahma is not offered any Pooja as he has a curse from Lord Shiva to this effect. You can offer Tarpana to your gore fathers on the banks of the Pushkar lake with water and flowers. Do it - Sukoon milta hai ! The by lanes near the temple have many attractive shops worth looking at.

title: Glad I went but not a great experience
review: I was hoping to go and see the temple and the lake and learn more about the rituals the Hindu people carry out.  Instead we were beset on all sides by the most aggressive beggars I have ever experienced in all my travels.  Even the Brahmin at the Lake who extorted a donation from me was unsatisfied by the amount I gave; first he assured me that a larger donation would assure more good karma to my family, including helping my dead parents reach nirvana, then when I opened my wallet to give the amount I'd promised he spied my emergency US money folded inside and demanded that, too.  After I'd given my money to charity, he wanted more for himself personally to support his wife and family.  Then on the way back to our vehicle we were assaulted on all sides, including by a street musician who I had to push out of the way to get into the car and who kept banging on the car window as we pulled out.

title: Terrible- bad karma give a miss
review: We had a self appointed guide who followed us around. Not able to tell us anything about the place, but we let him be. Then taken to the lake. Split my mom and I up with different Bhrama's. Pushy to donate large amount of rupees. When I offered an amount they were not happy with they pushed my donation away and said it wasn't enough. We had to leave in a hurry, I didn't feel very spiritual after that. Our self appointed guide did't like his donation either. Our taxi driver had warned us about the situation and so we had very little money on us. Be warned if you are a tourist. I would rather give Pushka a miss and will inform our travel agent too. Whole town holds no appeal to me at all and overall bad experience.

title: The only Brahma temple in India
review: Great Experience - I wish it would be a little more organised. It is crowded and no lines people are jumping on each other. But if you are focused and there for prayer then you don't need to worry. Good place to be.

title: Holy temple
review: Only Brahma temple in India as they say. Very nice. Some stairs to climb before reaching to the temple. Happy to be there

title: Only temple of Lord Brahma in the world
review: It is said that this is the only temple of Lord Bramha in this world and Pushkar is known for this. The temple is walking distance from the lake. there is a main deity and numerous others surrounding the main deity. There is a police posted at the gate and complex is small enough to be covered in a short duration. One should avoid the festive season when the queues are pretty long.

title: The one and only
review: This is one of a kind  it is very colourful

title: She must be the best
review: My first time and first night in pushkar,and it was a long time that I wished to see the one..after a circle walk,suddenly I was there,downstairs of simple and beautiful brahma temple..it was the first step...

title: Colourful!
review: The only Bhrama temple in the world, the bright and colourful temple had a charm of its own. The only drawback was the crowd.

title: Pushing for donations
review: Worst experience ever. The people who are in charge are forcing you to donate a lot of money while other Indians will have space to have their own moment and decide what to give. Once we were giving a donation they were dissatisfied about the amount. In my opinion those people deserve nothing. They ruined the moment and my experience of visiting temples in India.

title: Wonderful!
review: Recommending a young teenager who explained the complete history of the temple and helped me along the whole way - Govind.. Such a smart delightful fellow. On to the visit - First visit the pushkar lake. In fact just follow what the guides tell you to do. After metaphoric snan in the holy water proceed to the temple. Ensure that you visit the Durga, brahma and the Shiva stals. Lovely peaceful experience.

title: No din, no queue, so unassuming
review: I am sad that the only Brahma temple in the world is so unassuming, not many people thronging it. Its at the end of a long pleasurable walk along the shopping roads of Pushkar. A stiff climb up and there you are. Not even many prasad shops around, so not too touristy!

title: Small but significant brahma temple
review: This is an important temple as there are few brahma temples. This was busy and quite a small area so you had to keep moving to give your flowers. In order to go you probably would need an appreciation of the temple's significance as it is not the biggest or most ornate so it depends what you are looking for.

title: Unimpressive temple
review: With this being a huge place of pilgrimage I was expecting something grand or even impressive but actually it was very much the opposite. Dirty badly maintained and painted badly in gourde colours it was very disappointing. The history and legend behind it was interesting but the building itself was not worth the visit & won't be memorable for its architecture compared to other temples we visited.

title: The one and only
review: Everyone knows about the story of Brahma temple in Pushkar. But visiting the temple is a great experience.

title: must visit temple
review: if you are in pushkar must visit this temple because its only a temple in area and its worth. beautiful pillers and colors.

title: Simple yet a powerful message
review: The only temple in the world of lord Brahma. Captivating story telling with a message 'patience is a virtue'.

title: BRAHMA TEMPLE NEAR SACRED LAKE
review: temple of brahma is in pushkar near pushkar lake . on kartik purnima peoples comes take bath in lake & do darshan in temple .it seems this temple is 2000 years old .brahma temple is situated only in few places in which pushkar is most important.

title: Bharama Temple
review: Bhrama temple is main attraction in pushkar as there is only one Bhrama temple in all over the world .

title: A holy temple
review: It is the only Brahma temple in India and so it deserves a special mention. It inculcates a holy and sacred feeling amongst the travelers.

title: Interesting place to visit
review: We visited this enroute from Jodhpur to Jaisalmer.

title: the walk through the bazaar makes it worthwhile!
review: If you love walking through a market, looking for deals that entice you, local merchandise at atrractive prices, then do visit the Brahma temple, for it is surrounded by one such huge market. The temple is a nice clean place with a soulful   statue of lord Brahma- the creator. The compound has more statues which should be seen, especially the Pashupatinath statue which was exceptional. Apart from that there is not much more and you come out of the temple within 15 minutes. No pictures are allowed and the slippers have to be left outside. But no worries, the local shopkeepers help you out here as safe keepers. And they did not ask us for any charges. After you have visited the temple, back it is in the bazaar.

title: Unique Brahma temple
review: This is the only temple in the world dedicated to Brahma, the Lord of creation. It is built in marble and is decorated with silver coins. It has a red spire and a swan which is Brahma's symbol. A marble statue of Surya, the Sun-God is placed at the entrance of the temple. The sanctum has a four-faced idol of Brahma.

title: Peace and serenity
review: The brahma temple is lord brahma's only temple in the world and has it's own unique story which you can easily get to know it if you talk to the localitis or even temple's pujari. The temple is surrounded by an amazing market where the specialities are camel leather goods, authentic jewellery and lip smacking mal pudas. You should also visit the ghats and jain temple nearby.

title: An  rare temple of its kind!!
review: The Brahma temple located on the banks of the Pushkar lake is a must visit place while visiting Pushkar. The temple is at a height and one needs to climb a number of steps to reach it. The white surroundings make the temple look even more holy and pilgrims throng the place after a dip at the lake. A winter visit is recommended as the summer months are expected to be very harsh. A  very popular place at the time of the cattle mela, held in mid November this year.

title: Good temple
review: The only Brahma temple in India. Nice temple, was very crowded. Got a good darshan of the deity. The market is also located nearby and you get good stuffs over here.

title: You'll get tired
review: It's special as they say because it would be the only Brahma temple. The temple however is not that special, normal like many many other ones. What makes it special is that it's incredible busy, to many people. A lot of "guides" who insist to join you, ignore them, they all ask a lot of money afterwards. You are not allowed to take any personal stuff inside so you have to put it in not stable looking closets. Inside you are prey and they try to persuade you to do a ritual but if you do you will end up in a long discussion about the money you have to pay, they ask easily 2000 roupies per person so don't let you talk in to it.

title: Unique temple dedicated to the Creator of the universe
review: One of the rarest temple in India as there are very few temples dedicated to Lord Brahma.  The temple is off white structure. Small but very holy place where the creator of the universe is worshipped. Visited it during afternoon hours. No queues. We got direct darshan within minutes.

title: Only brahma temple im world
review: Religious significance of the temple attracts lot many devotees and tourists. Photography is not allowed in tbe temple. Its not a very big temple but its significance is hige throughout the world.

title: Only brahma temple in the world
review: It's the only brahma temple in the world and attracts a lot of crowd. Beware of the choas and crowd. Also, don't pay heed to any guides or buy any flowers etc from the people outside the temple. They pester you unnecessarily. There is Nothing special in terms of decorations or construction.

title: No big deal....!
review: Like any other temple....unless you are a devout believer. If you are a hardcore hindu believer then maybe worth your time.

title: The Only Brahma Temple in India
review: Brahma temple is really beautiful and is located right in the heart of the Pushkar city...Due to this very reason each and  every alley in Pushkar will lead you to Brahma temple.

title: Good peaceful religious place
review: As this is the only temple of Lord Bramha ji gives you peaceful generosity in mind and body. Be peaceful.

title: One and Only!
review: It is the only temple of Lord Brahma in the whole world. The temple is always filled with devotees. There is strict security outside the temple. The street in which the temple is located has many local eateries that have been running from generation. Try kadhi-kachori and bhajia at Pushkar Chat Bhandar. Also the malpua from the street shop. It is amazing.

title: Overcrowded during Pushkar Fair
review: We had visited this temple on 13th Nov 2016. At that time Pushkar Fair was going on. The temple was overcrowded. This is the only Brahma temple in the world. During Pushkar Fair, huge no of tourists & devotees throng to Pushkar for worshipping Brahmaji. We saw many foreign tourists also. We had to stand in a long queue and time for darshan of Brahmaji idol was very less as the huge crowd was pushing from the back. We had to walk more than one kilometer from the parking place to the temple.

title: One of a kind
review: Very good temple to visit. Only one temple in India. Clean, neat and organized. Our tour guide helped us alot by explaining the significance of the temple.

title: Brahma Temple
review: Its a beauty. Do visit the horse stable and cow shed as well. It is a must visit site as it first temple of Lord Brahma, second one is Khedbrahma in Gujarat which is lesser known and there Brahma ji tilled and ploughed land himself and a river flows there. So practically, this is not the only Brahma temple.

title: The only bramha temple across world
review: This is the one and only bramha temple across the world so it is obviously worth visit and recommended

title: the only temple but ....
review: needs lots of improvement by local public and local buddies. we have heard the only temple in world and lack of facilities.

title: crowded but well organized and secured
review: My father visited this place on 14-nov-16. Clean place, well maintained. Very crowded due pushkar festival. Lot of policeman managing the security.

title: Must visit
review: One of the oldest Brahma temples in the world, its a must visit place for everyone who set their foot in the holy town of Pushkar.

title: Temple of great importance.
review: This is the only ancient brahma temple in the world & a must visit for the religious. the pushkar lake is also of great importance. but please beware of the pundits here who will skillfully extract huge amount of money from you. dont hire any guide or pundits here even if you hire just use them till the brahma temple, after that go on your own to pushkar lake. because these pundits will perform some puja with you at the lake & extract money in such a way that it will be hard to deny.

title: Lacklustre temple for the god of creation
review: Went on a day trip to Pushkar and Ajmer with family of 5.

title: Couldn't even get near to it
review: As this is the only temple of it's kind in the world, the amount of pilgrims pushing, shoving and pressing towards it was unfathomable! I hate crowds so I pulled out before we even got near the temple. Indians don't do queuing and don't mind pushing and shoving. Not for me. I'd love to have seen inside but there was no way I was going to stay in bed hay crush for at least 1 hour to do so. Also if you have a phone or camera in you you have to go and pay to put them in lockers before you go in. To me, even if we'd got inside, there wouldn't have been anything remotely spiritual or calm about it. Way too crazy for me!!

title: Nice stop on your tour of Pushkar
review: This is the only Brahma Temple in the world that is actively worshipped at. Do be prepared to leave your bags and shoes at the bottom of the stairs outside. If you are not ok with leaving bags and cameras etc do leave them at your hotel or take turns going in so some one can watch your belongings. This is an interesting attraction with an interesting history.

title: 2nd Visit to Seek Lord Brahma's Blessings
review: Pushkar is most significant place for performing the the Shraadh & Pindadaan for the departed ancestors to stay in peace and be happy. Lord Rama and Pandwa came here at Pushkar to perform here Shradha ritual for their ancestor.

title: Nothing spectacular
review: The only USP is that it is the only known temple of Bramha, So if you are there and you are a believer, do visit. Nothing spectacular. Note: They do not allow you to take camera/cases, bags inside.

title: Rubbish experience for a tourist don't bother
review: The temple is nice enough, though nothing really special in terms of look.

title: Simple yet magnificient temple
review: Simple temple with ample time for darshanam. This unique temple is worth visiting and it lives upto the standard that this temple is Tirth of Tirths

title: Mismanagement at every level!
review: The Brahma Temple in Pushkar is the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world and hence historically quite important. It's a shame that the authorities can't manage the crowd well despite knowing how many people visit the temple everyday!

title: Only temple of Brahama
review: It is said, this is the only temple of Brahama. The exteriors of the temple is painted in red, looks beautiful.

title: Puskar
review: Considered to be the only Brahma temple in the world . There is history of this temple and would request to find more details on internet

title: Packed. Bring slippers
review: My wife and I visited the Brahma temple when visiting Pushkar during a tour of northern India.  We arrived on the last day of the famous annual camel festival. In addition, there was a supermoon that night (14 November 2016), which had significant religious significance to Hindus. This resulted in hundreds of thousands of pilgrims and people from the region converging on this relatively small town. And the Brahma temple is one of the most holy sights in the town, so was absolutely packed. Fortunately, we visited in the afternoon, when it had quietened down somewhat.

title: excellent
review: this brahma temple is one and only one temple of brahma in india. also sorrounding is also very good and there ae many small-small temples around this place.

title: Lord Brahma temple
review: Only Brahma temple in the world. Must visit in a lifetime. It is small temple, usually crowdy during pushkar fair. After temple, you can take round of pushkar lake and various ghats.

title: A must visit for religious reason
review: The fact that this is one of the very few temples dedicated to Brahma (creator god according to Hinduism) makes it special. The temple structure is not very big (like other Hindu temples) but the structure is quite old and that makes it special. The vibrant red and blue color on the temple walls give it a very different look. The temple remains closed from 1.30 pm to 3 pm so people going there should plan accordingly.

title: Beware of cheaters
review: Taking you in then charging as if they were tourist guides

title: Not so beautifull
review: And the indian guys allways just ask for money!! I expected for much more for a "one of a kind" temple

title: Nice
review: This is a great temple to visit near Pushkar Lake. The culture, the people bring to you a new experience.

title: Interesting
review: This is a holy place in the hindu culture with many prayers giong on daily . Observe and respect and leave .

title: Wow
review: Not as big as I expected but the history surrounding this temple is quite interesting. The guides in there do not cost you anything (they work for the temple) it's free entry and ladies you don't need to over up although I did. The steps to and from the lake are not that bad if you struggle to walk and I saw a young lad helping an old foreign lady down the steps. A must see!!

title: Be awere of people offering flowers in the entrance
review: Just be aware of people offering flowers in the entrance of the temple. Just say no thank you. Otherwise they take you to the lake and push you to leave a 50 Euros "ofrend" to clean your karma in a very violent way. Everything else in pushkar is just beautifull. This is my humble opinión.

title: Great temple
review: Apart from the fact that guides running around and greedy people asking you to keep chappals and buy prasad instead, temple in itself is worth a visit. You will find some heavenly bliss once you stand and pray there for sometime.

title: Interesting history
review: While the temple and its premises isn't something that is unique, it is still a unique experience given its mythological background.
