It is also nicely set with the pushkar lake/ghats providing the backdrop to the temple.  Just wish it were kept a lot more clean.  Given that we visited in the 1st week of October, it was just perfect

title: super corwded, people scam you
review: be careful of guides coming and interacting with you, the intention is to take you all around and scam you for money. If not interested say it right away. super expensive stalls around

title: Temple ruined by scams
review: We enjoyed our day trip to Pushkar but be wary of the donation scam by "guides" who demand and bully you into donating large sums of money at the lake or to guide around a temple. Ruined the whole experience.

title: Must see
review: Have been to this temple twice before.This time visited with parents.This is the only temple of Brahma in the world so people from all over the world come here.Daytime its very crowded. We went to attend its 5:30 morning aarti which was very good, very few people around.After aarti you can simply sit there for sometime, enjoy the ambience and after this can have your morning tea at nearby stalls outside temple. Photography is not allowed but saw many people clicking photographs from their mobile phones.

title: Only Brahma Temple
review: Nothing else needs to be said about this temple, as this is the single temple of God  Brahma, creator of the universe, on this planet.

title: One temple in world
review: Brahma temple is pushkar is only the one temple of Brahma in whole world. Every year Millions of local and tourist visit this place.

title: Only Brahma Temple in the World
review: We spent a few minutes touring this temple and hearing about its history.  It was fun to ring the bell as we entered and the history was very interesting.

title: Not worth it
review: The temple is very small. There is nothing really interesting to see. It is just one more temple, and the fact that they charged us for the locker and for leaving the shoes makes it a bit disappointing. There are temples more beautiful to see and free of charge. I think it is more for indians to pray for their god as it is a holy city.

title: Spirituality Everywhere
review: This was my first visit to Brahma Temple, experience was really amazing, I found Peace of mind, fresh air ,small town bazaars for traditional shopping, the only statue of Lord bramha in world!!  Must visit.

title: Unique temple
review: Must visit temple for hindus. Brahmins are originated from Brahmaji. Very spiritual, calm. It is on height. few steps. Be aware of the shop keepers as everyone want you to purchase something from there shop. They try to divert you. Stick to your plan.

title: ONLY TEMPLE OF BRAHMA IN THIS WORLD
review: the temple is believed to be 2000 years old. The temple is mainly built of marble and stone stabs. It has a distinct red pinnacle (shikhara) and a hamsa bird motif. The temple sanctum sanctorum holds the central images of Brahma and his second consort Gayatri

title: Went for Brahma Ji temple darshan .
review: Temple area is crowded but surrounded by sarovar hence location is perfect. Please be aware of fake guide and priests.

title: not worth the visit
review: We had been told to visit this temple by every person we met who found out we were going to Pushkar. We didn't look up what it was, we simply took everyone's word that we must visit it.  However upon arriving at the temple we weren't even sure we'd got to the right place.  We were then harassed by several people trying to take our shoes, purse and camera to put in their lockers as apparently none of the above items can be taken into the temple.  Finally we relented and put our belongings into a locker, we then proceeded to walk to to the temple amongst the throng of barefoot worshippers.  The floor was absolutely filthy, it smelt and was far overcrowded, so much so you could hardly see the statue to which people were praying to.

title: Lovely temple, bit crowded and quickly over.
review: Maybe we were temple-ed out but we were not blown away by the temple, and it was quite crowded so perhaps couldn't take in the full beauty.

title: Unique in it's own Aura!!
review: As it's the only temple of Lord Bramhaji, so if you are in Pushkar/Ajmer then this is a place to be in list for a must visit. The place is crowded and not very grand though it has it retained it's own charm, delighted to see that no maddening rush of lot of priests asking to do rituals so overall I found it unique in it's aura.

title: Temple visit
review: Only one temple in world.

title: Mesmerising View
review: Nice place. The only temple in the world dedicated to the hindu god Brahma. The place is really nice with a huge market place from where you can buy souvenirs for your friends and family. Local stuff at reasonable price.

title: Brahma temple
review: Simple temple, nothing extraordinary. It is not allowed to take camera inside. You have to take off your shoes a leave it outside of the temple. The guys were asking some money for taking care of the shoes. Was not so impressed.

title: Great temple
review: This is only 1 temple of Lord brahma. The temple is very beautiful and colorful. ThIs is very close to pushkar lake. A must place to visit pushkar.

title: Holy place, but badly maintained
review: This review is not on the temple but more on the authority who maintains it. Else one must visit this place as its unique.

title: OM Bramhane Namaha
review: It was my luck that I could visit param pita Bramha's only temple in the whole world. Darshan was easy and temple too was well maintained.

title: Amazing
review: You think now no more temples but each one is special and there is always something that stands out and admire as this one does.

title: Amazed me!!!
review: It amazed me and attracted me for long time till I actually visited the place. But now I have to say it's like any other temple. Being Hindu it had its own importance after learning so much about from mythology. Its importance may be there and would prevail but temple authority has a long way to go to maintain cleanliness and purity.

title: Holy place
review: This is the only Brahma temple of India. This place is considered very holy and is always crowded by pilgrims.

title: Average infrastructure for the only brahma temple
review: Location: If you're going in your personal vehicle, the local police will purposely make you park 2kms before and you will be forced to take a rickshaw

title: The Only Brahma Temple in the World!
review: There is just one temple dedicated to Lord Brahma who is considered as the creator in Hinduism and that temple is in Pushkar. There are numerous other temples in Pushkar and it is easy to miss the Brahma Temple altogether! One can reach the temple only by foot as vehicles are not allowed in the tiny winding lanes.

title: Too much Crowdy
review: The temple is good but over crowded. The entry gate is very small. But overall one must go there to have prayer at the temple.

title: new experience
review: There is nothing much to see in the temple but it has a small market outside the temple you can have local street food which is really good specially kadhi kachori and jalebi.

title: Unique!
review: Great experience. You need to park a few hundred metres away and walk through the busy market place (during camel fair). Lots of steps to climb - quite steep. And you need to do it barefoot as your shoes are left at the bottom of the steps. Great atmosphere!

title: A must to visit this temple of Lord Brahma
review: This Brahma Temple at Pushkar is quite famous as this is one of the very few temples dedicated to Brahma. It is very near to Pushkar Lake.This temple can be seen from a long distance because of its height on a raised platform. The main temple is built with Marbles. Inside the Garbagriha we can see the  beautiful idol of Lord Brahma and his wife Gayatri. It is said that this is the only swayambhu of Lord Brahma idol. Devotees usually visit this temple, after taking a bath in the Holy River Pushkar This temple is well  maintained. We went in the morning hours and could get our dharshan within 30 minutes.

title: Temple dedicated to the creator of the universe
review: Lord Brahma Temple in Pushkar holds a great significance as it is the only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma.  This temple is located in close proximity to the Pushkar lake. Devotees usually take a dip in the lake and then visit the temple for darshan. This temple is very well maintained temple.  We visited during the afternoon hours and didn't find any queue. Completed the darshan in just few minutes.

title: One of a kind experience, The actual INDIA :)
review: We were there during the pushkar festival..parked a few hundred meters from the temple and the lake.. had a unique experience walking in the village, non-commercialized, and then you walk through a typical village market place..Don't fall for the self proclaimed priests who will offer to do prayers near the lake, 4 of us paid 2000 rupees each for so called 'donation' which they conned us literally. This was the only part of the trip which was disappointing. You can opt out for the prayers by the lake and go straight to the temple.

title: Average
review: It is the only Temple of Brahma  in the world. Beware of the so called pundits  who lure you into doing unwanted pujas & fleece people , especially foreigners.

title: The only temple of Lord Brahma
review: This is the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world and it is very revered among the locals.This temple witnesses huge rush of devotees and is situated near the Pushkar lake.

title: RADventure: Pitstop10: Brahma Temple, Pushkar
review: From Jodhpur we set out for Pushkar. Since the Brahma Temple ususally closes around noon, it was a rush against time. We also took a shortcut via Balunda, Bhumbaliya, Kukri & Govindgarh. This saved us almost an hour in terms of time, and also gave us an opportunity to cut through the farmland devoid of any development. About 10-15 kms the road was non-existent. And you drove through sand.

title: A Visit to Brahma Temple
review: Brahma Temple is situated close to the sacred Pushkar Lake and one of the major attraction of Pushkr. A must visit place of Pushkar

title: Holy Temple
review: This Temple, is the Holiest in India.  The offerings is an important part of the visit, a guide is necessary to understanding the importance of this temple to the Hindu Religon, Please show Respect and enjoy the experience of the visit.

title: Only Temple of Lord Brahma
review: Clean premises, Not Crowded. Beware of the shops asking you to keep footwear with them.

title: Beautiful Brahma Temple
review: The Temple is colorful and beautiful. Must pay a visit to this amazing Brahma Temple during your visit to Pushkar. Take a full round of the Temple premises and enjoy the heritage.

title: Step in if you are in pushkar
review: Nice place to sit and have peace. Neat and clean. Few minutes walk from the pishkar lake. Few steps to clim and you will reach the destination.

title: Not recommended
review: Wrote a review for pushkar and to be honest I won't recommend the city or temple.

title: Unique Temple
review: Lord Brahma Temple in Pushkar is one of the most unique temples in the world. It's the only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma who is the creator of the universe.  This temple is located very close to the Pushkar Lake, just a few minutes walk from the lake takes you to the stairs leading to the temple.  Lord Brahma temple is a white coloured small temple.  There is an idol of Lord Brahma in the inner sanctum. We were overwhelmed to get the darshan of Lord Brahma and complete our visit of the only temple in the world where Lord Brahma is worshipped.

title: one and only one in the world
review: last year i been Pushkar its such a nice city nd what makes the Pushkar so special is the LORD BRAHMA temple which is famous  and too peaceful because its the only temple of LORD BRAHMA in the world.  situated next to the lake...the energetic atmosphere that connects you with a feel of presence of a power of god.. wonderful place.. must visit and then see and feel the power.

title: Nothing special
review: If you're not Hindu and you don't believe in Hindu gods the fact that it is the only brahma temple has no significants. It is not special architecturally it doesn't have interesting art. It is like many other temples. If you have never seen a Hindu temple before you might find it interesting but you can go to dozens of other temples in Pushkar that aren't as crowded.

title: Small temple
review: Nice temple but a little more cleanliness was desired. It was almost necessary to buy a puja thali in order to deposit your shoes. These are such things that make me sad. But I guess, for most of them it's just a channel of earning money.

title: One of a kind
review: The Brahma temple in Pushkar is the only one in the world. The area is beautiful and clean. The crowd is not so managed though and lots of bottlenecks. No cameras allowed inside so no pics of interior.

title: Going On a pilgimage,do visit this temple
review: This is the only temple of Lord Brahma.It is 5 minutes away from Pushkar lake.It is a small white temple where photography is not allowed.You can click pictures outside.Bathing in the lake is not advisable as the water is not very clean.Just sprinkle few drops on the head.Temple premises is clean.You can feel the spirituality and piousness.

title: Brahma Temple- Gods own world
review: Brahma temple,pushkar is well maintained. Very religious and holy place.

title: Very nice place to be..
review: Little bit off route  but an amazing place to be.

title: Only place where Brahma the creator of world has abode
review: Brahma who is creator world could not find any abode in this earthly world excepting pushkar due to his second marriage. As per folk lore no one should worship Brahma as he was SHAPIT but however in the temple offering happens. Place is really nice & peaceful

title: Inspiring
review: Small temple dedicated to Lord Brahma, it is beautiful to see people wearing all their colours to come and honour the god. Buy one of the baskets from one of the stalls by the entrance and take with you upstairs so you can offer it. Be aware that bags, cameras and shoes are not allowed inside the temple. Enjoy

title: The only Brahma temple
review: This is the only temple of Brahma ji, in India. Brahma ji is the creator of this world. There are many pandits around the temple who perform the pooja

title: In Pushkar - Temple visit
review: Climb a few steps from the Lake level and you are at this deity in Pushkar.We were told that this is the only Brahma Temple in India- Brahma being the creator dislikes temple to be built by human /devotees for his worship !

title: ॐ श्री ब्रह्मणे नमः Creator of World**
review: Its Wonderful to visit again & again Shri Brahma Dev Temple to feel Spirituality of Holy & Historical Place! To Celebrate this visit go early morning, take help of Guide* to know Facts and make 5 minutes Construction with closed eyes! Pronounce "ॐ" inside temple...

title: Only Brahma temple in India
review: This is the one and only temple of Lord Brahma in India who created the world. Nice and inspiring place.

title: Only Brahma Temple
review: Yes, the only Brahma temple in the world although according to Hindu Mythology, he is one of the 3 main Gods. Do find out the story behind the curse on the creator of the world when you visit this place.

title: First temple to visit in Pushkar
review: This is one temple which i visited first when i went to Ajmer last week on 16th July'2016. I went there alone. Photography is prohibited. Its the world famous Brahma Temple. You climb few stairs to reach this temple. Very nice experience

title: Amaging temple
review: Temple was very nice but some people was bathing with shampoo in lake its not fair no body was trying to stop them they are making spoil in lake

title: One and Only Lord Brahma Temple in India.
review: As the Hindu mythological legend goes, there is only One temple of Lord Brahma in the whole of India, as the Lord Brahma was given a curse by his wife and it  an important pilgrimage site for all Hindus. They say that even if one does the Chardham Yatra, one cannot attain Moksha unless one visits this temple of Lord Brahma. The temple is situated 500 meters away from the lake. One should ideally visit the lake first, do a Pooja besides the lake and then head towards the temple. Anyone who wishes to see the aarti can go there in the morning or evening. After the Aarti besides the lake, one is served prasad. After doing the pooja, one can head towards the temple. One needs to climb soome 50 odd steps to reach the temple. The idol of Lord Brahma, one of the most important gods of hindus and the creator is magnificent. Unlike other temples in India, this temple was not very crowded and one an pray peacefully for as long as they like. Touts are less and the pandit who performs the pooja also does not charge money. One can donate to the authorised temple trust, as much as they like. Overall a good visit.

title: The only one temple of Lord Bramha in all of India
review: We drove from jaipur 3.5 hours by road to reach here. The temple is supposed to be very famous - more so since its the only one of its kind dedicated to Lord Bramha. The temple is closed in the afternoon hours and opens are 3 pm till 8 pm. We walked straight in, there was no crowd as such.

title: Peaceful Brahma Temple
review: Its a wonderful temple offering a peaceful feeling. And it does not have anyone trying to cheat you out of money on religious activities like the other places I've visited in India.

title: The Only Bramha Temple
review: very well maintained this temple. Nice market near by and well mannered shop keepers. Short view of Rajasthan can be seen here.

title: One of the few Brahma temples
review: Great image of Brahma; it is unique that there are few Brahma temples in the world.  The hassle of the locals at the bottom is a bit of a turn-off.  It can feel like a tourist trap with children begging.

title: World only Bhrama Mandir
review: This is the only Bhrama temple in the world, so if u ever get a chance to vist pushkar then this place is must go as it is very ancient and well maintained temple.

title: one of the rate brahma temple
review: The temple building is quite average and there are much more  beautiful temples in india.  The only highlighting fact is that its one of the very few brahma temples in world.  okay for quick one time visit.

title: Expectation high
review: Since it's only one of the existing Bharma temple I guess my expectation were high. I wanted to keep my backpack in the locker (no bags allowed inside) and was offered by the local flower vender but was bit skeptical. Looked for government locker which was in the corner but the guy sitting there was kind of damn care attitude so went back to hotel dumped the bag came back again with just enough change to buy flowers. I guess I expected the temple to be grand something but was simple shrine, small and clean. Not so satisfied in my heart but glad I was blessed enough to be here.

title: Small temple, Big story
review: This is perhaps the only Bahma temple in the world. Even here the pooja for Brahmaji is not performed, but instead and Aarti is performed for Pushkar lake. Brahmaji is not worshiped in temples because of a curse of Savitri devi, his first wife.

title: Temple of Creator
review: There are few temple of Lord Brahma. Out of that one is in Pushkar, Near Ajmer, Rajasthan which was built in 14th century. We have to climb about 50 steps. Temple situated next to Pushkar lake.

title: Good experience
review: The history associated with this temple makes it worth a visit. We get to know more about our culture and ancestors.

title: nice place with lord Brahma temple
review: only lord Brahma temple is in Pushakar and you will be amazed to see the place which unique in the world. Pushkar is situated near Ajmer city so we go to Ajmer first and then  Pushkar. You can reach there with Bus or personal traveling vehicle.

title: Brahma Temple just Ouaouh
review: It's a beautiful and the only Brahma Temple in India !

title: world's only temple for Brahma ji
review: beautiful place, get full views of backside of Pushkar, savitri temple etc.

title: Crowds
review: Just pay few rupees when leaving your shoes out not dollars, those people in charge with the shoe deposit are always trying to rip you off. Temple is crowded and lots of worshippers.

title: Special temple.
review: Its probably one of two brahma temples in the world. Lots of handicrafts and local ware in shops around. However lots of steps and not suited for wheelchair users. Though everyone is very friendly and helpful and will more than happily give all the help needed.

title: Must visit
review: Guides ask u to visit first the Pushkar lake and then visit the Brahma temple. They say that Brahmaji was cursed so this order has to be followed.

title: asstha
review: i belive so much in god and been to this tample many time, every time i come here found change and its good. lots of changes in cleanness and maintance.

title: One of India's jewels
review: Ripe with history and blessing this place is a must see for anybody visiting the area.  Being one of the most important pilgrimage sites in India and the world's most important Brahma temple of which there are but few, i highly recommend to visit this place.  I went in June which was undoubtedly incredibly hot,  still i am happy i made it.

title: Spirituality with a tint of Antique Shopping.!
review: There is one peculiar thing I would like to share about this place I noticed.

title: Nice
review: The temple is clean and good. The only Brahma temple, as it is said, is kept well. There was a minister visit during our visit there. Due to which too much of police security. The VIPs along with their extended family and securities were allowed to enter the main shrine while no one else is allowed.

title: Very Scenic
review: Pushkar,,, its a Beautiful place.

title: The one and only temple for lord Bhrama in India
review: As per Hindu mythology pushkar is the only place in India where you have a temple for lord Bhrama in India. This is because of the curse he received from his wife Savithri Devi who got angry because Bhrama did not wait for Savithri while preforming yagna and gave her position to Gayathri Devi.

title: Only temple of Lord Brahma in India
review: Its nice,serene calm place to visit for worship. Its only temple of lord Brahma in India.Here you will find huge lake where kumbha mela held once in a twelve years.

title: One and only brahma temple
review: This is one and only brahma temple in the world. Inside this temple there is a durga mata temple also. Drinking water facility is there. Loker facility is available at the starting of steps. Good devotional place very near to Ajmer

title: Temple of Lord Brahma
review: The only temple of lord Brahma is the only temple of lord Brahma in this world. this temple is too small. Neat & Clean atmosphere here. be careful during rainy days,  Stairs are slippery at that time. Temple is closed during 1 p.m to 2:30 p.m

title: "Very busy"
review: This temple is right in the busy heart of Pushkar. Lots of marble very well crafted. Shoes off for this temple but socks can stay on.No photos to be taken.

title: The "guides" / "students" (scammers) ruined the visit, trying to extort money from us
review: Such a shame that yet another holy indian place was diverted by people trying to take advantage of it to get money from tourists. They will say a prayer with you, saying they will bless your family, and will ask for money in the end. Stay away from all of them...

title: one and only brahma temple
review: temple in small but rally nice.

title: Brahma Temple!
review: There are very few brahma temples in India and world and this is one of them, beautiful, peaceful and gorgeous, my wifes native place is just some kilometres from Pushkar, Must visit place in Rajasthan India and is famous among the locals and foreigners!

title: HEAVENLY ABODE
review: visited Brahma ji temple on 28.12.2015. the road to temple was not in good condition, bumpy ride. even the temple site was not neat and clean.

title: The World EXCLUSIVE: Only Brahma Temple
review: If in case you don't know, let me take the opportunity to tell you that there is only one temple in the world that belongs to Lord Brahma, and here it is.

title: Ok
review: This is one of the few Lord Brahma temples on the world... but it is nothing outstanding. Worth a look if you are passing by. You do not need to buy/donate, and if you walk up the first few steps, you can leave your shoes there instead of being charged 3 rupees (haha) for putting them in a box.

title: Pretty Temple
review: This beautiful small temple is a stones throw from Pushkar Lake...up a few steps. It houses Lord Brahma and his consort..You may leave your belongings..including shoes which are never worn inside temples ...outside in the lockers provided. The fee is only 10 rupees. You will probably be asked for a donation...but this is not mandatory. Often some-one will try to " guide " you through a temple and ask for money...it is entirely up to you to donate...or not. It is a very pretty little temple...but not really much to see other than Lord Brahma.

title: Interesting Brahma temple
review: Very nice small hindu temple. You must leave your shoes out also camera,... If you are tourist you'll be attraction - local people will staring at you, they would like to take a photo with you.

title: Sacred site, not peaceful site
review: Please be advised that this is the ONLY temple of Brahma in all India as well as the whole world. There are many Indians who come here to worship and it is busy the whole time it's open- sunrise to sunset.

title: Divine
review: If you are close to this temple do not miss the opportunity to visit and drink in the blessings. This is a rare and elevated spiritual vibration here and gift to your soul and the planet to be touched by it

title: Felt commercial
review: Having known that this is the only Brahma temple was looking at more comforts around but i felt that the people who were helping us pray made us fix the amount which we will donate .they were so helm bent that they did not continue until we mention some figure .

title: HIstorical Place
review: The one and only temple of brahma ji in the world makes it most spectular and intersting. And the most beautiful lake in puskar ji.

title: Must go, also some tips and advises for tourists and travelers.
review: I visit this temple about at least once a year.

title: Only Brahma temple in India
review: Because of its religious significance to Hindus ( equivalent to visiting Mecca for Muslims, apparently), it was interesting to visit this temple. Sadly however, the temple was not kept clean & tidy, as I would have anticipated, for a place with this significance.

title: Fascinating visit
review: From the moment you take off your shoes and lock away your valuables, you are carried away by the ride of worshippers and pilgrims. Incredible to see the inscriptions in each marble plaque, as well as the shrine itself. Drink lots of water and be prepared to move quickly across the ground if baked by the sun!

title: Brahma's only Temple
review: Take a guide and learn the history of the Creator. Very interesting and 20 minutes to understand all about the temple, the artwork and why Pushkar is such a spiritual place.

title: Supposedly once in a life time
review: Claimed as the only Brahma temple in India, it attracts religious people. The Mandir itself is nothing great from an architectural point of view. One has to climb quite a few steep steps to reach he altar.

title: The only lord Brahma temple
review: On religious beliefs good place to visit. Agian here as well keep away from all the pandits. Market near by the temple and few shops which offers the mehandi and gulkand is very good. i found the local products very good. Keep in mind that rates are negotiable.

title: The ONLY temple of Lord Brahma in the world
review: Some 150 km from Jaipur, Pushkar is the only place in the world which has the temple of Lord Brahma. It is also the place where world's biggest cattle fair is held every year. Visit to Jaipur would not be complete if one doesn't visit Pushkar ... and yes, one must not forget to try some local dishes on the streets of Pushkar.

title: World only lord brahma temple
review: World only lord brahma temple best location very peaceful place and feel very relax visit during lord brahma temple

title: Donation Scheming
review: Nothing is worse than a money grubbing scheme wrapped up in the garb of religion. This one purports to be extra special as it is a uniquely Brahmin temple. We had a very well spoken young Brahmin man as our guide and he approached the "donation" three or four ways...as an out and out contribution to the temple; then as money for the poor - $50.00 would feed 200 etc. At the end of his spiel, it was apparent that every word was designed to elicit donations - none of it was in the interest of understanding the religion or spreading their word. It was insulting to be taken for saps.

title: Most unusual temple!
review: Maybe in this city the Brahma Temple is not so unusual, I don't know, but I find it so. With the varying blue colour and steps up and downstairs inside and outside of the temple itself. Many altars and various spots!

title: Holy Beautiful Brahma temple
review: Holy and divine temple of Lord Brahma, situated next to peaceful lake Pushkar. We went during evening, priest performed the aarthi to Pushkar lake for around 15 mins with holy chanting. Very nice hear. This is only Brahma temple in the world. Temple is nice but not for person looking for sculptures and historic art.

title: Not Bad. Accessible to Foreigners
review: This is a nice small temple. You can check it out if you've got nothing else to do. You need to take your shoes off and check in any bags at the front. You take offerings (flower petals or other) and give it at the centre of the temple. One of the only temples open to foreigners.

title: Divine Brahma temple - One of its Kind!
review: This temple is the only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma in the entire world and is highly venerable to the Indians who throng the temple in large numbers.

title: Unique in India
review: Because of his infidelity to Savitri with Gayatri, Savitri cursed Brahma, that he would be worshipped in only one temple in India, and this is it. This is a fully operational temple in traditional architectural mode. It is open to westerners, but, thankfully, photography is forbidden inside the shrine. There are subsidiary shrines to other deities, Shiva and Ganesh, but the other unique feature is a sacred tree of genuinely magic presence. Well worth a visit for the devotionally inclined.

title: Brahma is not here!
review: Brahma is everywhere! The lake and temple are beautiful but filled with people who tout something that is far from true religious worship. Here, prayer has a price tag. As a Hindu I was not able to enjoy the sanctity of this place. It's just business with a conveyor belt approach. Don't get scammed. Advice to non-Hindus, there is NO Hindu temple that restricts who may enter and pray.  Advice to Hindus, you don't have to make a pilgrimage to Pushkar in order to worship Brahma sincerely. There are too many negative elements here that will not allow you to pray sincerely.

title: Must visit
review: This is the only temple of Bhrama the creator of universe. Long history of its existence.  You need to visit to believe this.

title: A bit boring
review: Not much to see or do for common westerner, though it must be important for Hindus. The crowds tend to get thick and the foot locker madness before the gate is a bit repulsive.

title: great temple
review: good temple nice,clean and well maintained..since only temple of lord Brahma is very well organised..

title: Nothing Great
review: Brahma Temple's only claim to fame is the fact is that supposedly it's the only ancient temple completely dedicated to Lord Brahma. Because of curse of Savitri or Shiva (there is some confusion around this) Lord Brahma is not supposed to be worshipped anywhere else but at Pushkar.

title: The Only Brahma Temple in the world
review: Recommended for people who like to visit religious and historical places. I travelled by my own car. You have to park your car about 300 metres away from temple and then walk to the temple through the well spread market. At the sight of temple there are about 20-25 stairs to climb to reach the temple. Before climbing the stairs there are numerous people sitting offering free service for placing your shoes in safe custody but you would have to buy the prasad from them in return, which in any case you have to buy. The temple itself is not grand but that should not deter from visiting the temple.

title: Nice temple, traditional, but it has seen better days
review: As the only Brahma temple in India, it is an interesting visit. However, at the end of the day, if you are not religious, you cannot appreciate the real value of a "pooja" in a poorly looked after temple.

title: Holy hindu temple
review: Probably most important temple in Pushkar, entrance is for free but some donations are expected. What i don´t like about this place is, that everywhere, as usually in India, are people  trying to get some monney from you, by guiding you, doying spiritual ceremony and so on.

title: The rarest temple of the lord brahma
review: This is one of the very few temples of the lord brahma which is located in the palce called pushkar in state of rajasthan. as per hindu religion lord brahma is the creator of the universe.  the temple here is believed to be 2000 years old. The sanctum sanctorum has the images of lord brahma & gayatri. The temple is built of marble & stone stabs. The shikara of the temple is coloured in red. This is must visit location as it is one of the rarest temple of lord brahma.

title: A temple is what you bring to it
review: Yes, it's a building, there is a lot of noisy confusion, they do seek money to maintain the building and compensate the priests.  But I found it to be a holy experience, and I felt that the donation I made was not excessive compared with the money I'd been spending on gifts for myself!  Try to find a guide whose English you can understand easily.  Take your time going through the temple, and ask questions if you don't understand something.

title: Quite an average temple
review: I know this is a unique temple. But there wasn't much happening. There seems to be graffiti on the walls and it's also quite dirty. No bags allowed in.

title: very clean
review: nice place to visit. Market outside is special attraction for those who really love to do shopping. leather products are very cheap made of camel & horse skin.

title: "Temple students"
review: The temple is average. You'll probably meet a "student" that want's to show you around the temple, after he's shown you around and made you throw flowers and other things everywhere, he'll ask you to donate money to the brahma temple. He'll ask you for food, like food for one day (500INR) or two days or more! Don't give them anything, or maybe 10 rupees as a thanks for showing you the temple.

title: Rare brahma temple
review: Few meters down the Pushkar lake is brahma temple which is one of the rare ones in the world. The temple is old, beautifully coloured in shades of orange and blue. There is a market in the premises from which one can buy knock knacks like bangles.leather goods are also available but expensive.

title: for such a holy place it was lovely and peaceful
review: Well worth the visit as this is the 2nd most |Holy Hindu shrine. it is lovely and has a great history and no one hassles you.

title: The god brahma...🙏
review: In Hindu sanskruti there are three bid gods..

title: Rarest Temple - The Brahma Temple
review: This temple is known to be the rarest and the only Brahma temple who is the creator of the Universe. The temple is very good and very peaceful. On your way to the Brahma temple by road, you can see an open ground where every year Mela is held sometime in October - November.

title: Great people watching occasion during the Brahm,a festivities
review: Visiting the temple during the festivities is an extreme adventure; you have to make your way among thousands of people who come for prayer, but it is the best way to really see indian culture and hinduism first hand.  The place is incredible, full of shrines of all sizes and colors, honoring so many gods.

title: Unique - the only one!
review: Nothing great from aesthetics or architectural perspective but too great a place from faith POV. All Sanatan Dharma followers, it is said that without visiting it your pilgrimage is incomplete.

title: visiting pushkar
review: Brahma temple, the only temple of Lord Brahma, is a nice place to visit. Also there is Shreawali Mata in the hall behind the main temple. Stone work on the walls and pilers is worth watching.

title: Amazing temple ruined by scammers
review: The temple is pretty good and has some amazing history attached to it. Sadly it has been ruined by fake 'students' who pester and follow you trying to get you to go for a blessing. We were not interested and all it made us do is want to leave quickly. The Hindu people need to crack down on this as it is putting a bad name to their religion.

title: Interesting temple
review: Loved sitting in courtyard watching the people and listening to music.

title: A Very Average temple
review: There is nothing massively special about this temple even if it is made out to be the only temple to Brahma. It feels like there is lots of graffiti on the walls.

title: Lots of people
review: This is an important temple for Hindu pilgrimages.

title: A temple unique on its own
review: Those people giving reviews like nothing great , to them it's like dude it's a temple. What are you expecting here ?

title: Hmm Another Temple
review: This temple is one of the main features of Pushkar. It is in two sections, one in the town and the other on top of a small mountain. Temple in the town is small but interesting. Temple on top of mountain has 550 steps up. They are currently building a cable car to it, but this will not be in operation for another two months.

title: Underwhelmed.......
review: I'm sure for the devote's of Brahma this must be the best place on the planet. But for everyone else it's difficult to not come down the steps from this temple without thinking "is that it ?"

title: Not that attractive
review: Long way to travel to see a small temple ,no photos allowed surroundings dirty .important to Hindus ,lake not impressive and again dirty .

title: Rare Temple
review: It is claimed that this perhaps the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world...the temple is old and has small sub-temples within the same structure...A climb of about 5-6- stairs at the beginning...Visit the Pushkar Lake before the temple...

title: Only place to visit in Pushkar
review: Religious place. Just remember that temple is closed from 1 to 3pm so plan accordingly. Brahma sarovar is also a place to visit

title: The one and only one brahma Temple!
review: Its the only one brahma temple in the world,so its worth to be on your kness in front of God Brahma.Dont forget to taste the famous and delicious Sweet dish "Malpue" outside the brahma temple.The best time to visit the pushkar is during the pushkar fair which is generally held in Oct-Nov every year!

title: Powerful Brahma Temple!!!
review: Brahma Temple in Pushkar is a definite spot to see, especially since...as the story goes..that Pushkar was created by Brahma after having a fight with a demon.

title: Not much to see unless you are a religious person
review: The temple itself is a disappointment - small, architecturally unimpressive and disorganized. Our guide was rather useless, couldn't answer any question. There is not even a place to leave your shoes. No socks and photographs are allowed. Our useless guide force you to leave the camera with a shopkeeper, in our case he was a 10 year old boy. A lonely priest was offering pujas (blessings), I skipped. I still offered the guide a tip, he got offended at first because I handed it to him with my left (instead of the right) hand, but ended up taking it all the same. However, the surrounding shopping area was quite interesting offering souvenirs, bangles, traditional Indian cloths, cold weapons, street food, and camel rides. Hence, two stars.

title: Can be potential tourist magnet given its uniqueness
review: The temple complex has Ambe Gauri, Shiva, Ganesha besides Lord Brahma of course. Different versions about Brahma getting cursed is quite interesting. There is the Savitri temple at the top of the hills - always looking at this Brahma temple from a distance as per the legends.

title: Only Brahma temple in the world
review: It is the only Brahma temple in the world, this temple is only a visit place, no worship done here. It is near by Pushkar lake.

title: The only one to this God
review: A clean temple with a flight of stairs. Brahma was cursed which left him without religious followers & worship.

title: Brahma Temple - Located Close to Pushkar Lake
review: This is supposed to be the only Lord Brahma's temple in the world. It is located very close to the lake. There are a series of steps leading up to the temple. Whilst many pujaris/ brahmin priests approached us to facilitate our drashan, we chose not to engage their services. There is not much crowd at the temple and the temple premises are very peaceful. Overall a very nice experience visiting the temple.

title: Not impressed
review: Even our guide was pushing us to offer money. We had to leave our camera behind, yet cell phones were okay to proceed. Crazy! The temple is ill maintained. Has live cables running through the middle, appears falling apart, most of the marble tiles are broken. Wherever that money is going, it is not going to fix anything. Brahma has a good cash flow it seems but is loathe to spend it. There is sikh part, which was pointed out, yet it too is badly in need of clean up and fix up. The ponds appear full of algae with poor oxygenation. No one cares!  "TII, "This is India".

title: Nice temple
review: Nice temple with a lot of history. Students show you around and say they don't want money. Beware when they take you to the lake though, because they introduce you to "holy men" that hustle tourist into paying thousands of rupees after saying some prayers.

title: Full of scammers
review: Went here while in Pushkar and found it to be 'nothing special'. Was dirty and the entrance was crowded by locals trying to charge money for holding your shoes while you go in despite the fact that domestic tourists could happily leave there shoes safely by security.

title: Nothing extraordinary
review: Basically the only brahma temple the only selling point of it otherwise nothing special about it.located in a bustling area

title: beautiful temple
review: I believe that the Brahma temple is the only one in the world. It is close to the Pushkar lake and the colourful local market of Pushkar. Here one just has to buy some flowers or sweets from a vendor and take to the temple where there is priest who will do your offering if  you wish to do so.No scam at temple, which is good from my experience .

title: The only Brahma temple in the world
review: Tip: Just go before the temple is about to close and as they ask people to leave the temple sanctum , just go and start talking to some senior religious person there. He may give you some precious gyaan but definitely give you nuggets about Indian mythology and the temple.

title: only temple dedivated to lord bramha !!
review: well organised staff to help  .. not too clean but still worth the efforts to climb up ..no pushing ..

title: stay away from Pushkar Brahmins
review: The worst experience, Brahmin's rip you off. Rather go to a Sikh temple in Pushkar, it's peaceful, no one force for offerings instead they feed you full meal anytime you go there.

title: BRAHMA TEMPLE
review: We visited this temple with family.everybody were very happy to see this ancient temple of lord brahma

title: Out of the world
review: A very ancient Temple in the heart of Pushkar where people of all caste and Religion come to pay their respect

title: The Only Brahmaji Temple in India
review: Pushkar is a very popular tourist spot known for the Lake and Brahmaji temple. The temple is closed during 1.30-3.00 in the afternoon. So please plan your trip accordingly. The shops around the Temple serve very Tasty Kadi Kachori ,  Maalpuha and Lassi. Must visit if you are in Ajmer.

title: Interesting history surrounding this temple
review: This temple has an interesting history and it should be your first stop in Pushkar before walking to the lake. This is where you will receive the flowers that will go into the lake when you receive a blessing .

title: One and only temple of lord Brahma
review: peaceful place but nothing new exciting apart from the fact that this is only temple of Lord Brahma in world

title: Nice
review: Just like any other temple, but significant because I think this is the only Brahma temple in India. Worth a visit.

title: Interesting
review: Very interesting story for the origins of this temple. It has very nice feelings of calm & peace. A nice place to visit in the lovely town of Pushkar.

title: One of its kind temple!
review: The first Brahma temple!

title: Just another temple but it belongs to Lord Brahma
review: Nothing great about this place, A simple temple, The unique thing is that its based on Lord Brahma so only one in India.

title: Only Brahma Temple
review: Lord Brahma's only temple on earth is in Pushkar. The temple is next to the pushkar lake with number of temples / ghats. The Brahma temple thankfully does not have a lot of queue. The temple is very serene and one can sit and pray. The temple premises has view of the temples at top of the hill [gayatri and savitri temple]. There are many shops near the temple which are nicely placed for shopping. Overall, the experience is quite exhilarating.

title: Brahma Temple !
review: The only Brahma temple left me more confused than when I set out for it !

title: A magical site
review: We drove from Jaipur to Jodhpur and stopped on the way to see the only Brahma temple in India.

title: Average Expereince
review: Well, like the title suggests it is an average experience. It is located in one corner of Pushkar. There are numerous stalls outside the temple where they sell the Puja items. If you want to leave your footwear in one of these stalls they would take care of it for free provided you buy the Puja items from there. There are security screenings and you mount a few steps and you can walk into the main shrine after which you visit a Matha temple located behind the main temple and another Shiva temple which is located in the basement. The whole visit takes about twenty minutes (atleast when I went which was at 3.30 PM). The temple is maintained well and you have mostly tourists coming in. Taking photos is not permitted.

title: Great Ancient temple
review: It was my second visit to Pushkar and this icon is still unchanged.

title: ONLY ONE TEMPLE FOR BRAHMA IN INDIA
review: I have been there with my friends in the month of January,2016.  This is the only Tempe for Brahma Dev in India.  And you can see 4 Vedas of Hindu Mythology is also there in this temple. Very decent and the people there also very polite.  You can also see the Brahma Kund. There Lassi is famous at all times. From there you can go to Ajmal Baba temple at Ajmeer.  He is the greatest magician in the world. There you can see the symbols of Prithviraj the King who ruled the kingdom. In Ajmeer you can also visit Foy Sagar, Anna Sagar, Durga etc.  These are all you can visit in one day itself.

title: Noisy, jostling, difficult experience
review: First you must place your camera, purse and shoes in a locker.  Then you walk, shoeless, at least one block on a dirty street littered with BB-sized prickly sugar balls that hurt your feet.  A thousand people jostle in long lines and "pushers" with ear-splitting whistles shoo onlookers quickly along.  You have only seconds to view the silver icon as you process past it.  The statue sits in relative darkness in its carved silver temple--scarcely visible.  Other temples to Lord Brahma do exist.  Recommendation--visit sometime other than during the camel fair and holy time after the crowds diminish.

title: Only one in the World
review: Beautiful and Peaceful.

title: Pilimigrage place
review: Rare and beautiful brahmaji temple to pay visit to the creator of this world.lifetime beautiful moments.a place to visit again and again

title: Only brahma temple in India
review: This place is very near to city Ajmer

title: Holy Place Must Visit In Pushkar
review: This is the only one temple of Lord Brahma in India , bit crowdy but a place to visit. Nice surrounding with shops n eatery

title: Only Brahma temple in the world, must visit
review: My experience in visiting this temple was similar to any other temple in India. If you are visiting in summers, make sure you wear socks since the marble floor is very hot. Keep away from touts in the area.

title: Dirty and not holy
review: I was horrified by this place.  The filth and the stench were shocking.  I felt nothing akin to spirituality or closeness to God.  I just wanted to run.  Very sad.

title: Beware of priests at the lake
review: Temple is very nice a " student" showed us around and at the end asked for a donation of at least 500 rupees. Floors need to be swept as going around barefoot and plenty of small stones to hurt your feet. Beware of priests at the lake giving "free" flowers very nice intro to the lake then demand a donation of 1000-5000 rupees. Spoiled a lovely experience.  Apart from this pushkar is my favourite Indian town.

title: Brahma Temple
review: Based on the mythology this is a must see.  From a temple perspective I would say it seemed quite normal like most North Indian Temples.  Quite busy place.   Should see if you are at Pushkar.

title: A unique place
review: The temple at Pushkar is the only temple dedicated to Brahma, all other Hindu temples are dedicated to the incarnations of Vishnu or Shankar. The temple is maintained quite well but the approach to the temple like most temples in India is dirty. One can also shop for Rajasthani traditional attire in the bazaar around the temple.

title: The One & Only in the World!
review: This temple is the one and only Bramha temple in the world. The visit was truly satisfying. Well managed queues is an added advantage.

title: The only Brahma temple in the world
review: It is a charming temple located a the top of a flight of steps.Being the only temple in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma in the world it is a must visit in a trip to Pushkar. The temple is painted blue with red spire and has Lord Brahma and his wife next to each other. There are other smaller temples in the complex including that of Lord Kuber and Lord Shiva the latter being underground- down a few steps. We went there in the evening and really liked it.

title: Humbling experience
review: Totally loved the history and experience

title: Very nice and peaceful
review: A unique and one off temple, not too sure if any other Brahma temples exist.

title: Only temple dedicated to lord brahma
review: close to the pushkar lake, i think its the only temple exists for lord Brahma, approx 2000 year old..

title: dont be bewildered by donation requests
review: we went there and did some ceremonies, ending with donation requests. What we got was totally worth it. Explenations, some rituals and blessings, and of course the red dot on the forehead.

title: Must visit
review: If you are in pushkar then only reason has to be visiting the brahma temple.

title: Ancient temple
review: It's an ancient temple as per Hindu beliefs and only temple of Lord Bramha in the world( creator of the universe) Avoid going to it during pilgrimage days and seasons.

title: Blessed
review: The uniqueness of the temple lies in the fact that there is only one temple of Brahmaji the whole world. Good to know about  the history of  temple and blessed by darshan.

title: Hyped.
review: The Bramha temple though the only temple of the Lord in the world is highly hyped.

title: Brahma murti
review: The temple outer wall are delight to see and so is the brahma ji's small murti.....overall a good endeavour for the effort it took

title: visit to brahma temple and pushkar ghat
review: The brahma temple is the only temple of the lord Brahma .Its a must visit if you are visiting pushkar . The pushkar ghat is also beautiful and has a history attached   .There are total 52 bathing ghats and several temples surrounding the ghat . Earlier it was said there were 500 temples surrounding the ghat .

title: amazing
review: contrary to expectation and reviews read, no one harasses you in the temple. its upto you if you want to take offerings. the darshan are simple and without hassle. loved it

title: only temple of Brhama
review: The only temple of Brahma in India.this is close to a big lake surrouned by many ghats built by various kings.since Ma saraswati was late for the yagna , Brahma married another women and sat with her for the pooja hence saraswati got angry and moved away and she sits separtely in a temple.

title: The only Temple in the world dedicated to Brahma
review: This is a very nice temple that somehow feels local and intimate even though it is a major Hindu pilgrimage site for all Hindus. Minor deities such as Lord Indra and Lord Kubera are not ignored, and the story of why there is only one temple devoted to Brahma in the world is lovely. I think one must see this temple if visiting Pushkar if only for its religious significance.

title: Nothing much in temple but market around is awesome
review: I visited this place on my way back to home from Jaisalmer- Jodhpur- Udaipur trip. I had actually underestimated this place after reading reviews on makemytrip. Temple was not well maintained but has its own glory. On my way to market I got opportunity to explore market unintentionally. I realised how much I had overpaid for stuff in others places. Handicraft things, clothes, slippers etc all were availible at such low price. Place had many foreign visitors. Mexican, Italian food availible on small stalls at under 100 Rs. I bought things at very low price.

title: Shri Jagat Pitha Mandir Brahma
review: Clean Temple to start with. A lot of history, good and calm experience. Not to be missed on ur trip to Pushkar

title: Mythological destination
review: Don't expect exquisite architecture or a grand temple complex or not even an elaborate Arti ritual so commonly associated with other famous Hindu temples. This temple has a significant in mythology and that's the reason you should visit Brahma temple. The markets are colorful and the food around is very good. Don't bother about hiring the services of 'guides' who will confront you every few meters  ... The place is easy to explore. There's the camel ride which tourists love (my kids loved it too). Go early to beat the crowds.

title: Prime attraction of Pushkar alongwith the lake
review: One of the rare Lord Brahma temples and the only one where he is worshipped.

title: A moving pilgrimage site
review: This is a newish building on an ancient site.  You go to see the long lines of pilgrims venerate a very ancient image of Brahma set in an otherwise unremarkable temple.  Lines may be longish during busy travel times.  The idol itself, surrounded by, sterling silver bas reliefs, and - of course - freshly garlanded daily, is moving in its simplicity.

title: NOT AS WE THOUGHT
review: The Temple is an historic place. Good to visit. However lot of agents on the road to make money. Gives a bad taste.Avoid the agents and visit on your own.

title: Interesting but very crowded and uncomfortable.
review: This was an interesting but very small temple.  It was extremely crowded and we were being pushed which made us uncomfortable.  Some of our group stayed outside due to the number of people.  I would recommend seeing this temple if you have a chance to go when there are fewer people so that you can see and enjoy the temple

title: Beware the scammers
review: A lovely sacred spot. My advice go in and do not engage with anyone. Our visit was ruined by priests who even insisted they take us to ATMs so we could draw more money to donate

title: good visit
review: being the only temple for Brahma, this was a must visit and it was a easily accessible and no crowd - not much queue temple.

title: One of the sacred place for Hindus and only one place having Lord Brahma temple on the Earth.
review: One of the sacred place for Hindus and only one place having Lord Brahma temple on the Earth. one must visit to understand the hindu mythology tale and much more.

title: Brahma's only temple
review: We were told that this was the only temple in the world dedicted to brahma.  Our guide book says one of the few.  It's really a rather plain temple.  Very little carving so have to drop your expectations if you've been to any of the great jain or hindu temples.

title: Temple of the Town
review: In this tiny, holy town, their God is Brahma, the Creator. Most tourists who come here come for religious purpose. The temple is small and very basic and situated in the middle of the market area. Leave your shoes and cameras behind. Yes, they will search you. Cameras are not allowed so you can leave them with the guards (if you don’t have a guide) and your shoes right by the front steps and no one will bother them. Offer your prayers and leave.

title: HOLY TEMPLE
review: Brahma ji temple in Pushkar is most popular and very old temple and people came here from all over the india Traveller should remember photography is restricted in temple

title: The only one tample of Brahma in world
review: This is the only one temple of brahma in world but for me it is disappointing that there is no prayer perform on any day in full year.

title: simple temple of Brahma
review: i was in ajmer for my friend wedding and find some time to drive pushkar . Drive was amazing but as soon as i reached nothing much to appreciate . Ok lets say small market shops but when I reach temple it was a set back as all this flower offering guys on me for my shoes and i imagine what they need so I avoid it as they charge for many many unwanted requirements , this feels real bad as tourist from far ends comes and face this arrangement, local autohrity is big set back ... guys be careful with all such unwanted situation owsie its beautiful city to explore .

title: only mandir  of lord Brahma in the world
review: There is only mandir belongs to Lord Brahma located in pushkar. good place to visit.mandir looks beautiful & clean.people visit this place after taking bath in near brahma kund.

title: Unimpressive and unwelcoming, but worth a visit
review: The temple was dirty and crowded. There were too many scammers at the entrance offering "free" flowers. Stay away from them. They make you leave your shoes and bags at the entrance so you have to pay to rent a locker. Be careful.

title: Avoid this place - Visit only if religious.
review: Nothing much but a simple Temple with very poor maintenance, unhygienic and with foul smell.

title: One of the few temples of Lord Brahma
review: In Pushkar, then definitely visit Brahma Temple. Located close to the Pushkar lake and in the hustle bustle of the streets of Pushkar. Arrangements to handle huge crowds is made and is worth a visit.

title: Religious Spot
review: This is the only Brahma Temple.  We visited in October and there was no crowd at all.  I feel it is better to avoid visiting this place during carnival time as the whole temple area is small.

title: One of the only two Brahma temples in the world
review: The walk through the market is a lot of fun, and being able to visit one of the only two Brahma temple in the wold is a blessing by itself. Its worth it the visit.

title: Unique Experience
review: There is a strong mythological reasoning on why this the only temple of Lord Brahma, one of the Hindu Trinity Gods.

title: Must see
review: Brahma Temple is the Holiest temple in Pushkar, I visited the Temple twice at different times and it was always very much alive with locals and tourists alike ........... well worth it!!!!

title: Rare Brahma Temple Visit
review: It should be mentioned that my temple visit was during the hyper-activity Pushkar Camel Fair, so much crowding was experienced which may or may not be present other times of the year. Bring a neck pouch for your passport/money and, if you care, socks to walk across the street, because shoes, handbags, cameras are not allowed in the temple. With long lines up to and through the place, it was kinda hard to see. My guide and I stood outside briefly as he talked up the history but when we sat outside we were to 'move on' - which, as I have a knee condition - meant being one one's feet for 30+ minutes, moving through. Lovely temple, though - lots of history! The lockers at a shop come with a key and are secure, but having one's money/passport in a neck/belt pouch was reassuring.

title: Beautiful temple
review: Pushkar has the largest and one of the few temples dedicated to Lord Brahma. It is good to spend some time sitting along the ghats and taking in the diving atmosphere. Not much quality shopping at this location. However, the temple and ghats are a must-see destination.

title: Quaint..!!
review: A very peaceful place. It's the only brahma temple in the world and that's why it's kinda crowded. But there are times when you can avoid the crowd. Heard the morning aarti is good.

title: Worship Place Of God Brahma
review: The temple is one of very few existing temples dedicated to the Hindu creator-god Brahma in India and remains the most prominent among them. From lord Brahma temple you can view Maa Gayatri temple. Its nearer to Ajmer City. When ou plan for Ajmer you must plan for Puspkar for seeing Lords Brahma temple & Pushkar lake

title: Overrated
review: Unless you have a religious connection to this place, I think the architecture is average and really nothing special.

title: Warning! Beware of con artists operating as priests!
review: Con artists try to take you for a ride by offering to do a prayer for you without prior warning of costs (donations?). Beware and check the details of any offers before agreeing on anything.

title: DTG(Direct to God)
review: As heard, it is the only one Lord Brahma temple existing on earth. It was the peak season when we visited during 'Pushkar Mela' when pilgrims were in Lakhs. It was very nice experience, though very crowdy. Policemen were doing their duty nicely to control the rush. Scenic beauty was perfect. Cameras are not allowed in the temple, but people were taking snaps from their mobile and no one was there to restrict them. Overall a must visit once.

title: Place of worship with history
review: The story of the temple brings people here. The temple by itself is pretty basic and small. We were able to offer our prayers in a few minutes. No Crowd on the day we went.

title: interesting
review: visited this temple on route around the Camel fair excellent place and we came here at a time when there were lots of pilgrims doin the rounds of the temples . Fab !

title: Jagat Pita Brahma's Temple
review: Visited the temple during Pushkar fair,  but there was so much crowd and long lines,  so decided to visit at night,  just entering the temple a divine feeling surround which purify the soul and give immense peace.....

title: Disciplined
review: Though it is the only temple of lord Brahma in whole world, but it is not huge and over crowded.You can buy offering from any of the shops before climbing the staircase to the temple.There are approx 29 steps to reach the temple.Go in the queue and there is no hurry by temple priests while you praying before the lord.After darshan, go around the sanctorum

title: Must visit in Pushkar
review: The only Bramha temple in the world and is Pushkar's main attraction.

title: Bramha Temple
review: very nice bramha temple, average crowded but not disciplined creates mess all around. . take time to view Bramha idol.

title: A must visit
review: As this is the only Brahma temple in the whole of India, if you visit Pusher you should really visit this temple. It is very beautiful and well maintained. I'm surprised to see photos of the temple here as photography is forbidden.

title: Brahma 's temple
review: It's considered to be the only Brahma Temple in the world..but there are other temples which have brahma,  of course not as the presiding deity. As legend has it, the diety is not worshipped regularly and is just an idol without any adornations. The main temple in Pushkar village.All pujas happen by the lake.

title: Must visit in Puskar
review: Dont miss this place if you are in Pushkar, as it is known its worlds only Brahma temple. I visited in Nov 2015.

title: very busy during Mela
review: Supposedly it is the only Brahma temple in India..In fact there is another Brahma temple in the Kullu valley HP and one in Kerela. Your camera need to be put in a locker...rice is all over on the floor...Yes, it is a Brahma temple...

title: My first visit
review: Good to be there with my mom, wife and kids. History of the only Brahma temple in the world is amazing.

title: NICE TEMPLE UNIQUE IN WORLD....PANDAS MAKING IT WORSE..TECHNIQUE TO AVOID THEM..
review: I had been to pushkar for two days from 14 Nov to 16 Nov. I stayed at RTDC Sarovar heritage. The only thing to avoid the sticky pandas that get up early at 4am, take bath at your room, go out for attending arti at Brahma Temple which is at 5am, from RTDC Sarovar complex walking distance is around 1km, no vehicles are allowed since its a market in the way, and walking time will take around 15-20min or max 30min.

title: Unique Place on Earth
review: Brahma temple in pushkar is an amazing and must place to visit as this is the only lord brahma temple on earth. Very unique place located in the center of Pushkar.

title: Feels positive
review: We went to brahma sarovar and did pooja for pithru .Our guide Mr.Mayank was very helpful and informative .Since it was afternoon the temple was closed so we could not vist the temple,which was disappointing.Good place and positive feelings visiting this place.

title: "Beautiful "
review: Beautiful temple of Brahma ji,this is the only temple of Brahma ji in world.crowded at Kartik month,lot of devotees comes there.

title: Mostly for locals, you have to pay for everything...
review: You will have to pay for the shoes, and will be asked to leave your belongings in a small box with questionable characters. They give you the key, but will ask for money. As this is the only Brahma temple in the world, you should visit, and have someone to explain why this place is important.

title: Very old and beautiful place
review: This temple is unique in its nature and very close the shopping street of Pushkar.

title: Great temple and must visit
review: As I went during pushkar festival, it was crowded but had a short gap of less crowd and had a peaceful darshan...temple was simply wonderful

title: Only one temple in the world of bramha
review: Pushkar is famous for lord bramha temple. And it is only one temple in the world. no one can build another temple of bramha anywhere in the world. its never complete.

title: Only Brahma temple in the world...
review: We visited the temple twice during our stay. And fascinated to learn that this is the only Brahma temple in the world...

title: Ridiculous hassle
review: On the approach to the temple, we were hounded by several men saying we had to leave our shoes with them. We put our shoes in our bags (which we have done at several other temples in the country with no problems!). Seeing this, one of the guys shouted up to the security lady who, surprise surprise, then refused to let us in with our bags, despite having let 2 other tourists in with their bags in front of us. Turned around to leave and got some smart sarcastic comment from one of the shop keepers. Such ridiculous behaviour from locals in a supposedly holy place - they're only after your money!!!

title: If your a religious person...
review: You will surely like the temple. Nothing really great. All though since your there its nice to pay a visit.

title: Brahma's Temple
review: An opportunity to visit the only Brahma Temple around. Be prepared to show respect and remove shoes - dress appropriately. You should still watch your step as a friend found a fresh pile to step in outside of the Lake/Brahma area.

title: Only worth it if have time while travelling b/w Jaipur and Jodhpur
review: Avoid during the summer, especially if travelling with kids... real hot and the crowded place makes it more difficult. Good to cross off one's checklist. Pushkar typically is full of hippies (you will see Caucasians riding around in bikes or lying around in drug induced state). Temple is just about okay... interesting the various versions of stories one hears about the origins of the temple (very divergent) :-)

title: Only Brahma Temple in the world!
review: I had high expectations about this temple before the visit as its suppose to be only Brahma temple in the world where Lord Brahma is worshiped. They could have done better with the temple as an tourist attraction. I felt the arrangement as just another local temple. Beware of the local pandits/ brahmans( they refer themselves as) Usually they do a small Pooja for you and your family near the Pushkar Lake and expect you to pay 2100 rs as Donation which is a rip off. You are likely to be misguided by these pandits as they will first tell that in Brahma temple , no pooja is done and don't need to buy any flowers and coconut inside the temple, later when you are close the temple, they refer you to a local flowerist near by and ask you to buy then as they will have commission arrangements. Avoid Local Pandits if possible and do your Pooja at your own terms. Also do not forget to visit Pushkar Lake and Savitri temple near by.

title: Unique and holy.. Must visit
review: It is supposed to be the only Brahma temple and it is truly unique. The ambience is good. The place feels charged with positive energy and spiritualism. A glorious shrine in a beautiful place.

title: Only temple in world
review: This is the only Brahma temple in world, so worth visiting. Photography is not allowed in this temple, so better do not carry DSLRs or you can deposit the same at the chargeable counters near the temple stairs.

title: A must visit
review: As its the only Brahma temple in India its a must see attraction. No photography is permitted so leave your camera behind.

title: Historical
review: Well protected by armed guards but much dirtier than I thought it would be.

title: amazingly unique in world
review: it feels really great to know that it is the only brahma temple in world. while visiting one must take a local guide who will tell you why it is the only temple of bhagwan brahma.

title: Known as One and Only worshiping temple of Lord Brahma
review: That was a good experience for us by visiting this temple. This temple is just 1.5km away from the Pushkar bus stand. First of all we should wash or clean our body in the Lake nearby. Sweet balls and Dry fruits are the Prasadas from the temple. idols of Lord Brahma and other God's especially Indra, Kubera are placed inside the temple. A small temple but worth seeing. May Lord Brshma Bless Us..

title: Unique in all the temples
review: A must visit for the sheer fact that no other Brahma temples exist. Beware that no cameras are allowed and no lockers exist so you would have to leave it with any of the shopkeepers from whom you would buy some offering.

title: Unique
review: It is believed that this is the only one Brahma's temple not only on this earth but in the entire universe

title: Unique temple!
review: Supposed to be 1 of only 2 temples worldwide dedicated to the God Brahma - the creator in Hindu mythology.

title: Lord Brahma
review: Known to be one of very few temples to be worshipping Lord Brahma.  Small temple but when we went was quite busy.

title: Good place
review: This is one of the few Bhrama temples in the world. Nice temple. No guides demanding huge fees. Not much crowd during off days. Can get crowded during festivals. Overall a nice place to go

title: Rare Bhramha Temple
review: It's said that this is the only Bramha temple, also that this is the king of all hindu tirth and hence the name pushkar RAJ. The temple is not very crowded on a normal day.

title: the only Brahma Temp,e in the world
review: I visited there along with my family and luckily got a chance to attend the Aarti as well. well maintained temple and very peaceful. who ever is visiting Pushkar try to avoid Pandits and agents as they will approach you and say that we will charge only 50 rs and we are main ancestors of Brahma temple but later on you will charged much more thorough other sources like necessary pooja and shopping

title: Only Brahma Temple
review: If you are in Puskar, you will not miss visiting this only temple of The creator God, Brahma. It is said to be the only temple of Brahma on earth because of a story you must hear from a local once you visit.

title: World's only Brahma temple
review: The unique feature of this temple is that it is the only Brahma temple in the world.The temple has silver coins embedded in its floor tiles and walls dating back to as early as 1800s. Do visit it when in Pushkar. Apart from that, it is like any other regular temple.

title: Very old and one of its kind
review: The brahma temple at pushkar is a rare one. The lake adjacent to the temple is used to take holy bath and also to do rituals to the dead. Crowd management was poor and people just hostled and jostled each other.

title: Peaceful
review: Listed as the only temple of Brahma ji in the world, it was a nice experience visiting there. The place is peaceful and we could really connect with the divinity.

title: Good Temple with uniqueness of it's oldness
review: Single temple in world of Brahma very beautiful template specially if we count it so old in construction of nature.

title: The only temple of Brahma
review: Brahma Temple can be reached by crossing the foreign tourist's centric main market of Pushkar. The temple is situated very near to the Pushkar Lake. The temple has idols of Hindu god Brahma and other hindu gods. This temple is known as the world's only Brahma's temple as it is not common in hinduism to worship Brahma..

title: Amazing experience
review: Wonderful, visited on Krishna's Birthday- chaotic, noisy beautiful.

title: Nice temple
review: Its was a nice temple so clean temple and one thing is most important its was a single temple in all over in india its a so nice n beautiful place

title: Sunset a MUST
review: It's a good climb to the top, the best time is around 5pm (sunset @ 6:15) For me one of the better sunsets, also beautiful views from the temple yard as well.  The pathway is lit up as it gets dark.its a 20 minutes walk from PUSHKA City TO THE PATHWAY.

title: Small temple
review: The temple is small and a half kilometre walk from the car park. The guides keep harassing you but they are not needed. Not very crowded. Easy Darshan.

title: "peaceful "
review: Listed as the only temple of Brahma ji in the world, it was a nice experience visiting there. The place is peaceful and we could really connect with the divinity. lots of monkeys around the temple .

title: Creators temple in Pushkar
review: The main temple in Puskar and one of the only temples for Bramha ji in the world. Easily accessible to anyone visiting Pushkar and is very close to the Bramha Ghat as well. There are various local delicacies that you could taste in the various roadside food outlets near the temple.

title: A place only in pushkar
review: excellent brahma temple which only in the pushkar not anywhere in the world so it is been very interesting to visit and there atmophere were so fantastic. good to visit.

title: Must visit in Pushkar
review: The only temple of Lord Brahma in India and one of the oldest temples in India. The temple is not too grand but has a lot of religious significance. It's close to the Pushkar lake and it's said that before offering puja at the temple of Brahma, one should offer puja to Goddess Savitri, wife of Lord Brahma who had cursed the Lord to be worshipped at only one temple. The temple is clean and well maintained. The place is easily accessible.

title: only brahma temple india..
review: the only brahma temple in india..nice place to be when in pushkar however temple maintenance can be better as sanitation was not upto mark.

title: Beware of touts...
review: Like most religious places, this temple also has many touts hanging around. They will catch you here for a Puja near the Pushkar lake. It is a whole racket which involves the guides, shopkeepers, agents, etc. Beware!!!

title: "THE GREAT BRAHMA"
review: as this temple very famous.i did not found it that great.its very crowded and they force you to buy pojja thing. but overall its a good palace to visit

title: Only Brahma Temple
review: Visit to Pushkar's famous Bramha temple, can be combined with Ajmer tour from Jaipur. The temple was beautiful, but lacked basic facilities. The famous Pushkar lake situated closeby was poorly maintained. There are not many good eateries around, incase you reach in the afternoon.

title: Modest, for being the only Brahma temple in the world
review: The only temple in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma, the creator, and the simplicity and blink-and-miss feeling about the temple is a big disappointment.

title: Only Brahma Temple in the world
review: Its a unique temple of Lord Brahma, the only temple in the world, worth a visit to the temple town of Pushkar.

title: Unique
review: This is the only temple in India dedicated to Lord Brahma.

title: Must visit
review: One of the major attraction in Pushkar and the only temple in the world.  Its suggested to visit the Brahma lake than the temple, as the temple is cursed and all the rituals, Poojas are performed at the nearby lake.

title: Only one!
review: Visit to the Only Brahma temple in the world is a must in Pushkar. Been here twice. Holy place. Its always crowded but it doesnt take time for darshan.

title: typical indian temple
review: pretty crowded, as expected by indian standards. Didnt get the spiritual feeling there. makes sense if you are a hindu devout otherwise may give it a miss.

title: Must visit
review: One and only Brahma temple in world ..... Typical type but if you are in Pushkar must visit and better to take guide . Not money making types temple

title: only brahma temple in world
review: pushkar is famous for brahna temple in all over world according to local people its a only brahma temple in world ...so must do and visit the temple...

title: Lovely stories for Mytology lovers and India explorers
review: A place rated to be the only place on planet to have a Bhramha Temple. (there are other temples which may host bhramha idol, but there is no worship anywhere else).
