This place is filled with people who will tell you amazing mythological stories about origin of stars , planets, to why the place pushkar is an important religious place and the reason behind why there is only one Bhramha temple in the world!... all in all a nice scenic lake at a decent height above sea level. temprate climate and enjoyable local folk culture...

title: Unique
review: Though it didnt take much time to visit the temple but the walk to the temple through the local markets was awesome experience, really liked the fragrance of the place

title: Unique Temple
review: This temple is unique since it is the only one dedicated to Lord Brahma. No prayers are performed at this temple and darshan doesn't take much time in spite of the crowds. Worth a visit if you happen to be in Ajmer

title: Miss it
review: I can see no reason why a tourist would want to come to Pushkar when there are so many lovely places to visit in India. Everyone told us it was a must see. Why? It is a street market selling tourist tat (dubious quality) , the restaurants are poor and the hassle and pressure at the Ghats make the whole experience unpleasant. Go to Udaipur, Jodhpur or Jaiselmar-they are wonderful places. Cutting the stay here short, leaving first thing in am and heading to Jaipur.

title: A Famous Temple
review: It is probably the only temple in the world where Lord Brahma is worshiped. It gives you a divine feeling to offer puja there with your family. The temple was crowded giving us a proper feeling of a holy environment. However the temple stairs can really get slippery on a rainy day and if you are visiting Pushkar on a rainy day you have to watch your steps. Also when we visited the place, it turned very muddy due to the rains. Cameras are strictly prohibited inside the temple and we did not like the idea of leaving it behind at the shoekeeping racks of the shopkeepers.

title: One of its kind
review: "Brahma" is considered to be the creator of this World as per Hindu mythology. As a God, he is never worshipped alone and his name is always coupled with Vishnu and Mahesh. This is the only temple in the World which is completely dedicated to "Brahma". Large number of Hindus and people from other religion as well come and pray at this temple.

title: beaware of saints
review: the saints ask for money every time and everywhere. the chappal stand guys will ask you exorbitant money while inside it is free of cost. also they would not allow you to spend some quality time inside the temple . and its a hush hush affair

title: Ok ok place to visit
review: Photography is not allowed in this temple but the only problem is the police officers standing at the entrance. They do not allow to carry camera inside the temple premises but allow to carry smartphone, does not make any sense.

title: The Temple of Gerat Great Grand Father!
review: The Brahma Temple at Pushkar takes us back to our origin. As per the Hindu Mythology, Brahma, one of the Trinity Gods- Brahma, the Creator, Vishnu, the Protector and Shiva, the Distructor- originated Himself from the Lotus flower in the Pushkar Sarovar. Pushkar, the Origin place of the Humanity and the Brahma Temple- a symbol of the Great Grand Event!

title: If you are a non-hindu, you can skip this one
review: I understand the importance of this temple in Hinduism and that it's on the few temples devoted exclusively to Brahma, but it is just not very appealing for the non-hindu or tourists. There is just not a lot to see.

title: Holy temple of Pushkar
review: Very holy hindu temple. Worth a visit. Free services are offered outside the temple to store your shoes and bags. there is a cooler & water purifier too inside the temple for making drinking water available for the devotees. Multi cuisine food can also be found on the streets to cater to foreign travellers needs.

title: Not too interesting.
review: There are too many people around who try to rip you off, which really takes the fun out of it. I've seen nicer temples in India.

title: A divine place
review: The temple is one of its kind as it is the only Brahma temple in the whole world. The lake is beautiful. The temple is located in the center of a market where you can find some great showpieces for your house at reasonable prices. The temple is beautiful and it has underground shivling as well. Savitri devi temple can be viewed atop a hill from one of the windows inside the temple.

title: Excellent clean temple
review: Interesting temple, also along with the temple visited many small temples inside. Visit handicraft shop outside the temple.

title: The only shrine of lord Brahma
review: Visted the temple for prayers and was amazed with the heritage & history of this property , the temple has a statue of lord brahma which is four faced & the fourth face is visible in the mirror at the back its a experience of life , must take a guide with u who can explain u the importance and history of every small thing inside the temple.

title: Ancient Temple dedicated to God Brahma
review: This temple is over 2000 years old, but hardly known to many foreign tourists. Fortunately the driver I had hired, Tara Singh, cell(91) 9650022570, is the one who old me about it as I toured with him from New Delhi to Agra to Jaipur, (known as The Golden Triangle). The temple is one of very few existing temples dedicated to the Hindu creator-god Brahma in India and remains the most prominent among them.

title: Very beautiful
review: Definately a place to visit!

title: The temple has been the same for so many years but visit during Non mela days
review: Do not pay for anything as it is free and do not take any guides only a temple and nothing much else. Go alone and enjoy the temple.

title: Brahma temple
review: It is often described in the scriptures as the only Brahma temple in the world. Take a sacred bath before going inside temple. Three aratis are held in the temple: Sandhya arati in the evening about 40 minutes after sunset, Ratri Shayan arati (night-sleep arati) about 5 hours past sunset and Mangala arati in the morning, about 2 hours before sunrise.

title: Unique Brahma temple
review: It was totally worth visiting there.  Buy at the entrance an offering of flowers, grains and coconut walk up and experience the beauty of a religious culture that it's so distant but at the same time not so different to ours in the west.

title: Unique Temple for Hindu God Brahma
review: We made sure we included this temple in our Rajasthan tour itinerary as we were told that this temple is unique as there are no temple for Lord Brahma any where in the world. There is an interesting mythological story behind this and most guides will explain this to you. The guides are well educated and English-speaking. The marbled steps and temple court yards are impressive and interesting. No puja is conducted due to the the mythological reprimand Brahma received. Very interesting indeed for both Hindus and non-Hindus.

title: Good temple with huge crowd
review: This temple is close to Pushkar city and the only Brahma temple in the world with a true history. Temple is crowded but not that hard to handle.We got to do the parikrama within the sanctum although others were not easily allowed to.A lot many foreigners frequent this temple so do assist them as they might fall prey to the cash demands of local guides and shopkeepers.

title: Nice temple to visit
review: The temple is clean and you can explore on your own. You won't spend too long there but you must see it if you go to pushkar. You get a nice greeting with coconut, grain. It is a unique temple so you must see it.

title: Interesting Temple but beware of "helpers"
review: Pushkar is an interesting and overpriced town.  Definitely out to get the tourists - beware of "the friendly  people near the temple and the lake" it is all about getting lots of money from you, and I mean thousands of $ not rupees.  They make you chant and agree to "donate" at the top of the stairs and then you are taking to the payment booth.  If I had my time over I would give Pushkar a miss unless you are there for spiritual reasons.

title: only brahma temple in the world
review: this is the only brahma temple in the world of lord brahma with a very nice history attached to the temple.

title: One and only one Brahma ancient temple
review: Pushkar means lotus and it was from brahma that whole universe was created so brahma's very old temple who is the the creator of world. very good campus within temple. Very huge temple. Must visit!!!

title: Not nice
review: Temple itself is not particularly nice or impressive and is very crowded. However everyone will try to post you with money on your visit, you do not need to pay to leave shoes on the ground despite what they tell you, and non Hindus do not need to buy flowers or sweets to donate or donate cash.

title: The only temple of Lord Brahma in this universe
review: Visited this temple in December 2014. This is the only temple of Lord Brahma on this earth or you can say in this universe. A very sacred place for the Hindus.

title: Busy, but interesting
review: It was very busy when we went there, but it really was something to experience, we handed in our bags and shoes and went will all the people up to the temple. Everyone was super friendly and it was very interesting to witness the rituals up close.

title: Only place to worship creator of world
review: Pushkar is located near Ajmer around 15 km and many buses are availability for around 20 rs. Its up on hill and nice breeze flow all the time. Many people in queue but one can darshan in max 1 hr. Lots of foreigners stay there. I have heard unanimously from many foreigners who have visited whole india that pushkar is most chilled out place. Lots of shopping options. Handmade products at cheap prices. Must visit.

title: Nice small unique temple
review: It's mainly a nice experience since this is the only temple for Brahma in India. If you are in Pushkar, I'd suggest to visit it.

title: The only tempke of Brahma in India
review: This temple is the only temple of Brahma in whole of India ( according to scriptures - Brahma ,s wife Savitri  put a curse on Brahma when he felt infatuated by his own daughter - that people will not worship you )  The number of pilgrims coming here is huge but sadly there is no crowd management to control -a que system with a little cleanliness -  unlike most temple in South India . There are total chaos here ,the sticky floor inside main temple outside the shrine littered with the sweet candy strewn makes the feet sticky - no regular cleaning . Any devotion while going inside temple  soon evaporates when you walk on the sticky floor . The greedy pandits adding to it . You feel the relief on coming out . If Possible pray to Brahma  from outside and feel blessed - the stairs are another steep reason for you to think twice before entering . There are zero facilities here - no bath rooms , no ramps for wheelchairs ,and no parking near the temple .

title: It's really really great
review: It's really great. Please do come here. It's and magical tour. Where you can find and extremely great art.

title: So poorly kept :(
review: We are such devotees of god then how can we keep areas outside our temples SO dirty ? It is heart breaking how dirty outside of the temple is . There is no organisation and no one seems to be in charge. Stray animals, no place to walk, people spitting everywhere, hawkers bothering tourists ...

title: Nice temple .. Holy and highly religious !!
review: Brahma temple is the only real Brahma temple in the world. Its one of its kind .temple is well built and decent !!

title: Dirty and Crowded
review: Crowded and hyped.

title: ALWAYS GO ON GYARAS
review: I went there with my family.Only temple of God Brahma.Luckily i reached there on Gyaras that is on 29th june which has his importance in Hindus.This day is consider the most auspicious day for a devotee The statue of Brahma ji is one of its kind you will at once feel peace and calmness in your mind as soon as you reach there.I felt Gyaras is the best day to visit Brahma jis temple.

title: religious place
review: ancient temple of lord bramha in north india.very good place to see.i find it very peaceful and calm.My parents liked it so much.most recommendable temple in northen rajasthan.

title: Creater of the Universe
review: This temple is at a walking distance of  Pushkar Lake. One of its kind. Only Brahma Temple in India. And probably in the world. It was Full moon day and there was heavy rush of devotess. Chance met the preist and requesed him for a special darshan since my mother was with me. Yupeee and here we go. We were allowed to enter the temple and take special Darshan

title: Supreme creator
review: Only temple of Lord Brahma, not very well maintained, but when in Pushkar don't skip it, lots of  mythological stories told by Pujaris

title: Nice, but crowded
review: A really nice temple, as they all are, and probably worth a visit. But is usually very crowded and not as peaceful as the rest of Pushkar that's for sure.

title: Bramha- the creator of the Universe
review: Bramha- The Creator Of Universe. This is the main attraction of pushkar town in Ajmer district. people who visits Ajmer also travels Pushkar for darshan of Lord Bramha. It is only 15-16 KMs from ajmer.

title: Temple of World's Creator.... A must visit
review: This is know to be the only temple of God Brahma, the creator of this entire world..... Altough not mentioned properly... this is a must visit for all devotional person...

title: Only temple of Lord Brahma in the world
review: The only temple of Lord Brahma in the world, really love to be there. very peaceful and well structured temple.

title: one of oy two ir tgree Bramha yemples on the world.
review: I first visited this place in 1996, and it was very different to what it is today. Commercial traders have captured most of the shrines, and it is difficult to see inside the actual Mandir.there was a shrine of bramha half way up the stairs, which is now inside a shop, it has a metallic object which the pteust said was there for at least 8,000 yrs which is recorded. It may have been there much longer. NASA had analysed a small piece from the statue, and could not identify the elements. So I presume it could be from other space. Unfortunately this cannot be seen in the open. Someone figured another way to make money.

title: Don't waste your time
review: We spent an entire day traveling to Pushkar to see this temple in 10 minutes.  The lake is more of a reservoir.  Seriously unless it is on your way to somewhere it is a gruesome drive with very little return.

title: Brahma Temple in Pushkar
review: This is one of the places for which I had very high expectations, as suggested by many that there is only one temple of Lord Brahma in the world. Now a comment like that makes a statement in the head that it would have been incredible. But all the effort to reach there and then walk to find the temple turns out to be just another regular not so well managed place.

title: pushkar lake and brahma temple
review: Pushkar is usually known for the great pushkar mela held in nov/dec. What is lesser known is the importance of visiting pushkar and having a holy dip and performing puja on the banks of pushkar lake during Purushottam month. This is the 13th month in an otherwise 12 month hindu calendar and this occurs once every 3 years. I had been there on 19th july (purushottam mass is from 17th june 15 to 16th july 15). Take a dip in the lake at "Brahma Muhurat" which is between 3.50AM to 5.30AM and then perform "Rajaopachar puja". Please note to engage a good pandit (thankfully I got a very good one) as the ritual needs to be known and it takes an hour to hour and half. The sunrise sight during the pooja is the most holy experience and one which is superb. You can see the day break from behind the hills which is spell binding. After the puja visit the brahma temple next door, then the underground shiva temple which is there from the time of brahma's puja here. Finally visit to the Ranganath swami temple which is 3-4 km within the city is a must to complete the spirutual journey in Pushkar

title: Special and peaceful
review: I personally loved this temple best of all i visited in India.  Really spiritual feeling and welcoming - dont miss.  Make sure you take a good local guide to get to understand all the nuances and meanings.  Don´t miss.

title: Too crowded & Bad management
review: Suppose to be the only temple of Lord Brahma on Earth & very badly managed. Unless you really want to pay your homage, you can skip this one

title: Well worth the trip and hike
review: It's a long walk but worth it and with the added bonus of meeting numerous Baba's who slept locally, beautiful scenery and a step back in time.

title: Amazing Experience
review: A temple that has been taken over by the very large number of western tourists that throng the place, the visit to this temple is very unique. Unlike any other in India.

title: interesting
review: The temple architecture is simple, nothing extraordinary,but as it is a unique place you should visit when in Pushkar.

title: Great experience
review: Pushkar was one of my favourite cities in Rajasthan and visiting this temple was such an experience! Make sure you have someone to tell you all about the history of it or at the very least read up on it as it's incredibly interesting. Such a fantastic place to have visited!

title: Nice temple
review: Had been to this place near ajmer after almost 4 years, even after visiting Pushkar almost twice every year. Known to be Brahma's only temple in the world had to visit it once for sure. Architecture was normal and nothing special..! Pls ensure yo carry your sunscreen and sunglasses if u visit Pushkar in summers..!!

title: Great place.
review: Very peaceful place. You feel blessed being here.  Only brahma temple. The Bheshmani Lund was Oslo quite clean.

title: only 1
review: this is the only temple of brahma dev i have ever seen in my life. surrounded by a lake it very beautiful temple. it also remind us about the various stories we heard about the God Brahma.

title: great hindu temple
review: we was first time in hindu temple in india and it was great experence we like it very much quite peace full..we been their three time to our stay in puskhar..

title: A beautiful, peaceful place.
review: Sitting high above the town of Pushkar is the one and only Brahma temple. It is worth the climb up the many steps to see this  peaceful and beautiful temple. Not to be missed!

title: Lovely
review: Beautiful temple. No cameras or bags allowed inside though. Be careful of people trying to charge you for storing shoes and bags etc, even the guards!

title: Interesting temple
review: A quite unique place, being one of the very few (in theory the only one) temples in India dedicated to this major divinity. It seems to be a more relaxed place then many similar ones in the country - we were not surrounded by people who tried to offer us unwanted "services" in exchange of money. Be respectful and aware of the importance of the place, and try to follow the uses there - get flowers, offer them to the divinity as the locals do, and so on. Nice overall.

title: Don't fall in the trap
review: A place around 15-20 kilometres from Ajmer, people here are horrible with explaining things in the name of God and make you forcibly to pay money for their trust.. Don't fall in trap of people who assist you as guide and later take you to some pandit who will tell few mantras and later tel to deposit money for their trust

title: Divine Temple
review: Divine Temple, the only temple of Jagat Pita Brahma ji in the world. Administration should take care of Local Guide, shopkeepers irretating tourists otherwise Pushkar is nice little city.

title: Only temple in the world
review: It is very basic architecture, dedicated to Lord Brahma. it is the one and only temple of Lord Brahma. Situated on the left side of the lake.

title: Only temple in world.... Nicely built
review: We planned for pushkar , brahma temple..... In evening time we reached brahma temple. We took some prasaad and rose petals for worship. Felt blessed in front of lord brahma. Spend half hour at temple.

title: Serenity ruined by greed
review: Another of India's countless important landmarks ruined by a monopoly of ticketers, sneaky guides and phoney priests. You are assaulted before you enter by several groups of people claiming to be the official government locker company - they take your things and demand money before you are allowed to enter. Then one of many lurking locals on the steps attach themselves to you, rapidly spouting information and trying to build rapport with you with the usual questions about family and nationality. Difficult to refuse people who imply your lack of cooperation offends their religion. I had the whirlwind tour, offering flowers and mints to various statues and having no time to appreciate any of it. Then comes the obligatory haggle over how much money you are giving them for the privilege. Arguing over money inside the temple walls is a surefire way to blast away any hint of serenity. I left with a sour taste in the mouth and I was downright surprised nobody asked for money for 'watching my shoes'.

title: Don't bother
review: You get hassled as you approach the temple to take off your shoes - fine. Then they fill your hands with flowers inside an old bit of newspaper and send you in, then someone else hassles you inside telling you about the temple which you don't need, then takes you down to the lake and you get hassled again and asked for money for someone to give you a 'good luck' prayer. Pushkar could be such a peaceful place to visit but it's ruined by the few who hassle tourists non-stop. Avoid.

title: magnificent
review: Its amazing and its the only temple in world havong bramha indradev kuber bhagwan.i liked the temple.And the shoekeeper aunty who dint take a penny for keeping our shoes neither forced us to buy flowers or prashad.

title: yeah, pushkar is pushy
review: just what to confirm what everybody says. It's the temple that attracts most people. We scouted it the day before, so today I left shoes / camera / phone with my friend. A hinderance at the entrance showed sign that I cannot get in, but a few guys inside said I can, and I got in. After taking turns with her, the hinderance say we must not come here again. Not that we care as we already seen what's inside, not much actually. We also saw tourists chose to leave their belongings to a restaurant/tea shop close-by skipping those men.

title: first and foremost visit
review: the place is only one in pushkar where u should visit as the god brahmas finest temples been worshiped as per my knowledge

title: The temple is nice
review: The people near the temple I hated a lot,they are way uneducated and treats like hell the tourists.I'm giving an excellent rating just because of the temple and architecture but for the people there I give zero rating,just go by your self and do your things do not talk to these people around.

title: Only temple of lord Brahma
review: In india this is the only Brahma temple...Here one thing that lord Brahma is not worshiped in India...it has story behind it...initially there was a fight between lord Vishnu and Brahma over supremacy...lord Shiva asked them to find out the end of his shivling but none were able to even trying to find the end for 1000 years ...lord Vishnu came to know abt lord Shivas greatness ...and stopped going forward..but Brahma didn't stop and told that he has seen the end...but it was not the end...due to his proud ego ..and the lie...he was punished of not being worshiped..and his favourite lotus would be given to Vishnu ...here this temple don't allow camera and security guards break the memory card and also cuts the battery if found...it is a rare place...must visit and do dwell for the history....

title: The one and only
review: The only Lord Brahma temple on earth is this and it is honor for us that it is in Pushkar, Rajasthan. As I am Rajasthan I love to be here always. It feels me calm and relax, and I lost all my worries and all. This city called Pushkar is also famous for its animal fest, weapons, art and yes tattoo artists. If you are planning for Rajasthan trip include this place on top columns and yes one more thing plan it in winter seasons only.

title: One and only
review: Pushkar is about 10km from Ajmer.  A visit to Brahma Temple is a must as it is the only temple in world dedicated to Brahma.  Bags and shoes are to be left outside the temple premises.  Photography is not allowed in the temple.  So leave all valuables and cameras in a safe place.  Beware of touts and pickpockets.  The temple is closed in the afternoon.

title: Said to be the only one
review: Brahma's temple is also a must-go when you visit Ajmer. Pushkar is very near to Ajmer. We visited the place in evening. You must leave your valuables, cameras, ladies purse etc behind.

title: Only if you must
review: Ok if you're Brahmin or have a great need to see all temple then go. I wanted to seek it out because of the story of Brahma in Pushcar. Savor the story and forget this temple visit. It's crazy crowded and dirty w armed guards. People will be soliciting money and begging.

title: Beware of Pujarees... Temples & premises are worth visits
review: Its big premises of Pushkar Temple having so called Temple of Brahma God in the world. Other temples are also there, good water base & in front of temples on other side are Starred hotels. Only thing one should be careful of Pujaris, they have their ways to extort. So happened with me in spite of being CAUTIOUS, better no Pooja through them.

title: Only Temple of Brahma in World
review: This is the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world, and religious place. You will not find any architecture work here.

title: Vary oooousum
review: We are going and vary cool and vary mute palace and vary foreigner vary population is vary coming that place good this I love is

title: Well worth a visit during time of Pushkar Camel Fair
review: The Brahma's Temple is well worth visiting.  Normally we do not want a guide at these kinds of places, but here it was quite helpful at the time of crowded religious visits coinciding with the time of the Pushkar Camel Fair.  There was no fee, but we paid someone to watch our shoes since it is necessary to be barefoot, and of course tipped our guide.  The Temple is not very large, but it was colorful and musicians were performing.  NO CAMERAS were allowed.  About one hour is recommended.

title: Not very interesting for a lay person
review: We visited the Brahma Temple in Pushkar just after it opened for the afternoon.  Unfortunately, there was no chanting going on at this time and we found the temple itself to be rather uninspiring.  You cannot take any cameras or wear shoes inside the temple.  Waiting outside, many touts are set up to hold these items for you in exchange for a fee.  We found these touts to be overwhelming, so we visited the temple one at a time in order to avoid them.

title: Pushy priests
review: We were warned about pushy priests in Pushkar, but were shocked at how demanding they were. We were steered towards a priest and who told me that I should be giving £60 if I wanted good karma for my family. He was quite insistent when I said I wouldn't give this amount, and then lowered the amount to £50. Unsurprisingly I didn't give this either.

title: Temple of Lord Brahma
review: This is world famous temple of Lord Brahma out of rare temple of Bruhma's. It is believed that temple is about 2000 years old. Nice temple made of marble,granite and stone Slabs. There are three Puja-Aarati performed daily named Mangala Aarati, Sandhya Aarati and Ratri Shayan Aarati. Nice visit.

title: Nice and Calm
review: Shut between 1.30 PM - 3 PM every day, the visit to one of the only Brahma Temple was nice. There were not too many lines or waiting and a slight walk up the stairs takes you to the main temple.

title: Unique one
review: This is the one and only one Bramha temple in the world. Best time to visit is early morning. I have never seen such a temple in any place, thats why its so special.

title: Evening Aarthi
review: We were lucky to be visiting during Aarthi time, the Temple exudes an aura of Times gone by, and Creator at His Best. The Temple Bells add to your feeling of being closer than ever, to the Presense of Brahma. The shops lining on either side of your road to temple offer a wide selection of local things.The steps to God's abode may be the only thing that will bother a few of elderly's. Great place to visit!

title: peaceful
review: Nice place to sit around peacefully.

title: The ultimate mandir
review: This is the only Brahma Mandir in the world. So if you are in Pushkar or nearby a visit to this mandir is a must

title: The one & only one Brahma Mandir in the world
review: Being the only Brahma Mandir in the world it was an experience and opportunity of a lifetime.

title: BRAHMA TEMPLE - PUSHKAR
review: The only single temple of Lord Brahma is situated here in a hillock in Pushkar . Great place to visit as its pre-historic and a mysterious  setting along the entire lake , bit similar to Rishikesh , a must visit when you are in Pushkar or Ajmer.

title: Skip it
review: Unless you are involved in religion, this temple has no "visual' interest.

title: Brahamas temple  in Pushkar - Rarest one
review: The ultimate one -  one of the rarest temple for brahma in the world - holy place to visit in pushkar , (historic one)

title: Ancient temple
review: Only one temple of brahma in india that is in pushkar. Pushkar srovar called tirthraj is very good spritual place in Rajasthan.

title: very good
review: i excited to see the lord brahma temple in pushkar.it has historical evidences that the only temple in the world.but so many brahma temples in india.this is only temple maintained strictly the brahma worships.it is surrounded by cc cameras.it is fully crowded.but i visited this temple by 6am,12 feb,2015.photo graphy stirctly prohibited inside.but i dont how the people made the photography inside by some reviewers.the security check is must.it is wonderful holy place of the our fates decider the god brahma.

title: Ancient Temple worth a visit
review: The place is located amidst the market area and has idol of Brahma which is hundreds of years old. It also houses a Shiv Ling in the premises, Known to be the only Brahma temple in the world.

title: Only Brahma Temple in the world...
review: This is only the temple in the world.

title: The only God Brahma Temple
review: We went with our guide to Brahma Temple.  I'm glad we went with the guide to learn the history of the temple.  It is in the midst of the markets in Pushkar.

title: The only temple of Brahma Temple in the whole world.
review: The only temple of Brahma Temple in the whole world situated in Pushkar city. One has to first visit the pushkar lake and cleanse our hands and legs...then we have to visit the temple. There are 100 steps we have climb to reach the Brahma Temple. The idol of Brahma is very beautiful and we were pleased after visiting the temple.

title: Only Temple Of Brahma Ji... worth a visit
review: This is the only Brahma temple in the world. Not much commercialisation as seen in other places. One can offer according to wish.The temple is situated in the mid of narrow Pushkar markets..  It is located at a little height and you have to take stairs to reach there. The parking is an issue so make sure to plan accordingly. You can buy Prasad and flowers from one of the many shops downstairs and they will be kind enough to allow you to leave your footwears in exchange . you can take holy dip near temple if you want or just visit lake and forward to temple you have private cloak room facility is available near temple. temple z closed in the afternoon.

title: Rare Temple.. must visit
review: This is one of the most rare temple in India. If you are in pushkar you must visit this place. Place is nice and clean

title: Can Visit - but Beware of Locals
review: There is nothing great about this temple other than the fact that its the only Brahma temple.

title: only Brahma Temple in the World
review: Mandir is good but beware of animals, and Cleaniness is not good in the mandir premises...... good to visit the same a lake nearby is also good

title: Only Bhrama Temple
review: Worth a visit as it is of great importance to all Hindus, being the only temple dedicated to Lord Bhrama. Oh and do not talk to anyone approaching you as a "Priest", just another scam.

title: Beware of costs of Puja
review: Its a nice place but stay away from all the Brahamans there if you dont wanna spend a lot of money for puja. They will take you to Pushkar lake and ask for donation to their trust.

title: Nice Temple
review: Nice temple. Cameras not allowed inside, the shops outside have lockers. Temple is good and reasonably clean. They do not allow flower offerings at the main deity, so don't bother to take them. Donation boxes are available, just in case you wish to.  You may want to check out the timings, they are closed at particular time during the day.

title: Interesting to walk round.
review: It was interesting to walk round the temple, but there wasn't a lot to see, compared to some other temples elsewhere.

title: Lord Brahma's unique temple
review: This temple is unique in the sense it is the only Brahma temple in the world in Pushkar city.As a result of a curse there is no other temple exists for Lord Brahma. It is a small and beautiful ancient temple. It is maintained clean. When we visited in the forenoon there is not much crowd and had dharshan with in 30 - 40 minutes. The queue is orderly. No pandas harassment as in some temples and had peaceful prayer. I felt blessed offering prayer in this one and only temple for Lord Brahma, who is the God entrusted with creation.

title: Over Hyped
review: Brahma's Temple is a nice temple but does not live up to all the hype. People in the area will tell tourist that this is the only temple to Brahma which is not entirely true.

title: Important shrine for pilgrims
review: As it is the only Brahma temple in world, it is considered a very important religious place. The temple in itself is not a very big one. There is not much to see, architecturally speaking. It is just an attraction center for religious purpose.

title: Temple
review: It's a temple, honestly more hassle to get into than it's worth if you're not Hindu and Brahma has no special significance to you. It's free though, so if you've got lots of time in Pushkar, it's not the biggest waste of your time.

title: Very Good Place
review: A must visit when in Ajmer, the only Brahma temple in the world, nice place and do visit the sarovar nearby, sitting on the banks of it gives immense peace.

title: The only temple of the world of God Brahma is in Pushkar
review: I had visited the temple along with my wife and twin sons on the 9th Feb, it was great to take the blessings of God Brahma, very divine place.

title: Only One of its kind
review: this place is mesmerizing where you get to see the creator who started every thing. what a place no words can explain the feeling. must to see places in the world

title: Watch out!!!
review: When you first arrive in Pushkar you will be mulled if you dont have a bracelet on your wrist that shows you have been blessed by the Brahmas priest. They will take you down and do a little blessing and then try to get money out of you!! they ask for a lot. like 10$ per person in your family(for me it was at least $60 they were asking). just be prepared.

title: BRAHMAJI revisited!!
review: friendly people taking care of your shoe pairs for free. whether you buy flowers or not, is not important or necessary. inside temple there is always a que these days. women should be given different que and managed properly and without rush!

title: Neat & CLEAN HOLY Temple FOR HINDUS
review: Its a neat & clean temple,not too long a queue,darshan is easy,not too many rituals to follow,touts usually don't pester you. Hindus have lot of respect for this place. Since it is a temple with a unique history(read on internet) hence mandatory for all hindus visiting Ajmer/Pushkar.

title: Beautiful
review: Be sure to leave your backpacks/cameras behind, or you'll not be allowed inside. Husband stayed outside and enjoyed a different kind of spiritual experience...feeding and connecting with the black faced monkeys!

title: Nice temple, with bit of commercialisation
review: This is a nice temple to visit, and is marketed as the only brahma temple in India. There is an interesting story as to why this happened.

title: Crowdy but one of its kind
review: Its the well known place on earth.One of its own kind.

title: Be careful of the priests
review: An ancient temple where priests are like vultures.  Outside the temple,  one will be invited by by a guide for Rs . 100 charge.  But as soon as you enter the temple, be prepared to be ripped apart. My advise go visit,  don't hire a guide or a priest. If done, might end up emptying  your pockets with a false assurance from priests, that almighty has safeguarded you because you have contributed donations here.

title: Only Lord Bhrama Temple in World
review: If you are in Pushkar, you should definitely pay a visit to this holy place. A small temple, but historically very significant. Try shopping outside the temple, lots of food and drinks ( Lassi etc) available. Try buying Gulkand and Rose Water. Its famous here.

title: Very busy and very smelly
review: This is not one of the best or most memorable temples I have visited. I understand that this place is sacred for the Hindu's but for the Western tourist I do not think it is really worth the trip.

title: Well maintained holly place
review: It is one of the holly places where people wont cheat and try to loot you.

title: Beware of priest and Fake guides..!
review: As our extended tour to Jaipur i went to Pushkar along with my family and my mother in law. When we reached to pushkar our bus driver introduced us to a person who took us to Brahma temple. After that he took us to pushkar lake where he explained pushkar history and how pushkar lake created by lord brahma. Then he offered us to do 21Rs pooja alongwith pundit and we readily agreed as spending 21Rs was no big deal. Pundit did 10 min pooja and after that played real game , he asked us to give donations to distribute free foods to poor. All starting from Rs2200 and as minimum Rs 500, we all immediately came to know its Trap & we started denying. But my mother in law got into trap and she did Rs 500 donation. Friends these people can do anything for money, they plots trap to catch older ladies so that they can loot them easily.Beware of pundits and their commission Agents while visiting Pushkar lake.

title: For the tourist, is nothing special
review: This is a very ordinary temple for the tourist, despite being very, very special for Hindus.

title: Temple, in a modern sense
review: This temple is definitely a place of pilgrimage and worship. The buildings are not historical, but to Hindus the sites stands out for its singularity. It is the one place in India of significance where Brahma is worshiped. If you understand that that is why it is important, and not the historical setting, then you're on your way to a better understanding of India.

title: Camera not allowed in the temple premises
review: Temple has varied versions of stories. The localities in the vicinity are not trustworthy, they will sell u 'Puja samgri', however those flowers are thrown in the bins inside the temple. It is too crowded and since camera is not allowed in the temple, my recommendation is not to carry it. There is ongoing 'langar', where u are served with khitchi.  Overall, the temple is worth a one time visit, though there is nothing extra ordinary.

title: nice place
review: Good place ..but is crowded .There is also a shiva lingam there inside the temple and is good. YOu can feel the positive energy there. Beware of being cheated by locals.

title: One on raretemples allowing visitors
review: it is quite a  walk , and need to give your shoes and your bag. Very busy and not as beautiful as many other temples in Pushkar.

title: Thumbs up to Rajasthan govt. and Temple managment.
review: It was apleasure to see the temple neat and clean. It was a good feeling to see it so clean as it was not well managed and cleaned in past years.

title: Not intersting
review: When  you arrive near the temple's premises, a group of people rush to you to get your shoes in exchange for some money. Well, there is not much to see in the temple and altogether it will take you 5 minutes to walk around the temple.

title: Good but beware of pandits
review: Overall arrangements are ok but beware of pandits and local people nearby the arena near pushkar lake. Any local person will grab you and will take you to pushkar lake. Then some pandit will give you a pooja thaali and will start pooja. In middle of pooja he will ask you to donate more than thousand rs for food for beggers ( in hindi it is called lungar). If you deny him he will get annoyed and will stop the pooja in middle. They will not even allow you to sit near lake. Beware of these kind of people. Otherwise overall arrangements are ok

title: Most prominent among all temples of Brahma
review: This Hindu temple is situated at Pushkar in state of Rajasthan, It is built close to the sacred Pushkar Lake. The temple is one of very few existing temples dedicated to the Hindu creator-god Brahma in India. This temple is the most prominent among all of them.

title: brahma sarovar
review: very beautiful and panoramic sarovar. the pond has a shiv temple in its centre. after taking a dip in the holy water the the pilgrims must go to the brahma temple which is at a distance of 500 meters from the sarovar.

title: Only Brahma temple in the world
review: Keep the title in the mind as the only Brahma temple in the world then u will feel excited otherwise it's a normal temple with normal architecture. No worship here as Brahma was cursed by his first wife. There is a interesting story behind the temple. Main attraction at pushkar.

title: Only temple of lord Brahma
review: It is said to be only temple of lord Brahma in the world. Going to the temple by staircase in the crowded place is a challenge. You need to go before 1.30 pm, as it is a closing time, temple opens after a gap of one hour then.

title: Beautiful temple on smaLL Hill
review: The Temple is famous as it claims to be the only Temple of Brahma in the world. The road leading to the temple is bit disappointing but once you climb the steps up and reach the temple you forget all other things, Visit here during evening time when Aarti is performed. I reached there at 5.15pm and the Aarti was at 18.00. On way to the temple be careful of many people approaching you. They may miss-guide you and you may end-up paying a lot in name of Puja's and offerings. They may also approach you by asking just Rs. 11 for showing the temple but DON'T USE ANY help from any people as you won't need it. If you wish to offer flowers then buy from the shops near the steps to the temple and you can leave your shoes there too if you buy flowers from them. If you are there during the Aarti be careful of your belongings.

title: Pushkar stay
review: We stayed in Pushkar for 3 days as part of a holiday touring some of India. I loved the lake and the temples around it. The town was also interesting if you stayed for a while. Busy streets, good places to hang out.

title: only temple said to be of brahma
review: i went to the temple as it was said to be only major temple dedicated to brahma, the temple is beside a very big pushkar lake and made of fully of marble

title: Con Priests
review: We Had a nasty experience in Pushkar. At the Lake in Pushkar we were somehow deceived in sitting with the priests on the steps of the lake.

title: Visit During Sunrise for Prayers
review: The only known temple in world for Brahma. Read the story of this interesting story online and go. Being situated in the middle of market, ensure you wear loose footwear. Wear full clothes specially for girls. Footwear needs to be left outside.DO not CARRY important gadgets as needs to be deposited. Beware of pick pockets.

title: Holy place
review: The only temple of Brahma in the world...

title: Quite nice - but beware of frauds
review: The temple itself is rather nice and worth a visit. It is untypical for India to worship Brahma so even if you have been to numerous temples this visit might be something new to you.

title: only Brahma Temple but not exiting..
review: Many times I have visited this Temple. People get exited at the word only Temple, but if you miss it, is it not a big deal. That is not only my opinion, but my guests as well. A small Black Brahma statue, and some other shrines as well. Be aware of the following: You have to leave shoes, camera, lighters , almost everything (prev. your whole bag) behind in the lockers from nearby shops. It cost approx. 100 rs. but its safe. No photo s allowed in temple. The Temple is also closed at a certain time after lunch for couple of hours...Inform about this pls..to avoid disappointment.

title: Middle of nowhere
review: Located in the middle of a very dirty town, the temple itself is tiny and rather uninteresting for a tourist, especially if you have to drive a lot to get here (approx. 3 hours away from Jaipur).

title: A Unique Holistic Brahma’s Temple in the World
review: Located in Pushkar near to Ajmer, Rajasthan. This is the only Brahma temple in the world and believed to be 2000 years old. Temple architecture is very attractive, marble floor and walls inside the temple have been engraved with hundreds of silver coins. Right time of visiting is early in the morning. The temple is open for worship between 6:30 am and 8:30 pm during winter and 6:00 am to 9:00 pm during summer, with an interval in the afternoon between 1:30 pm to 3:00 pm when the temple is closed. Near the temple there is a huge market of clothes and other stuffs. There is also his wife’s temple on the top hill of Pushkar just opposite to the Brahma temple.

title: World's only lord Brahma temple
review: Not much commercialisation as seen in other places. One can offer according to wish. Try to visit at early morning. Liked that place.

title: Pushkar Temple.
review: Only Brahma temple in the world. But could have been cleaner.

title: The only Temple in the World
review: This is the only temple dedicated to lord Brahma in the world and it is said that the married people donot offer any prayers and Prasad etc in it. The temple is spectacular.

title: Peddling God!
review: The temple is small and nice and shouldn't take more than thirty minutes to see. What was annoying however, was that after entering Pushkar our car was chased around by men on bikes offering to show us around. This is typical of a number of tourist places but one tends to feel worse when coupled with the fact that you are in a religious place. Our guide wanted INR 50 to show us the "kund" and temple. That was fine but he promptly landed us in the hands of a pandit who wanted us to donate INR 1100 or more in the name of our forefathers. Be careful of the "guides" and "pandits" and be very sure of what you are agreeing to!

title: Too crowded
review: I had heard a lot about Brahma temple and since this is the ONLY ONE - we went to visit it. Maybe it was a day before Janmashtmi but it was so crowded that there was barely any space to breathe. We were almost being tossed from one place to another and had to keep a close watch on our belongings. I walked till the temple but looking at the crowd , I had to come back without getting inside

title: Main landmark in Pushkar
review: One of the most famous landmark in Pushkar. Don't get carried away by the local guides. One can go one your own and visit the temple.

title: must visit place once if you plan for jaipur
review: this is the only temple for Lord Brahma, and must visit if you plan for Jaipur or ajmer. from ajmer you have easy option auto or taxi even budget traveller can get government bus ticket about 20 rupees. this place is good to purchase Bangles . you can take holy dip too but don't relay on pandits there , you can go on your own from ajmer and have a good dharshan.

title: Brahma temple
review: This is one of the 3 brahma temples in India- others are near mount Abu and one in northern part of India again. The temple is maintained neatly. The place is also frequented by lot of foreigners venturing in multiple modes of transport-- camel ride to moped ride to a bullet ride. Good for those who are seeking spiritual blessing

title: Very significant
review: I visited the temple during my sightseeing tour of Pushkar.   My guide instructed me to leave my camera, bag and shoes over at a small shop opposite the temple.   We climbed the steps and walked (clockwise) round the quite small temple.   It's quite fascinating to see the names of so many visitors on the walls and surrounding area.   I wasn't really sure what I was meant to do,  having been given some flowers to take into the temple.   However,  my guide instructed me where to leave them and we circled the temple.  It was very crowded,  unbelievable amount of flies (on anything left as an offering (like rice or food) and it smelt.    But....I am glad I saw it.

title: Only temple of Lord Brahma in the world,a place of religious importance for Hindus
review: Only temple of Lord Brahma in the world,a place of religious importance for Hindus.The ghat is not well maintained & the water is dirty.

title: Temple
review: Too crowded. Too many shopkeepers outside hassling for business. Once inside, temple is unique. Must see the place if you can just walk past the distractions

title: Divine
review: this is the only Brahma Temple in the World, surrounded by the mountains, situated Near the lake, Loved this Place, definitely visit again.

title: Old temple , nice visit
review: The temple is one of very few existing temples dedicated to the Hindu creator-god Brahma in India. It' in main market of puskar, crowded place with narrow streets , good temple and unique because of Brahma, we didn't find Brahma temples in other part of india.

title: If you are in Pushkar, if don't want to miss it
review: It's the only (or probably only 1 of the 2) Brahma temple in the world. The temple is situated in the mid of narrow Pushkar markets and some 40 steps will take you there. Its a sacred place so appropriate wearing and behaviour is a must. The parking is an issue so make sure to plan accordingly. I personally prefer to walk to reach the temple.

title: HIstoric temple
review: only known temple of lord brahma in India.not very clean ,not maintained properly.beware of local pandas(priests).

title: just as any temple but there is just one in this world
review: just pray and get blessed. DO NOT PAY ANYONE ...espicially the pandits who will embarass you to the ground till you pay. infact these goons have card accepting system to take money.

title: Brahma's Only Temple?
review: I read and also told by locals that this is the only temple of Lord Brahma in the entire universe. Though I am not sure, but I have not heard of or seen any other either.

title: "great way to explore the hindusim"
review: one of the best temple we have seen so far in india.there are nice mountan around the temple abe you can see the devotee in different colourful dresses of rajasthani traditional style.

title: Gre
review: The only Brahma Temple of the world with great historical value. We visited when there was Pushkar fair but luckily not much crowd. Had fun in the fair and also tried Malpue which very famous sweet dish. Enjoyed the place.

title: the great Lord Brahma
review: i hear about brahma temple ffrom my friend but when i see in real its a peaceful place and very well manage temple by local pandit.

title: Time in the temple
review: Beautiful marble and other colours in this temple. Be weary, they will try and demand a "donation" from you but you can refuse. You also can't bring bags or cameras in.

title: The only temple in india dedicated to Lord Brahma
review: This is the one and only brahma temple in india and makes the city of pushkar a holy one due to its presence.The Rajasthan police and temple administration shd do a little more so all visitors get a chance of minimum decent darshan-The large and uncontrolled crowd makes the experience a dull one.

title: Interesting....... I guess?
review: For Hindu's the gods are very important, not sure if I need to see all the temples in India, but I respect the opportunity to engage in their world for a short time in mine. Great to see how a culture pays homage to their gods.

title: Most Important Temple in Pushkar
review: No 1 attraction in Pushkar, a must visit and only Bramha temple that exist as they say. Very good temple, didn't find priests very aggressive there. Temple premises has some kind of positive energy I guess.

title: Lord Brahma's Temple Pushkar
review: Do not miss this temple when you visit Rajasthan.  Only temple for Lord Brahma exist in the world.  Temple premises very quiet and calm with decent surroundings.  Do not expect too much about this temple when you heard or plan to visit but to enjoy your presence on reaching this temple and treasure the memory with good pictures with your family members.  Krishna Duvvuri

title: One of the very few temples for Lord Brahma
review: One of the very few temples in India for Lord Brahma. Just a few precautions. Leave your shoes to the caretaker below the temple and it would be safe. Camera is not allowed inside the temple. A very good temple, one of great historical importance.

title: Temple for Brahmaji
review: This temple apart from its v architecture is famous and draws importance because it's the first temple, which i think is dedicated to lord Bramha.

title: Only temple of Lord Brahma in the world
review: Easy to reach and you do not need a guide or priest. Being the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world, it is visited by everyone visiting Pushkar. You would need to climb some steps, around 40-50 to reach the temple. As the place is crowded, keep a check on your expensive stuff. Mobiles and Camers are not allowed to be taken inside the temple.

title: The Only Brahma Temple in the world
review: As the title says, situated on the banks of the Pushkar Lake, the Temple itself is a must see for any traveller.

title: Nice. Must Visit.
review: Although the people kept running behind you to show you around, I'd prefer seeing around for myself. This is the only Brahma temple in the world and when you visit Pushkar, this temple is a must visit place. Visiting it made me feel serene. But try not to over pay the people on the street. They have a bad habbit of running behind for money which gets pretty frustrating eventually. Just be careful and dont carry too many valuable items.

title: The only Temple in the Country
review: Historic temple and the only temple in india of Bramha, Hire a guide in as low as Rs. 21 and he/she will tell you the entire history and the way to visit the temple.

title: Pushkar Fair
review: The placed was packed with devotees and one never actually gets to spend any time for reflection or spiritual connection.  Although it is a very religious site and one is not suppose to pray there it is hard to find any connection because of the crowds. There is just a moving wall of people who push and pull trying to get a closer view of Lord Brahma and before you know it your past and on the other side.

title: Extremely Crowded
review: Brahma's Temple is VERY crowded during the Pushkar Fair. We didn't manage to get in due to the long lines and an impatient toddler. It is beautiful from the outside.  Do know that you can't bring in cameras or mobile phones and must take off your shoes. Expect hordes around the temple. It is easy to find from the fairground as there are signs pointing your way. Also note that it is closed early afternoon for about 2 hrs for priests to perform rituals, so don't plan to go between about 1:30 and 3:30 (though I'm not sure of the exact times)

title: Really busy
review: This temple was really busy when we visited with lots of queue flies every where as the leave sweets as gifts

title: Unique Temple
review: It is said that is it one of the only Temple of Brahma in India.It is very beautiful. it is located in the main market place near lake.there is idol of Vishnu and Kuber in the same temple.one should visit the temple as it has a history and unique.

title: Agents have destroyed the serenity
review: First beware of the friendly person who drives on a bike and approaches you as soon as you alight down from auto. They claim to tell you history and show you around for only 30 INR, but that is just the beginning. They would take you to one of the corners of the entrance of ghat and explain you the importance and history of puskhar and how worshiping it would help you.

title: Visit with Friends
review: Liking :- Market is having lots of art with good pricing, Temple is good with lake . Can hold you to stay there for while

title: must visit but ruined by pandits and  lake not well kept
review: only temple of brahma ji in world ! but ruined by some priests , not well kept , though you cant miss this place ! its still worth going as noone knows when pushkar you go again

title: Seen ONE Brahma's Temple you've seen the lot!
review: Yep there's only one in India. So if you've seen this one in Pushkar you don't need to bother seeking out any more. It's not special like the Vatican or Mecca. It's low key for the god who is the Hindu creator. Shoes off.

title: “Jagatpita Brahma Mandir”
review: The only thing Good About this temple is that - Its The only Temple of Lord Bramha In the World. The temple was neat and clean. The market surrounding the temple was also lively, and colorful.

title: oldest and only one famous brahma temple in pushkar
review: i visited brahma temple on 19 october 2014 with my wife and at first i came to sarover where we have bathed and then we went to brahma temple ( around 150 meters away). we visited in brahma temple and there were  crowd of peoples in temple from all over india. Every people want to see the statue of brahma and also there  is all god goddess statue. And in this temple, narayan god mini temple also. overall i enjoyed with cal mind and in the market near brahma temple, there are a number of varieties of rajasthani culutural goods.

title: Very Pecefull
review: Good to visit, its an ancient temple, may get some peace of mind, located near Holy pushker lake and Pushker animal fare ground.

title: Calm and Spiritual
review: Visit to the temple was less crowded. Felt blessed. A must visit for all Pushkar goers and right in the Pushkar city.

title: great palace to visit
review: i have been to brahmas temple. i felt very nice there . people are very friendly in the temple. this is the cleanes temple i have been to.the atmospher is very unique. one who looking for  shanti should visit this temple.

title: The only temple where you can worship Lord Brahma.
review: It is pretty close to the bus stand, but it is preferable to take an auto. The place is nicely maintained and you can avail free lockers near the entrance. Beware of touts and shopkeepers who will just drag you to their shops.

title: Good place to be at
review: its easily accessible, and situated at the middle of market, very near to the mela ground....have good cloak room, beware of shopkeepers who ask you to keep your belongings at their shops..temple has a cloak room of its own which is Free of cost and is clean.

title: A beautiful Brahma temple coated in gold
review: One of the very few Brahma temples in India, this temple is located just in front of the Pushkar kund or lake.

title: Holy place
review: The only Brahma Temple in the world! The temple was neat and clean. The market surrounding the temple was also lively, and colourful.

title: One of the oldest Brahma Temple
review: There are not many Brahma Temples out there so this one deserves a visit. After visit to the temple, the market outside seemed to be the main market. That is a good market to buy souvenirs and other Rajasthani stuff for good price.

title: Temple where god is not worshiped
review: There were basically no pandits for dakshina. you may voluntarily deposit the amount you wish in the trust.

title: brahma ka ek sthan
review: yeh brahma ji ek hi mandir hai,you should visit it but beware of pandits guides they are there to fleece you.

title: The creator's Temple
review: It is Brahma Ji's only temple in India, sole temple! Yet, it has not been maintained properly. The temple is in dire need of good management. In fact, it is one of the most beautiful and holy temples of our country yet it hasnt been given much care.

title: Holy Place
review: only place where lord bramha is worshipped...no prasad is taken for the deity here, has a shiv temple inside... visit purely for devotional reasons.

title: Unique place, common woes!
review: Pushkar is known across India for the only temple dedicated to Brahma, the creator of this universe according to Hindu mythology. It's also known the world over for various other things.

title: Special place in history ruined by the so called priests...
review: This temple has a special place in history since it is the only bramha temple in the world, so I have heard....The place, though little unclean, like most of the temples in India, is situated around a beautiful self contained lake giving the place a pleasant feel..do visit this place due to its uniqueness and pls for gods sake don't engage with any of the priests or buy their nonsensical argument of being a mediator to god...most of them, if not all are thugs..

title: very crowded
review: the temple located inside the market. apart from the busy market the temple itself tend to be crowded all the time. you are not allowed to take pictures inside the temple and you must leave behind any camera or ipad (mobile phones are allowed). for a good service there is a shop there that offers lockers for a cheap fee so you can keep your belongings until you are done with your visit to the temple.

title: Unique and worth the visit
review: Hard to believe, but this is the only temple of its kind - so totally worth the visit. It will not be stroll in the park as it's extremely crowded most of the time, but then again, this is nothing new for India. Much of the spiritual life in the town revolves around this god, so not to be missed. It's kind of hard to find as it is on a street adjacent to a street market and the signs are not very clear.

title: Be cautious of scams
review: Watch out. Don't be misled like I was and allow someone to give you a tour of the temple. There are whole host of boys standing outside the temple waiting to pounce on unsuspecting foreigners. How the temple and authorities allow this to happen I do not know but it reflects badly upon the Brahman temple. I was taken around and then pressurised into donating in a multiple of RS300. It was ludicrous. I met another traveller in Pushkar who was given flowers to put in the lake, then pressured into giving many dollars as a 'donation'. Utter nonsense.

title: one of the holy trinity of Hinduism
review: Very few temples to Lord Brahma exist anywhere in the world. it was built in 14th Century in city Pushkar. Pushkar in Sanskrit means blue lotus flower.[2] Hindus believe that the gods released a swan with a lotus in its beak and let it fall on earth where Brahma would perform a grand yagna. The place where the lotus fell was called Pushkar.

title: Old and only one in the world
review: Yes , this temple is the only one in the world where Hindu God Brahma is worshipped. Good temple to visit , it is dirty at times but manage it since you have come so far ! You can't carry your cameras , phones and other devices so leave it in the car or keep it in the locker.

title: It may be the only Brahman temple but....
review: Beautiful temple but be careful you don to get ripped off. The guy in the temple who says he wants no money and looks 'official' gives you a good tour but then takes you to a 'faux' Brahman who chants and recites prayers for you and your family and then as part of the prayer agrees with you a donation to the poor - takes you to an 'official' office in the grounds and you part with your money - note apparently according to our guide - it really doesn't go to the local poor!

title: Holy
review: Wish people understood the value of patience and queues. Was literally abused for not taking a guide for Rs. 50. :)

title: Unique temple of Lord Brahma.
review: As pilgrim says that Lord Brahma is unique temple in the world , Beautiful temple and good spiritual too. Many spirituals people come to worship of Lord Brahma.

title: good
review: visited for blessing ..well structured and hired a guide for bit historical review..nothing much to look around

title: OK whilst in Pushkar
review: A fairly standard Indian Temple, go in a group so one of you can look after the shoes. The temple is fairly extensive but not overly spectacular. As per usual we were harassed by 'tour guides' to show us all the rituals surrounding the temple.

title: Only Brahma Temple in the world
review: The Pushkar Brahma Temple is located on the banks of the Pushkar Lake. The temple was originally built in the 14th century and stands on a raised platform...

title: Too crowded but worth a visit
review: It takes a km and half on foot to reach the temple. during peak aarti hours it becomes too crowded for a family with small kids and older people to climb stairs and manage a darshan.

title: Holy
review: This Is the only temple Of God Brahma on this Earth,

title: Religiously Significant but too crowded for comfort
review: I understand it is religious significant, but don't think it is for regular traveler. I hope that regular traveler like me go to these places to see the beauty of the place and to experience the calmness, but not the case over here, The place is too crowded and not well maintained, or it could be because of crowd itself. There are not many thing to do in Pushkar, you will be just ticking off place like me in tripadvisor.

title: Nice Place
review: Good but overcrowded all the time. Worth visiting it for 1st time since this is the only Brahma temple in entire world. Inside crowded lanes, approach might be disappointing and you need to carry minimum baggage with you. Camera and ipads not allowed inside the temple. so better dont carry em with you.

title: unique
review: The only temple dedicated to the Creator ! Always crowded but really interesting to be there. Unfotrunatly pictures dont allowed.

title: visit once
review: Visit once as its the only temple of bramha in the world. Otherwise its very crowded, you wont even get to see the idol properly. Cameras and hand bags are not allowed inside. There are lockers available below the temple to keep these. Use local transport to reach here as parking is not available.

title: Not a tourist attraction
review: Well, the guide book said it was a "must see" and perhaps for Hindu travellers and those with a real interest in religion it actually is, but it was not the high point of my trip to Pushkar. I got taken on a whirlwind tour by a guide who said he worked for the temple which left me none the wiser about the place and without a chance to pause for thought. Perhaps without the guide I would have had a better experience of the place but it is a 'working' temple, not a tourist attraction.

title: UNIQUE TEMPLE
review: Supposedly the only temple of its kind dedicated to Brahma. It is a must see if you are in Ajmer / Pushkar. Like most Hindu temples it is not the ultimate in cleanliness, but the trip is worth it if you go around the complete complex. Do have a look at the niche dedicated to Kuber (the banker of the Gods). We were fortunate to have a quiet and detailed darshan. Unique.

title: Have a look at it..
review: Not the best temple I have visited in India but worth a look as Pushkar is not full of activities. Get someone to tour you there against 100inr not more.

title: Creator and Creation
review: This is a temple that commemorates the creative aspects of religion and is the only temple to Lord Brahma in the world. The simple prasad, the many small temples and the auspicious tilak makes our experience unforgettable.

title: one only mandir for Brahma , so must visit once
review: you can take holy dip near temple if you want or just visit lake and forward to temple

title: Strange
review: Quite strange to understand that we have only one such temple in the world (Brahma's Temple)

title: Quick darshan almost every time
review: I have visited the Brahma temple a few times and almost always had quick darshan unlike many other temples, despite a steam of pilgrims. The eateries and shops in Pushkar are good for a range of curios and puja material. The lake, for all its importance is not clean and the priests fleece you.

title: nice temple
review: beware of the brahmin pandits , who after doing some sort of pooja's try to take some money from you at the ghats.

title: Crowned A Only Temple in world
review: must must visit temple for each n one........

title: Maybe better with a guide
review: It was somehow fascinating to walk around in the temple, and I will recommend you to give it a visit even though its not any spectacular experience. It's central, free and you probably wont spend too much time here. Remember to bring pants and something to cover your shoulders if you are a girl. Also prepare to leave your shoes in a locker outside the temple entrance.

title: Serene
review: The calm that you feel after visiting the temple is unparalleled. Don't encourage the touts and simply walk-in and visit the temple and feel blessed

title: Nice temple
review: This temple has more significance as it claims to be the only Brahma temple in the world. I would suggest visit the place with a guide and also be aware of the pundits. It is not mandatory to perform any puja at this place. Just visit like you would any holy place and feel blessed :-)

title: Peaceful
review: Clean, well maintained, very pious. the only temple of Brahma, worldwide. be careful of your prasad etc, there are monkeys on the prowl inside the temple complex. the temple per se is not very big but there were no queues for darshan.

title: Place full of fun and scammers too.
review: The temple is very beautiful and old. The architecture is amazing.

title: experiencing Hinduism fully
review: i believe that noise and crowd you will find at Brahma's Temple are the important part of experiencing this place. Temple is full of people all the time because it's a pilgrims' destination. just find a spot on the side and look at the architecture and enjoy the flow of people.

title: Important Hindu Temple
review: This place is worth a visit, as it is the only place where the principal Deity is the god Brahma.  Ancient temple with simple marble construction.  No photos and no shoes inside the temple

title: Spiritual place
review: Only brahma temple in the world. Temple is beautiful and reasonably well maintained. No lengthy queues for darshan.  The worst part as is the norm in any pilgrim center are the whole lot of people to misguide you. There are lot of monkeys also so have to be careful for your Prasad and other belongings.

title: Must visit!
review: It is said that there is only one Brahma ji mandir in the world and it is in Pushkar. It is beautiful. There is just one suggestion, that you must hire a guide as he will tell you about the history of the temple and the charges are also very less. They also ask you to perform a small puja ceremony at the pond which is optional.

title: Spiritual Ambience
review: Heard that there is only one Brahma Mandir and that is in Pushkar. Made sure to visit this while going to Jodhpur from Jaipur. The temple premises is relatively clean. Photography is prohibited. "Darshan" is systematic. Sat in the premises for some time, The temple door remains closed from 1:30 to 3:00 pm. Overall, nice experience.

title: pious
review: It is quite crowded but just that it is the only temple of brahma in the world, it is worth visiting

title: A must see!
review: The Bramha temple is very beautiful and since it is one of the rare temples dedicated to Bramha, a must see while you're in Pushkar

title: Full of touts - needs to be cleaned up by authorities!
review: We really wanted to go in here, but the minute we got close there were so many touts trying to get money out of us and do the flower scam on us. There were fake Holi men asking us for donations and cursing us when refused. We felt pretty uncomfortable on the approach. When we finally got to the temple entrance we were told no bags and no cameras and shoes off. Shoes off was fine, but there was no way we were going to leave our bags with passports, valuables etc and expensive camera equipment in the lockers which shop keepers and flower pushers control. So unfortunately we did not get to go in to see this magical place. Too big a risk for us and definitely the most uncomfortable we have felt in the entirety of Asia. It's a real shame because the dodgyness around this sight significantly diminishes the attraction of Pushkar.

title: Lord of creation-lord Brahma
review: Brahma Temple-the only temple of lord Brahma in the world

title: The only one
review: Well the only temple of brahma in the world is located in the center of Pushkar city, if you travelling to pushkar then its a must see option.

title: Worth a visit in Pushkar but don't be conned
review: It is worth visiting this temple if you are in Pushkar, but be aware that it is FREE to enter. You cannot, however, take bags etc., so if there are at least two of you, do as we did, have one visit while the other waits with the stuff.  Also, you don't have to pay for minding the shoes, I watched the Indians...they left their shoes on the left side in a small alley in some cubbyholes...then retrieved them for nothing.  That is what we did to avoid the hassle of the shoe bargainers!  Anyway, once inside, it is quite interesting, but a quick visit.  Too bad you have all the hassle outside the temple with people trying to be your guide, asking for money, etc.

title: Nice to see but not a must
review: Nice to see but not a must. I was not happy with the behaviour of priests(of so called priests, don't know) They are kind of bargaining with me to donate.

title: Good to see, but nothing special
review: Since Pushkar is a small town and this is one of the main attractions, we went there with our guide. Left shoes and bags in lockers (nothing got stolen). Gave some flowers for the gods etc. Decided to do the ceremony which our guide told us about. The donation was a must, but a "secret one" and we could give as much as we wanted afterwards. Was not allowed to be together in our group nor talk to eachother how much we were donating, that made the "high priests" angry. minimum was 1000 rupies, but they wanted atleast 3000 rupies, for good luck and good karma. We did it for good fun, but being forced and feeling obliged to do so ruined the whole experience. The "priest" basically made us swear how much money we "wanted" to give. Not pleasant. Don't do this, that would keep them going, that is definitely not religion.

title: Pushkar has so much more to offer than simply Brahma Ji's Temple !!!
review: Pushkar is famous as the only place in the world where lord Brahma gets worshiped,but even in this temple he is not offered puja it seems.Lord Brahma gets puja only in Pushkar Lake.so people come to Pushkar mainly for this temple,but tell you the town or u can say the village Pushkar is really one of a kind,its soo beautiful and peaceful.everyone should at least come once to Pushkar and spend some quality time here,not as a day trip.because if you wish to see th tepmle and pushkar lake only ,the whole trip might take 3-4 hours at max.but to enjoy Pushkar you need to stay back and get indulged in the Nature's beauty and the Spirituality of the holi city.Good luck .have a dream time !!!

title: its the only one
review: As it's the only Brama temple and in the centre of town you might as well have a look. it's nothing special though

title: good place
review: The only brahma temple in the world is in Pushkar. Everyone visiting Pushkar must visit Brahma temple for its beauty and religious belief. It is close to the Pushkar lake.

title: Since it is the only one...
review: Pushkar is known across the world for the Brahma temple, the lake and the fair. Scores of foreigners visit the city annually to experience all the three, and I suspect a fair dose of drugs. I experienced the temple and lake. The Brahma temple is considered to be the only one in the world dedicated to the Creator from the Trinity-Lord Brahma. Why is it so? It is due to the curse given by Brahma’s wife to Him. She cursed Him that He would not be worshipped anywhere in the world, except for Pushkar.

title: "Lord Brahma..."
review: i visited  bhrma temple along with my family, it is very nice structure and peaceful atmosphere, it is the only temple in this whole world.........

title: India's only brahma temple !!
review: I and my friend visit to temple around 1335 Hrs time but temple was closed til 1530 Hrs. Temple is too old & simple but they don't allow you with your bag's or camera.

title: Emotional moments by the lake
review: We were approached by an older man who claimed to be a brahman priest (we preferred to take his word for it) and he performed a touching ritual by the lake. It was a very nice experience. Also, if you can look past the dirtyness of the surroundings, walking barefoot along the ghats was a nice experience.

title: A major landmark and a very sacred place for Hindu pilgrims.
review: Brahma Temple is situated at the very end of main market street and is one of the major centers for Hindu pilgrims.Its architechture is amazing and there is a stairs leading up to it.I have never entered the grounds out of respect for the pilgrims and most of you will be happy to take some photos and admire from outside.

title: Don't Bother Going
review: Visited as part of a recent tour of Rhajasthan. Was the worst place we visited. Filthy, crowded, full of people hassling you for money. Avoid any so called holy men at the lake - some people we were travelling with joined someone who offered them a blessing then demanded money.  If you don't have to go, then don't bother.

title: The Only Brahma Temple In The World
review: Well maintained, neat and decently organised is what makes visiting this temple a good experience. The Pandits in the temple too are friendly and give a little info about the place if the crowds are less.

title: The only Brahma's Temple in India
review: The way to the temple made us walk all the main markets of the Pushkar town. The markets offer many things to shop for. Temple is dedicated to Lord Bhrhma ji.

title: Wow amazaing
review: What a place, so serine and quiet. Kept up nicely. Nice and peacefull place to visit. It was crowded. People pushing so did not fully enjoy visiting the temple was rushed.

title: Pluses and minuses here
