review: While in fact this is not the only Brahma temple in India it is certainly the most widely known and significant. Also, it is open to non-Hindus. These two things make visiting it if you are in Pushkar pretty much mandatory; so go.

title: The Only temple of 'Creator'
review: The only Brahma temple on the planet. However, there are no prayers being offered there. Good place, very close to Pushkar lake. Worth a visit.

title: Must visit at least once
review: I like the very easy going feeling of the temple and simple but sweet feel of the priests. I did not like the pushing mood of the shoe stall people forcing them selves.

title: Nice and calm place
review: Market place is very crowded, we visited market after visiting the "brahma Temple" which was clean and pious. Overall a good place and worth a visit.

title: “1 and Only Brahma's temple in the world!”
review: The only brahma temple in the world is in Pushkar. Everyone visiting Pushkar must visit Brahma temple for its beauty and religious belief. It is close to the Pushkar lake. Nov / Dec their is mela must c that things. 6-7 time I visit here in that 2 time I c mela camel race....

title: Beautiful temple
review: The only brahma temple in the world is in Pushkar. Everyone visiting Pushkar must visit Brahma temple for its beauty and religious belief. It is close to the Pushkar lake.

title: only one brahma temple in world
review: People told me that this is the only Temple of brahma in the world.

title: Must visit in Pushkar...Do Not Miss this!
review: As hindu god lord brahma's temple is the only temple in the world which is in pushkar, which makes this sight is must visit in pushkar even if you are from any cast, religion or from any country.

title: BHRMA TEMPLE IN PUSHKAR
review: It is the only one temple in this world .it spread in large area of pushkar  it very nice to see .and there are many attractive shops to bye small things

title: Only temple dedicated to Lord Brahma
review: We were extremely excited to see this temple as one of our friends is a Hindu and prays to Lord Brahma. However our experience of the temple itself was not great. There was rude temple staff at the entrance and when we got inside, although it was spiritually impressive, it wasn't physically that impressive compared to other temples we'd seen in India. We did one quick walk around and left.

title: Simple but nice
review: This temple is very simple, with nice structure and peaceful atmosphere. They don’t allow bags or cameras in however there are lockers provided outside to store your belongings.

title: Pushkar Brahma temple
review: Don't go to this  temple for the architecture, it is  not very beautiful and quite kitschy . But do go for the ambiance, to see all the devotees and their respect for this very important Hindu god who has so few places where he is worshiped (this temple is said to be the only one in India dedicated to Brahma).

title: Beware the scam
review: The temple was interesting but guides tell you they work for the temple and are there to show you. Then they take you to the lake to throw in the flowers you have been given and then to say a very long prayer. Then they ask for $ to feed the poor except it is a scam and the money is for them. One guide was harassing me. I asked our driver to tell him to leave and then he threatened to punch him. You get a receipt when you give money ad Michael did but it is a total scam.

title: devotion values.
review: This is the only in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma. This has sentimental values  to Hindus. A lot of foreign tourists visiting this place and commenting about being misguided and forced to give donations. This temple don't have any architectural values or antiques idols,visuals. So the y should not go to see the temple or follow the pandits/guides for offering prayers. I you feel to offer prayers or  charity donation you may do. no one in this world can force you to all this. Do what you heart says or otherwise simply say namastey.

title: Brahma ji
review: Went to Brahma temple recently.There are big steps leading to this temple.We reached here in evening whilst Aarti was taking place. There are various galleries of other deities too.This place is unique as there's no other place where Brahma ji is worshipped.

title: One of the Few Temple Dedicated to Lord Brahma
review: One of the few temple dedicated to lord Brahma, however the charges for offering at the stall is too much. Don`t take any thing for offering as it is not required. You can visit the temple and donate for upkeep and maintenance of temple

title: very nice and unique!
review: Well, considering there is only ONE Brahma temple in all of India, this is pretty neat. Only thing is beware of all the people asking for money left and right.

title: One and Only Brahma's temple in the world!
review: This place is no doubtly unique as there is only one temple of Brahma ji in the world but beware of guides who just charge 20 bucks but will take you to pandits who pull thousands of money from pocket that will shared between pandits and guide.. This is done on the name of temple.... don't sit on my puja if they ask you to do... this is a trap to take your money out...

title: Historical and rare temple
review: The temple is one of the few dedicated to Brahma. Depending on the time and day, it gets full of Hindu pilgrims from far and wide and its atmosphere is full of reverence and mysticism. There are many in its doorsteps that charge for storing your shoes because they are not allowed in the temple. Patience and respect are expected in such holy ground.

title: Brahma's only temple in the world according to Hindu mythology
review: We went there in the morning around 9. We bought prasad from the shop outside, took off our shoes and went to the temple. The temple was quite empty. Saw Brahma's idol, took parikrama and came out. The visit was short and sweet.

title: Review of Brahma's temple
review: I with my family members visited Lord Brahma Temple Pushkar on 7/10/2013. This is the only one temple of Lord Brahma in India. There is no locker facility near Brahma Temple and you have to keep your valuables on the mercy of shopkeepers nearby selling Prasad. You can visit this place within 10-15 minitues.

title: Religious Place
review: The only Brahma temple on Earth... Close to Ajmer Sharif Dargah... Say about 30-45 mins to reach....

title: One of the very few Brahma temple
review: Pushkar has one of the very few Brahma temples in the world. The temple is not a big one, but very special to all the Hindus around the world. The temple is believed to be build around 2000 years back.

title: Watch out when going to the lake
review: It's a nice temple to visit, nevertheless be careful when going down to the lake.  Before you know it, fake looking holy men are chanting with you and trying to get 3000 Rupee's out of you, they promise you happiness and say it's to feed those living at the lake.  I was willing to give 500 Rupee's but this wasn't enough for him so he became very rude and stupid.  This was very annoying as it could have been a nicer experience.

title: one of a kind
review: the temple is well built the place has its own spiritual significance if you re in pushkar then you must visit this place

title: Worth a quick visit
review: A nice place to see if you are in Pushkar - but not worth a special trip.

title: One and Only Brahma Temple
review: This is the only remaining Brahma temple in the world and is worth a short visit.

title: Nothing spectacular
review: Not much to see there, but a lot of people. Probably very good for people, who are more into or believing in hinduism.

title: Religious and Historic Value
review: The hindu purohits will advise not to offer prayers at the temple because they catch hold of the pilgrims on the ghat of the Pushkar and fleece all possible money, in the name of all the dead ancestors and their wish for peace, they carry. Given the age of the temple and known to be the only Brahma temple in India the place of Creator holds much value in the minds and definitely we stoop to offer our prayers. A wonderful place to be. Pour your heart to God when you are there. The silver turtle in front of the temple is quite interesting.

title: Worth a quick visit because of its unique significance
review: At best, it is worth having a quick look as it is the only Brahma Temple. I found the temple not well maintained and a bit unkempt. The original walls of the temple are not well preserved and has lost its original design.

title: A little rough round the edges
review: Loved this temple.  Clearly very much in use and primarily for worship.  It is small, and tip is to follow the crowd as there are some narrow areas.  Once I had walked around, I sat on one side, watching people come and go and was fortunate enough to have a wonderful experience with some girls from a school group who were visiting as they shyly came over to say hello.  No camera's or bags allowed.

title: Only one temple in the world
review: Brahma Ji only temple in the world.

title: Beware of Guides
review: If you don't want to be shown around then politely decline when someone starts showing you the ropes. I had a guy show me around told me it was his SEVA, volunteer work for the temple and then asked me for money thereafter, I didn't give him enough so he told me to give him 100 rupees. I also got shouted at by one of the shrine attendants to offer money at the small shrine below ground. I felt offended as it is my choice as to whether I want to give or not. He then said..."as you like, as you like." but it was a little too late. I gave money but reluctantly. I feel like the religious message has been lost somewhere along the way. If money is the issue, keep it kosher and charge an entrance fee.

title: Interesting and unique temple
review: Only one other Brahma temple in India (according to our guide) so this is well worth going to see.     Just a shame there was so much confectionary scattered around, attracting hordes of wasps.

title: God is Here!
review: A thousand years old Temple of  Lord Brahma only One in World. As Hindu Mythalogy Lord Brahma Create the Universe and known as Lord of Pushar. All Rules and Process follws by Priest to Worship Lord Brahma and Old Walls and small Streets inside Temple say's History itself**

title: Nice but very small Temple
review: Only temple of GOD Brahma in India. There is holy lake near to Temple and there is thousand of Pigeon around the lake.

title: Human simplicity
review: This temple is one of the rare examples of how simple and humble the human race can be. When visiting it you must enjoy and aprecciate all that spirit.

title: Ok, but not the best place
review: It's a nice temple, but it's nearly impossible to visit it without a "guide" who does some ceremony with you... For a little tip of course...

title: Nice to visit but nothing spectacular
review: Firstly, outside of the temple I was hassled by guys trying to sell various things and escort me through to the temple -- never a great start.  Next, I was hassled inside of the temple (not affiliated with the temple) again by someone trying to escort me around the temple.  After having a not-so-peaceful stroll around, it was apparent that this temple is no different from any others.  The hassling is unfortunate and perhaps visitors experiences would be improved if the touts were handled better.

title: Don't believe the hype
review: Look at the pictures on tripadvisor and you have pretty much seen the whole thing. It's crowded and filthy and like most of the other sites in the holy city of Puskar you are relentlessly harassed to part with your money.

title: Temple of Lord Brahma only One in World
review: A thousand years old Temple of Lord Brahma only One in World. As Hindu Mythalogy Lord Brahma Create the Universe and known as Lord of Pushar. All Rules and Process follws by Priest to Worship Lord Brahma and Old Walls and small Streets inside Temple say's History itself**

title: Only for the devotees; not for the tourists.
review: We went to this temple as we were in Pushkar. Nothing to rave about from a tourist or architectural point of view and so unless you are a devotee, I would miss this out from your itinerary. I didn't like Pushkar at all and you will be harassed endlessly by vendors, saadhus or saints, guides and everyone else.

title: Brahmaji's temple !
review: It is an ancient temple and there are only two temples of Lord Brahamji's in India,one is here !There is a lake where you can take a holy dip and may proceed for darshana.

title: busy temple
review: I was told I had to leave bag and camera outside in locker to be paid for which is common practice but then on entering I saw many people taking photos so i wasn't too happy. Try taking your camera in pocket if you want photos. very busy temple and it is as interesting watching the people as it is seeing the carvings.

title: NO PUJA
review: An interesting temple where no Puja is performed. Even after knowing that no Prasad / Flowers are offered to the Diety, crazed devotees carry sweets and garlands anyways and watch the Priest chuck the flowers into a bin and distribute the sweets among other visitors. A very regular looking temple but special 'cause its the ONLY temple dedicated to Lord Brahma.

title: If you are the religious kind !
review: Hmm ! love the cow thats there outside ... least bothered around the crowd ..

title: one an only in world
review: The creator of the universe Lord Brahma has only one temple dedicated to him and that is in pushkar. Being the only Brahma temple in the world it attracts thousands of visitors everyday who want to bow down before the master creator.

title: Good Place To Visit
review: The only thing Good About this temple is that - Its The only Temple of Lord Bramha In the World. Liked Its Structure And Paacefull Atmosphere. Disliked Nothing.

title: Unique but nothing special
review: Only temple dedicated to the creator. Nothing opulent or noteworthy considering the significance it has. Not much crowd either. More or less just like any ill maintained temple in any locality.Don't be fooled by local self proclaimed guides and parking agents.No need to take any local guide.Wikipedia has more and better knowledge. Find the temple yourself using signboards. There is ample parking.The story is interesting but the temple is not.

title: nice place to visit
review: nice temple small but peaceful area

title: Visit only for religious importance
review: This temple is very simple, nothing extraordinary. The temple mainly derives its importance from being the only temple of Lord Brahma in the world; an interesting story behind this. The market around the temple is good for shopping for local articles.

title: Don't carry any bags
review: Please dont carry any bags or purses to the temple as none is allowed inside the temple. There are lockers - not recommended - so someone will have to wait outside with the bags.

title: Finally almost got conned after visiting here.
review: Do not accept anything from strangers and you should be alright.

title: Nothing special
review: It' s one more hindu temple butif you have time it a good idea to visit it.

title: The Only Temple of Four Headed Brahma on the earth
review: The Brahma Temple is located at Pushkar about 30 KM from Ajmer. Taxi will take about 30-40 minutes.

title: Average
review: Calm place. Best visited during evening.If possible one should stay at the adjoining hotel near lakeside.Though we missed it.

title: Very Nice........
review: This is best. One can only enjoy the calmness of Pushkar, if he/she come here and see the holy city.

title: Only for devotees
review: Only for the devoted...it needs to be maintained well...it is such a historic and religious place but need to be well kept.

title: Brahma Temple - Mainly for Hindus
review: Pushkar is of religious importance to Hindus.  As just a temple, it may not be of much liking to others.

title: For the People of Faith
review: The route to the temple from the lake is full of touristy shops selling camel skin bags, footwear & other stuff, garments for foreign tourists (the locals don't usually buy this stuff), junk jewelry, fake antique silver, umpteenth cafes & the like. Fascinating walk. But the best part is this chap selling "Marwari Tea" on a mobile stand just outside the temple.

title: Nice
review: The only brahma temple in the world. Nice. There were nobody to maintain the line for devotees, wish they have somebody.

title: OM BRAHMANAYA NAMAH
review: "ONE AND ONLY ONE TEMPLE OF LORD BRAHMA IN THE WORLD". This statement itself creates Curiosity and Anxiety in everybody's mind. It's a wonderful temple of Lord Brahma which really makes you energetic. After getting the darshan of Lord Brahma and visiting the Pushkar KUND, it feels quite peaceful and satisfying. However, one important thing I would like to share with everyone which is that if you are travelling for the first time, make sure you do not buy anything from the shops and also do not enter into any conversations with guides or priests near the temple. Priests and guides may mislead you with various things and information and then may ask for a high amount at the end. Please avoid this. There are many many foreigners travelling to the Lord Brahma temple throughout the year due to its significance. The Charges for Camel rides are too high at Puskar. Overall, it was a peaceful and satisfactory experience at Pushkar with my family.(Travelled:-29th January)

title: DIVINE
review: This temple dedicated to Lord Brahma,the Creator of the universe is a very ancient one and definitely worth a visit

title: Unique
review: It is the only Brahma temple in the world.

title: Not the only Brahma Temple in the world!
review: Many people believe this is the only temple in the word dedicated to Brahma, but that is not actually true as there others in India. Still it is quite rare to find one and this is the most famous so it does have a specific significance for Hindus.

title: Just go if you are there
review: I went to Pushkar for a cookingclass and my friend had a dance class. So while we were there we visited the Brahma temple. It was not as special as i expected it to be, but still i do not regret visiting it. I believe that you always have to see things for yourself. The only thing that i didnt like is that they say that you can pray by the water with a hindu priest, but they actually just try to get money from you. They say its money that is donated to poor people, but if it is actually that than why try and get bigger amounts out of people. The priests are rude and that ruins the whole experience a bit. Still, i do not regret going.

title: Too crowded with too many signs
review: the beauty here is severely diminished by the huge crowds (cut it down a bit and have someone keeping count) and the signs telling people what to do with what and not to take pictures. Guess what? Everyone Indian is taking pictures on their phone and if you take out your phone or camera you will get yelled at and glares. Not a fan of that, but can't hate on the temple for what other tourists did.

title: Great Place to visit but too crowdy
review: Nice place to visit but too crowdy. Just go if you are there in around. Nice scenic veiws while onward and return journeys.

title: we need to pull up our socks
review: the place is the same as it was 11 years ago that i saw.people have names engraved on tiles and just has the same dull look. govenment doing nothing for this beautifully located sole bramha temple in the world.

title: only brahma temple in the world
review: well maintained and beautiful temple this most significant place to visit pushkar before visit check the timings of the temple

title: Super nice people
review: We were guided around the temple by an apprentice priest you answered all our questions and explained everything to us.

title: the only one in the world
review: The creator of the universe Lord Brahma has only one temple dedicated to him and that is  in pushkar.  Being the only Brahma temple in the world it attracts thousands of visitors everyday who want to bow down before the master creator.

title: Beautiful but dirty and crowded
review: This place was beautiful but absolutely ruined by the crowds and lack of cleanliness.  You could not move without being pushed, and there were bees EVERYWHERE.  Be very careful if you go here.

title: Take care of the touts
review: The Brahma temple is really nice and it is impressive to see all indians celerbrating their belief and going through the ceremonies. What's not nice is the touts, picking western people out of the crowd to 'explain' them, what's going on in the temple and what to do where. they will drag you though the temple, give you floewers to donate them to the gods and than drag you to the lake (the ghats) where they are going to hand you over to a priest who is going to bless you, your family and then wants you speak after him: ' I am going to donate ...... thousand rp now ....'.... after that the priest likes to have a tip, than the tout who gives you any student story and at least the whole story doesn't feel holy but ambivalent.

title: One temple where one cannot do any Puja
review: The reason and Legend can be read elsewhere so I can skip the same. This temple receives a lot of donation (we could see a lot of donor details written on various stone pieces) from India and overseas (Spanish, French, Russian...all). The market near the temple would give the feeling of "Janpath at 20% price" and even better design (clothes) and we were told that most of what sells there is also made within Pushkar!!

title: very nice temple
review: the only temple of brahma, have been planning for some time to visit this place, finally got there. very nice and quiet place, but was thronged with tourists and lot of locals on Saturday

title: Nice but very crowded
review: The temple is just like any other temple with loads of shops lining up the way to the temple. Beware of the "Guides" (spread across the town), they would ask anything from Rs 20-200 for darshan, local site seeing, pooja with the pandits, they claim they would help you cut the line for temple and what not! No need of anything, you can easily manage without them.

title: very important temple but beware of priests and guides.
review: It's the only Brahma temple.so that way it's worth a visit.but beware of priests and guides.one guy stalked us right from the beginning and we had to use some very harsh language to get rid of him.speaking such language in the holy land of pushkar is really very sad.

title: The only Bramha temple in the world..
review: This should be a must visit.. being the only Bramha temple in the world, this place has significant importance..

title: Nice lively streets around
review: If you like street photography, the streets of pushkar would be a blessing. Loads activity and colors all around. While you're at pushkar, don't miss the amazing food at the dhaba. It is the first dhaba on the Gulley to the right just before the bramha temple

title: Only one in the world
review: Due to the simple fact that this is the sole Brahman temple in the world it is worth a visit. It is a moderately elegant temple, but doesnt have any breathe taking aspects apart from he potential heave of people.

title: nice but not a must
review: the guide said it is one of the very few brahma temples in the world. to me it looked like the average hindu temple except for the inscriptions in almost every tile in this temple which are in memory of beloved people

title: If you have come this far .. brave the crowds and seek the blessings
review: The temple no doubt is one of its kind. However, when it comes to the elaborate temples India which leave an impression, this is not one of them. Its bang in the central area near the ghats, you will be mobbed by the crowds who will just carry you till you get to it's steps. Now you need to find a place to leave your footwear, there is a small alley on the left near the entrance where you can leave them and a restroom as well.

title: Oozes with culture & sanctity
review: Lovely temple, though not greatly maintained. Quite clean - even the priest do not rush you through or beg for "dakshina" or money. Since there is no offerings - flowers or fluids - the place is dry and clean. The image of Brahma and the colour scheme of the temple mandap will remain in memory.

title: Small temple in which one cannot see much
review: This temple is famous as being the only (or at least one of very few) Brahma temple in India, and prilgrims come from afar to worhsip. The temple itself is very small and extremely crowded. Security is extrmely high - one has to be body searched before entry. No bags, purses, or camera of any kind. We were told to check our passports, money, cameras, and all possessions in a locker run by a convenience store near by. We were not comfortable doing that so my travel companion and I took turns going in, with the other person watching the stuff. Inside the temple itself it was almost impossible to see the deity since it was so crowded, and the deity is not large, dark featured and located in a dimly lit area. The crowd is made worst because the temple is so small. One struggles to get a glimpse at best. Overall it was a lot of trouble to see very little. Thus, although this is a place of religious significance, it is not a high value attraction for the traveling tourist.

title: The temple of Knowledge
review: A must visit to this temple as it is the ONLY tmple where the third God of Trinity is worshipped. Since he is the embodiment of knowledge, it does pay to visit here. There are some old smaller temples within the vicinity which are worth seeing. Also pls do not take Bags and Camera as it is not inside th vicinity.

title: only temple of Bramha ji
review: As said the only temple of Bramha , Pujari was asking for money to give away the prasadam packets. But at the time i visited this was quite free . it is closed at 12 or 1pm in the noon so try to visit this place early.

title: What's the real story!
review: One strange thing I noticed about the place is that vendors outside the temple encourage you to buy flowers etc to offer to Lord Bharhma. On the contrary, one of the priests at the Pushkar Lake suggested that we do not worship Lord Brahma. The story is a bit different on web! Conflicting point of views, maybe to make me spend some money at all the places. Anyway, do not fall for the trap! It will be nice to know the truth and not different versions of this place.

title: Must visit
review: This is the only temple of Brahma in the world. We recently visited this place. One should visit this temple if visiting pushkar.

title: Don't miss it!
review: The fact that this is the ONLY Brahma temple in the world is quite awesome itself! The relatively simple structure, the beautiful small temples within the ground (don't miss the underground Shiva temple) make it even more special. If you are in Ajmer / Pushkar, you just HAVE to go here!

title: Just awful.  Forced march in bare feet while men are spitting everywhere.   Take your shoes off?  Be prepare to pay.
review: No spirit, just money making and filth.   Spitting, crowds and pushing you around.    Someone turn over the money changing tables.

title: Not to MIss When in Pushkar
review: Primarily because this is the only Brahman temple in the World and located in perhaps the oldest city in India, and thus is sacred to Hindus, you should take the time to visit. Its actually not very big and won't take much of your time. You DO have to remove your shoes and yes - as in the previous review - you need to watch where you step! We managed to see the temple and experience it without being asked for money, but were given some rose petals and told that we have to offer something. Well, whatever. We got stuck for some money when we visited the lake. All-in-all, the temple and its history, as well as learning a bit about the Hindu religion, made the visit worthwhile.

title: the only one
review: the temple of brahma is only one in world so it is very em portent  for Hindu  i highly recommend all of you to go and visit one in your life it is good to make some good krma

title: No Bags
review: They wouldn't allow anyone in with any bags which means foreigners need to leave all of their money, their passport and all important belongings in their hotel room.  Mine never left my body so I did not get to go in.

title: Great!
review: It is the only Brahma temple anywhere- a must do when in Inida, can be a little crowded though, and be sure to spend enough time in front of the Brahma statue to be able to see all 4 of this faces- can be a bit challenging when there 500 people behind you dong the same thing!

title: Lord Brahma
review: It is of religious importance. Lord Brahma have only one temple in India because of some religious story. Camera etc is not allowed but locker is available for Rs 10/- . Slippers can be kept at the same place for free. The atmosphere is peaceful

title: Famous Tourist Spot
review: Pushkar is well known amongst veteran travellers.  Lots of tourist shops with exquisite products...I purchased Masala tea (from Assam) and was a real wonder. Hand-made garments/bags.. Do visit the only Brahma temple but  you cannot go in with bags! Next to the temple is a handicraft shop(government sponsored) where you can purchase quality paintings or statues.  On the way back, visit Ajmer and its wonderful palaces.

title: Pilgrims be crazy.
review: We arrived at the temple to a huge line in the afternoon and everyone RAN towards it once gates were opened. It's a crazy mess. Be prepared for the madness and you'll enjoy the spectacle, otherwise try to figure out when it's not busy and go then...

title: Well..
review: What can I say about a shrine, that too dedicated to Lord Brahma, the Creator in the Hindu Pantheon? Surely it will be blasphemy. But I am a Hindu myself, and  I guess I am as devout as the next person. Pushkar as a whole left a bad taste in my mouth.. and yes, I did do the mandatory worship (Puja) in this temple. Wish it was better maintained though. Wish the pilgrims and the real devout faced less problems from greedy priests, hollering shopkeepers, stray animals and filthy environs.

title: Crowds come here but wasnt special for us
review: This is THE thing to see in Pushkar apparently.  It didnt really stand out for us.  You also have to leave your bag outside so make sure you have someone - preferably you know - to mind it for you.

title: brahma s temple all ovar warld tha best temple
review: lake is good niet and cilien brahma temple is all ovar world the best temple i lick evry thing good good market and small twoan

title: Be realistic about what to expect
review: You have to leave your things in lockers when you go in, we didn't get hassled by guides as we were with our group leader. It is an unassuming temple, if you've come to India for elaborate temples it is not going to impress you but I quite liked it! It was quite dirty and the flower and sugar offerings were attracting alot of flies but I felt quite humbled to be allowed in, it felt real and all the inscribed marble gave it a sense of community. I found this to be the most realistic representation of the people that used it.

title: One of Very Few
review: Brahma's  temple in Pushkar, Rajasthan, India is a Hindu Temple. This 2000 years old temple of Lord Brahma-Lord of Creation; is the only existing temple dedicated to Lord Brahma in India. It is Constructed  on a high plinth with marble steps leading up to it. There is a beautifully carved silver turtle; and the marble floor around the silver turtle is embedded with hundreds of silver coins. Silver coins with the donor's names engraved on them are also inset in the walls of the temple.

title: Only temple of Brahma...
review: Visting a temple is always an good experience. Its one the holiest temples in Rajasthan. I would request you to be careful about the guys standing outside the temple trying to give you some flower or trying to tie a thread (moli in Hindi) on your wrist. You may end up paying them some good amount of money (they do it through emotional stories).

title: Historic temple
review: it is a historic temple with lake.

title: Rare temple
review: This temple is not  a must see ,since is in a dirty locality .My kids didn't enjoy pushkar.Still,since it is the only brahma temple i have seen,i found it interesting.Also has idols of kuber-god of wealth and narada.There is a savitri temple near by which is atop a hill, which we didn't have time to explore.Pushkar is a town with potential,needs to be developed.

title: The Only Temple for Lord Brahma
review: The best part of the temple is that apart from the idol of Brahma, one would be able to view idols of Kuber, Indra, etc generally not found so commonly. The worst part of the temple is that offerings (Prasads) are scattered all over the premises. Photos inside the temple are not allowed so remember to leave your cams at hotel or vehicles.

title: nice temple
review: Very different experience from we had before visiting holly places in Europe. We were lucky to see the monks living there and even more to get blessings. Had a wonderful time, local guide explained very professionaly the history of the temle and mythology, which was very interesting and useful.

title: Interesting
review: I didn't think I would like this site but I was wrong. I thought it was really interesting and spiritual. Our guide was knowledgable which made the difference. No shoes so be prepared to give them up before you enter.

title: Like Bethlehem for the Hindu faith.
review: Looking down from the heavens Brahmin released a lotus flower from his hand, it fluttered to earth and landed in this spot, a lake rose from the earth and the only temple dedicated to Brahmin was built....

title: Lives up to the legend
review: As per the story told by the guide, this temple was never to get popularity and probably that is what we get to see.

title: One of the very few temples dedicated to the Hindu Creator God - Brahma
review: Located in the Holy city of Pushkar in Ajmer district of Rajasthan,this place originally dates back to time immemorial. The new temple structure though dates back to the 14th century. Pushkar is about 15 Kms from Ajmer Railway Station. We rested at the Ajmer Railway Station Retiring room for the night (clean & comfortable for a night stay ) and traveled next day to Pushkar by road.

title: Rare Brahma temple
review: The temple is one of very few existing temples dedicated to the Hindu creator-god Brahma in India and remains the most prominent among them. The temple, which is set on high plinth, is approached through a number of marble steps leading to an entrance gate archway, decorated with pillared canopies.

title: One of the few temples to Brahma
review: In India you can find many temples, but very few to Brahma, who is the creator God. Beautiful and special

title: Magical experience
review: You have to get up early & go to the temple to feel the vibes here.  The atmosphere is beautiful at this time.

title: Interesting to see but dirty
review: You can see how Hindus experience their religion, we were a tourist atraction, because many of the pilgrims had never seen a Western tourist befor. The place is dirty with birds excreta, and you have to take off your shoes, so provide socks to wear.

title: Bad maintenance
review: Priests near the lake trying to loot you and horribly maintained temple

title: From the spiritual centre to beggars and cheaters
review: I always enjoyed Pushkar bevor. But it changed a lot. Some people on the right side close to the steps shouted at one Indien friend who was with us without any reason. They tried to deny him the entrance. They are only interested in making money by caring of your shoes. They are not caring about what is inside the temple. It’s a shame for Pushkar and for all the honest Brahmans that are living there.

title: Only great if you are Hindu
review: The sole reason to see this temple is the only image of Lord Brahma. Temple is small, nothing different from what you can see all over India, except for the one image.

title: Only Temple in the world
review: Brahma temple in Pushkar is the only temple of Brahma ji in the whole world. The temple closes from 1.30 in the afternoon to 3.00 o clock in the afternoon. Rest it is open can be visited any time. The temple is unique one should definitely visit.

title: Visit to Brahmaji Temple, Pushkar
review: Brahmaji Temple is one of its kind the whole world and located in Pushkar, being a famous landmark.

title: Coulda, woulda, shoulda...but......
review: Underwhelming to say the least!!

title: Enjoyed witnessing the true believers
review: Pushkar has lots of atmosphere including The Lake and this Temple. As has been mentioned by other reviewers its a famous temple and an important pilgrimage centre for Hindus. The lake is believed to be the spot where the lotus flower thrown by Brahma (Creator of the Hindu Trinity) landed.

title: Only temple in India and was amazing
review: It was an amazing experience. Although there was a lot of rush and a lot of people trying to take you for a ride by offering special benefits (BEWARE!!!) but the temple is serene and extremely peaceful. Must visit

title: Only one
review: This is the only Temple Dedicated to Brahma in India so it is a very important pilgrimage for many. At the entrance rigorous check and no big bags allowed. No she’s either. Short visit, not of great interest architectural.

title: Holy place
review: Number of times we have visited Brahma Temple and all the times we get fresh look after offering prayer . Such a nice place for worship.

title: Beware of cheaters
review: Beware of the cheaters surrounding this temple. Nice people who just want to show you around and talk a bit about the temple will end up asking for ridiculous amounts of money.

title: From the spiritual centre to beggars and cheaters
review: I always enjoyed Pushkar bevor. But it changed a lot. Some people on the right side close to the steps shouted at one Indien friend who was with us without any reason. They tried to deny him the entrance. They are only interested in making money by caring of your shoes. They are not caring about what is inside the temple. It’s a shame for Pushkar and for all the honest Brahmans that are living there.

review: The sole reason to see this temple is the only image of Lord Brahma. Temple is small, nothing different from what you can see all over India, except for the one image.

review: Underwhelming to say the least!!

review: Brahmaji Temple is one of its kind the whole world and located in Pushkar, being a famous landmark.

review: It was an amazing experience. Although there was a lot of rush and a lot of people trying to take you for a ride by offering special benefits (BEWARE!!!) but the temple is serene and extremely peaceful. Must visit

review: Beware of the cheaters surrounding this temple. Nice people who just want to show you around and talk a bit about the temple will end up asking for ridiculous amounts of money.

title: Coulda, woulda, shoulda...but......
review: Underwhelming to say the least!!

title: From the spiritual centre to beggars and cheaters
review: I always enjoyed Pushkar bevor. But it changed a lot. Some people on the right side close to the steps shouted at one Indien friend who was with us without any reason. They tried to deny him the entrance. They are only interested in making money by caring of your shoes. They are not caring about what is inside the temple. It’s a shame for Pushkar and for all the honest Brahmans that are living there.

review: It was an amazing experience. Although there was a lot of rush and a lot of people trying to take you for a ride by offering special benefits (BEWARE!!!) but the temple is serene and extremely peaceful. Must visit

title: Enjoyed witnessing the true believers
review: Pushkar has lots of atmosphere including The Lake and this Temple. As has been mentioned by other reviewers its a famous temple and an important pilgrimage centre for Hindus. The lake is believed to be the spot where the lotus flower thrown by Brahma (Creator of the Hindu Trinity) landed.

title: Only one
review: This is the only Temple Dedicated to Brahma in India so it is a very important pilgrimage for many. At the entrance rigorous check and no big bags allowed. No she’s either. Short visit, not of great interest architectural.

title: Holy place
review: Number of times we have visited Brahma Temple and all the times we get fresh look after offering prayer . Such a nice place for worship.

title: Beware of cheaters
review: Beware of the cheaters surrounding this temple. Nice people who just want to show you around and talk a bit about the temple will end up asking for ridiculous amounts of money.

title: From the spiritual centre to beggars and cheaters
review: I always enjoyed Pushkar bevor. But it changed a lot. Some people on the right side close to the steps shouted at one Indien friend who was with us without any reason. They tried to deny him the entrance. They are only interested in making money by caring of your shoes. They are not caring about what is inside the temple. It’s a shame for Pushkar and for all the honest Brahmans that are living there.

title: Coulda, woulda, shoulda...but......
review: Underwhelming to say the least!!

title: Visit to Brahmaji Temple, Pushkar
review: Brahmaji Temple is one of its kind the whole world and located in Pushkar, being a famous landmark.

title: Only temple in India and was amazing
review: It was an amazing experience. Although there was a lot of rush and a lot of people trying to take you for a ride by offering special benefits (BEWARE!!!) but the temple is serene and extremely peaceful. Must visit

title: Enjoyed witnessing the true believers
review: Pushkar has lots of atmosphere including The Lake and this Temple. As has been mentioned by other reviewers its a famous temple and an important pilgrimage centre for Hindus. The lake is believed to be the spot where the lotus flower thrown by Brahma (Creator of the Hindu Trinity) landed.

title: Only one
review: This is the only Temple Dedicated to Brahma in India so it is a very important pilgrimage for many. At the entrance rigorous check and no big bags allowed. No she’s either. Short visit, not of great interest architectural.

title: Beware of cheaters
review: Beware of the cheaters surrounding this temple. Nice people who just want to show you around and talk a bit about the temple will end up asking for ridiculous amounts of money.

title: Holy place
review: Number of times we have visited Brahma Temple and all the times we get fresh look after offering prayer . Such a nice place for worship.

title: From the spiritual centre to beggars and cheaters
review: I always enjoyed Pushkar bevor. But it changed a lot. Some people on the right side close to the steps shouted at one Indien friend who was with us without any reason. They tried to deny him the entrance. They are only interested in making money by caring of your shoes. They are not caring about what is inside the temple. It’s a shame for Pushkar and for all the honest Brahmans that are living there.

title: Only great if you are Hindu
review: The sole reason to see this temple is the only image of Lord Brahma. Temple is small, nothing different from what you can see all over India, except for the one image.

title: Coulda, woulda, shoulda...but......
review: Underwhelming to say the least!!
